d0L4noTVGkJ3KyZ5REHoLQ.text: Good service is hard to find these days. 6 minutes waiting to be seated, 20 minutes waiting for chips and salsa (26 min so far), 10 minutes to get water to put fire out in my mouth (36 min into dinner we finally got water), 20 minutes after that the waitress takes order of people sitting next to us who got there 20 minutes after us (56 min now). believe me or not, finally got food an hour and a half after being there. When we finally ate, the food was ok, little bland, but ok.

l5DpWlGH9uiQFZqDRetEog.text: Pink taco. Cannot say enough good things about this restaurant. Friendly staff, great Mexican style food, cool decor and atmosphere. Pink taco is a laid back restaurant (no dress code) showing sports on the flat screens all over. I was here at March madness and was quite loud but didn't bother me and was still able to have a conversation. I ordered the chicken burrito and it was delicious and arrived to me in a timely manner. I would come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa.
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken burrito.

vzkXbfAFBtfzR4dmlfJ4Rw.text: great service, amazing service, blandest mexican food I have ran into in recent memory.

9W-18Md2Yp3QUp7YQQNeUQ.text: 15 mins in line waiting for a table . . . . . 20 mins at said table- got chips n 3 salsas right away but no server ever showed his/her face for drinks, appetizers, entrees...  that's time I won't get back in vegas so thanks for that...

oVyNqYdIAF8XYWb40EcSBQ.text: One of my favorite little spots in Las Vegas at the hard rock hotel. I absolutely loved the Pink Tacos, very tasty and different. Also I was a huge fan of the Wet Burrito. Place has a great cheap Happy Hour as well which is a awesome thing to have in Vegas a Pink Taco a Beer and a shot of Tequila. When I go back to Vegas I will def be stopping in here.

5RpOCD3bHuRRDtqzm3sDyw.text: Ate here multiple times and each time the food was exquisite , the service was always great, everyone is super friendly and the drinks are amazing ! I ate the Pink Taco combination plate which was the BEST! In my opinion you get the best combination of their greatest food. The enchilada is my favorite by far and next on that list is Al Pastor Taco's. The Cherry Cherry Bomb Bomb drink is delicious. Think of it like a Roy Rogers with good liquor. 5/5 starts. Will be returning! If you visit Vegas this is a must stop place.

JD0B_dU4zxnOQTWZsc16SQ.text: Short story:  horrible service that took entirely too long..decent food  Long story: coworkers and I went here for a 'quick' meal before shooting the pac12 tournament.  The complimentary chips and dip were among the best I've ever had.  And out of all the Meximerican we've all had, that's saying something.  The service is hard to overlook in a dinning experience. And the experience here was among the worst.  Despite not being too busy our food took an hour to arrive.  Not cool man.  When it did get there it was on the colder side of lukewarm. If you're in the hard rock check out either places like culinary dropout.  Much better choice

EKIIh-76Uen0BWrNaeZPKQ.text: Hit lunch with friends staying at the Hard Rock and we found a good spot. Started with beer and margaritas which we highly recommend the Presidente. The carne  asada fries and loaded quesadilla hit the spot. Only reason I mark the review down is the service was a little slow and several burnt chips not to be confused for purple tortillas plagued our basket.

yWQhOh7iHeABUzNSHCs9AQ.text: Had the all you can eat brunch on Sunday and it was pretty good. The setting isn't very inviting and the staff is cold. Most of the tapas were good but they did not have any sort of creamer for their coffee which is odd considering they serve breakfast and they have the coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary fruit
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue corn pancakes
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly

h5RKjFCdM7uyTJFo7q1qyQ.text: Had a party of 25 people and it couldn't have turn out any better! The managers (Cindi, Ian and Angie) made it so easy for our crew and our servers, Bianca and Jaime were top notch and on point! The food, atmosphere and overall experience was more than I could hope for! Thank you to you all for making this a memorable night!!!!!!

DCUd43y6WMCUfWbR7Cl3rg.text: We showed up a little late but the hostess sat us at the bar.   The bartender told us we had to hurry and order because the employees want to go home.  He then served us our food to go!  We were staying at the hotel and the restaurant was full of other diners, we had to ask where he expected us to go to eat our food?  We went to another bar at the HardRock to eat, but couldn't get anyone to serve us, probably because they thought that we had imported our own  mexican food from a food truck or something.  The food was ok, the service was terrible.

3Ebs64tcCSW6e3RaFE-5Og.text: Great atmosphere! The tortillas are fresh but extremely greasy. The Guac was average.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink Taco
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak

Bmn4qB1S8d0pK_9CXFI-aQ.text: This used to be one of my favorite mexican restaurants in Vegas. And I'm not coming back for a long time.  My last experience was baaad. Not only the food was less than good, the service was horrible.  The guacamole tasted ok, the ceviche was fishy and too sour. We ordered 2 margaritas and a mojito. One of the margaritas wasn't good so my friend returned it. The waitress was slow and never around. We asked her for more chips and she just literally dropped the new basket into the old empty one, also, nobody was clearing the table from dirty plates, when the food runner came to drop our entrees he left me holding the dirty plates! He looked at me holding them with no more room on the table to put them down and just walked away!  At the end of our dinner we asked to talk to a manager, so this woman (manager) comes to our table not being very nice, we told her about everything that happened and she just said, "ok I'll talk to my staff, thank you". Well now you see why I'm probably never coming back. Management sucks! And food is not the same anymore, very disappointed.

JorLaL1ClT1wjqfBRWkFxQ.text: Came here with a group of my friends after going to rehab at the hard rock. We sat out side and there outdoor seating was nice. Great place for groups and the food was good. Big portions, great drinks  and gotta love chips and Salsa.

BLv0TUUOZqxEs-L7AqKk6g.text: Last weekend we stopped in to the Pink Taco for dinner pre show at The Joint in the Hard Rock Hotel. It location is within a two minute walk of the venue we were going to for the show.  Very convenient. The food was really yummy. I had the pink tacos and my vegan companion had the veggie tacos. We'll be back again next time we're in town.

4PfGOkE_viSZLazeKIcnkg.text: Ate here twice while staying at Hard Rock. Couldn't find a single menu item we didn't want to try. Everything was truly delicious. Decent pricing for Vegas. We'll definitely return on our next trip just for the tacos. Margaritas are solid, great cantina chips and tasty salsa. Good service.

qeU33zcIZv0rem9K5eHRVg.text: This is another case where 3.5 stars would be perfect. We went on a Monday for lunch and the service was out standing, the portions were huge and the food was good.   We had a chicken salad and carnitas along with the bacon wrapped jalapeno's between the three of us, all were very good!   The jalapeno's are not the bland filled jalapeno's that you get at a lot of places but had a bit of a kick to them and were perfectly cooked.  The carnitas was excellent with the meat nice and tender the fresh tortilla's were excellent.  The only knock I had was the lighting of the place was quite dim.  Thanks!

zVXxxZUCpyCvqSjSwg7qtg.text: I'm staying at the Hard Rock & didn't feel like leaving the hotel for dinner.  Came down with a group of  7.  The service was great.  Our waitress was on top of it.  She took care of everyone, got all of our food & drinks out quickly & made good suggestions.  Overall, the food & drinks were good.  The best thing we ate, hands down, was the bacon wrapped jalapenos.

ykXXGlIYdkcKbx0IKB7MuQ.text: We got there for lunch because our hotel stay let us choose one of the restaurants to eat at Pink Taco was the only one that was opened for lunch and it was packed in there, no surprise to me because I bet half the people their had the same deal as us!   Anyways when we finally got seat the food took forever to arrive and wasn't that great just average, the service was extremely slow though I understand it was busy but the waitstaff could have kept on checking back to make sure everything was going fine instead of disappearing until our bill arrived (which we had to wait and ask for).  Btw my boyfriend and I ordered fish tacos, guacamole, and salmon  My boyfriend mentioned the salmon was bland and overcooked while I though the tacos should have been better because the name is Pink Taco in the first place. Guac was the only highlight of our lunch.  Next time I'm in town or staying at the HRH again  I won't be eating here instead going to mr.lucky 24/7 located in the hotel for a better deal and time.

tJnrD03ATZSjAJFn5GhlGQ.text: Had dinner here with a coworker while staying at the Hard Rock Hotel.  Tried the frozen margarita during happy hour and the choose three tacos option.  Tacos were OK but nothing spectacular - found the pork one to be quite dry.  Drinks were OK and service was pleasant.  Definitely nothing to write home about.  Decent option if in Hard Rock.

2tQ2TM-dYEVzyxPDDgHcIw.text: MY FAVORITE!!!! The carnitas tacos are unreal! So tasty! The salsa is unreal. Guacamole is one of the best Ive ever had. And dont get me started on how delicious the pitchers of margaritas are. Amazing. I visit once a month to get my fix!

i0OQ_zqYGzmF-5KivZOYrw.text: Perfect place to replenish your sun-weary body after a day by the pool. We were provided immediately with chips and a trio of delicious salsas. The house margaritas were not too weak, nor too sweet, and one pitcher ($45) refilled four of us at least once before we ordered another round. Everything that arrived at our table was positively scrumptious- as evidenced by a table-full of plates scraped clean by the meal's end. Before our respective dinners were heartily demolished, they were: fish tacos, shrimp tacos, and veggie burritos adorned with perfectly soft avocado slices.   I would comment on the added delight of the world's best people-watching, especially as more and more patrons cycled in from Rehab throughout the evening, but this is not an honor exclusively reserved for Pink Taco. Acting surprised that any Vegas establishment contains unusual and noteworthy strangers is about as redundant as commenting on the number of Red Sox hats on Yawkey Way.   We also went here for breakfast and sat at the poolside patio to avoid the aggressively chilly AC. The service was a bit slow the second time, but we were still provided with a way to treat our bodies to generous helpings of tasty food before starting to drink in the daytime. Also, the parfait was completely on point.

FJtE4y2pTvslOoXVfnx2GA.text: So damn bland. The chips were nothing spectacular although i'll admit to the speed at which they were served. The atmosphere was loud and very fitting for the hard rock hotel but everything left me with buyers remorse. Drinks were $12 and for that price - yes, i expect mediocrity. The margaritas were weak. Weaker than weak. What a bummer - because you need to get a buzz going to at least tolerate the tacos which were too soggy to stomach (if they were able to make it into the mouth before falling apart into a pathetic pile of questionable ingredients). Flavors were unspectacular and as my father said "like an expensive version of Chilis." Save yourselves the frustration of a costly letdown.

Dg6-vwoP6dXy3zF83cpcxw.text: This place is MONEY! From the tacos to the home made tortilla chips and salsa this place is bad a$$. My wife and I went in on my birthday for lunch after cocktails and walking the strip. We could've ate chips and salsa all day. Had a great time.

N47d1VYIEZ-4Dps_7XHA2A.text: Place was empty on Friday afternoon at 2pm. I had the Burrito with carnitas. Lots of pork, but it was dry. Chipotle burritos are better. Wife had pink tacos and they were good, but she had to vut them up, impossible to pick  up with all the stuff in it. Service was mediocre. I downed my soda pretty quickly and was never offered a refill until we were leaving...my fault for being a camel, but we were sitting outside in the desert.

QG51HQymQsAPcxYY6f30ZA.text: So I go here every year for a convention and i have been to the pink taco three times now.  Wonderful food, they never dissapoint me.  Plus I love the name

TjMD7ljcGFjmd83FD8IMUA.text: Awesome-  order the pink tacos and enjoy.  Tons of food, awesome service, and a very cool vibe.  I wish there were more of these around I the country.  I will return every time I am in Vegas.

Erlkz1We9BrPmcPnmC8Esg.text: Unlimited chips and salsa and buy one get one free Margaritas during Happy Hour: that's why we go.  The food isn't spectacular, but their signature dishes are innovative and good, although a little pricey.  There are certain menu items you can't get anywhere else.    Try the Panuchos (Pink Tacos) which is made with chicken.   You have to order the Pink Taco Margarita on the rocks with salt.  The BEST!!  It's Jamaica based and you can't get it anywhere else.    Usually, we get too full on the drinks because it's buy one get one free and it has to be the same person, so expect to buy two drinks.  So we usually just get one plate and split.  For some odd reason, this Pink Taco is way better than the one in Hollywood.  And it's not because we're in Vegas and we're already having a good time, but the quality of the food and especially the drinks are better.  I know this because I've ordered the same drinks from this location and the one in Hollywood and Vegas wins!  The atmosphere here is fun and the patio is right by the pool.   This place is for lounging: eat, drink, converse and be merry without a sense of time.

JbbLcZX_Z1-YO8dOgLvHXg.text: The server was friendly, and that is where it ended. Assume everything has cilantro even if the menu doesn't list it. Dinner was awful, house made tortillas weren't even good- they were rubbery and oily. They knew I wasn't happy with my dinner and made no adjustments or efforts. $46 for a crappy dinner for two. On par with the rest of the Hard Rock property. We won't be back. Wish I could make the rating less than 1 star.

lTijHPGCS7cl_N_syJV9JQ.text: What a disappointment. My husband's a huge Mexican food fan so after going off strip for a poker tourney at the Hard Rock we stopped by the Pink Taco. The waitress was a nice lady, but the food was just awful. Horchata colada tasted likely a colada with cinnamon in it. The pork platter had the chewiest dry pork ever. Could not get out fast enough. Save your money, try another restaurant at the hard rock.

tODiCZ7X-D1pJ7_29zaKow.text: I really do not like the name so maybe that affected my opinion a little bit. I sat at the bar and the staff was great. I ordered the fries off of the Happy Hour menu and they really sucked. Not much to base my opinion on but really; do not put it on the menu unless you are going to do it well. The only thing that saved these so called fries was that I used the salsa to cover them. They were in no way shape or form crispy so the salsa did not make them soggy. The salsa was good.

q9FbvqrpaNjQ69JHeBiQWw.text: With all the hype of this place I thought it would be way better. I'll admit I do not eat Mexican food often but when I do it doesn't taste like this place.   My gf & I ordered two meals & two margaritas that came up to the total of $45!! REALLY   The margaritas were fruity & not strong at all/food was bland/atmosphere were four dudes drinking at the bar & two other tables with 40 yr olds at them not talking very much   The waitress/staff was cool & explained to me how to "comp" my bill since I was staying at HRH other than that my experience there was let's eat this overpriced food & get out of here to go get real drinks.  Food came fast & was hot but totally not worth the price   The chips/salsa were good & tasted really fresh they also gave you three types of salsa to go with it but the salsa wasn't too good either. Maybe it's me but I just don't get this place or the hype   Would I eat here again? NO  Would I drink here again? HECK NO

60KIkdNbcnPQl-s93KDZfA.text: Definitely a fan of this hip Mexican joint in the Hard Rock!!  Happy Hour is legit.  Get the Appetizer Sampler.  The fried ice cream is off-the-chain!!  Wait staff is always friendly and prompt with the food.

_5PF9sR0C-Ybxic-tiL5DQ.text: Average. The nachos were really good but the pork tamales were bland. Just okay. Drinks were overpriced and nothing special but that's typical on the strip.

WRGB2yN7k9bFc0Nq1UZy-w.text: would have given it five stars, but food came before our drinks!  food was delicious and plentiful. definitely would go there again if we stay at the Hard Rock - which we probably won't but that's another review

4-gGz0qC1WYYDo_wX2eBNQ.text: Food was good and price was reasonable.  Defiantly would go back and recommend to others.

Reay5tJzmjoHSoVDDopTYg.text: I ate here at the Pink Taco while hanging out at the Hard Rock Hotel with friends.  Met a couple of friends of mine and we had lunch.  Service was pretty good.  I had the pink taco with a corona. My friend picked up the tab, since I was visiting Las Vegas.  Thought that was pretty cool.  The pink taco was average. Should have gotten it spicer.  The salsa was pretty good, although it could have been better.  No so disappointing was the ambiance of the restaurant.

GZZngDZpu2AkHXlxE1hkng.text: As you can tell, I ate my way through Las Vegas last weekend. I'm lucky enough to have friends that are locals and can share some of their favorite places with me =)   I had dinner here this past Monday...started off the meal with a pitcher of Mango Margaritas (3 people had 2 glasses each). Then we ordered the Sampler platter - one order can easily feed 2 people. It was a great selection of the beef kabob, chicken skewer, tacitos, quesadillas and sweet corn tamales. And let's not forget the Mexican corn...holey moley, guacamole! This corn was OFF THE HOOK! I've never had Mexican corn before...grilled, with a slathering of Mexican cheese, butter and some other creamy concotion...wow...a little salty, but delicious all the same!   While waiting for our food...we snacked on homemade tortillas and a trio of salsas and gazed upon the funky decor of pimped out bicycles and funky art that gave the atmosphere a fun and comfortable vibe.  We finished off the meal with some flan...honestly...I've eaten MANY flans before and I always say that my mom's is better. This was the first time (Honest to God) that I said, it was nearly as good, if not the same, as my mom's recipe. That's telling you right there how authentic this was!   Kudos to Pink Taco!!!!  Another thoroughly enjoyable meal...thank you!!!

iaUYTYv4xZGgtkvPMcFGEg.text: Pricey but we got a $40 voucher from Hard Rock Hotel ... enough to get an appetizer plate, nachos and some fried fish dish, which we ordered for takeout for our drive back.  Your average Mexican food (with average Vegas prices).  Nothing spectacular.    They have $1 taco specials 11am-1pm and 9-11p but heard those were puny and not very good.

SWGYc9kNFfxkkydaU55IHg.text: Great food and great service. No draft beer, though. Seems odd. A large selection of tacos.

yUsMgHzUTee7PIO6-N7Iyg.text: We always go to the Hard Rock when we're in Las Vegas, because my husband just LOVES all the rock exhibits and displays.. so we are at the Pink Taco when another Yelper said they have vegan options.  The minute I said "vegan" my server immediately made helpful suggestions, and we ate WONDERFUL veggie fajitas, burritos, and fresh guacamole that the server suggested be served with cut veggies.. just delish.. and we will definitely go back.  NICE location, a little eclectic, nice patio and very accommodating.

YokLRLZ0vm9ueG0aMTeCMA.text: Great food. Great service. Carne asada tacos were amazing! And their micheladas were great as well!

IS3T5sFGbnwZ-H9bWNZx3g.text: Great find by my daughter. Real World Realty show filming  location , off the beaten path, wayyyy off actually. Terrific alfresco dining option. Food was solid. Definitely worth the the walk/ uber travels. Highly recommend!

csF2w0wHP5OMA4WjMFOahA.text: Tacos were great for lunch. Reasonable prices compared to other food options considering the higher quality here.  Also, shout out to the employee who found my credit card (which I left at the bar area by accident) and took it to the lost and found! Thanks so much.

-z3SpsxeqwYe5wszPRYHkg.text: I loved this place, when we got here it wasn't too busy, they give you complimentary chips and salsa. They have a full bar with the poker machines all around the bar. The place is pretty good size and they have outdoor seating but it's way too hot to sit outside today. Our waitress was very nice and let us know that the fried Ice Cream was enough to feed 4 people. Let me tell you this dessert was sooooo delicious a must try.   The tacos had a lot of flavor but I gotta admit the chicken was kind of dry. The tortillas were freshly made right when you enter the restaurant, that's what got me to order the tacos. This place is not expensive like most restaurants out here either. They sell pink taco shirts, shorts, tanks, shot glasses etc. I noticed too they have a 2 chair table that has a sign "worse table to sit at 10%off" lol its by the kitchen if you sit there you get 10% off your bill. Pretty cool. So if your in the area try it out...

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was to die for fried Ice Cream a must try..
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 taco plate $19 and a side of rice and beans it was hella good.
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa with a order of guacamole which was very good.

OMFvkL4rRjIrP6mYtVzw1A.text: I love coming to Pink Taco and having the choice to dine inside where it's trendy and hip or out on the gorgeous, poolside patio! The staff is always wonderful and food is incredible. Plus, it's fun to order the "kinky bitch" and "blue balls!"

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These were delicious! Next time trying the shrimp, too. The staff is always fun, friendly and professional!
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I didn&#39;t know I could like any taco as much as the &#34;Pink Tacos&#34; but the Gringo Tacos were incredible! Coming with an appetite for two!

cnnMPsHQ6a7qIXOlEvDHEQ.text: DO NOT GO TO PINK TACO! I filed a formal complaint on behalf of our group of 12 girls, 7 of which got sick with severe food poisoning, including vomiting and diarrhea. The waitress was very nice and gave us great service. Unfortunately, that is where the good service for the restaurant ended. No more than 3 hours later while we were at the Magic Mike show many of us started to feel very ill. Some of us had to leave the show early to go vomit.  The list of items that we ate that night and got sick from were as follows: Shrimp fajitas, gringo tacos, three orders of pink tacos, fish tacos, two orders of steak fajitas, carne asada plate and mushroom tacos. We originally called the restaurant to express our concern for future guests that night and warn the restaurant manager about the high chance of something being served that causes severe food poisoning. Instead of receiving any condolences or expressing concern, we were immediately barraged by questions of whether we could have been sick by other means (ie alcohol) and that the only way to make a confirmed diagnosis would be to go to the ER. We are all trained medical doctors and we explained to the woman the diagnosis procedure for food poisoning. She still did not offer any consideration for future guests and for our own unfortunate dining experience.   Then after filling out the formal complaint to the general manager of the Hard Rock Hotel and emailing multiple times the "Risk Manager" we heard no response for days. That is what is prompting this one-star review. Not only was the food not fit for human consumption, the managerial staff of the restaurant and hotel has been completely negligent and refusing to discuss with us any potential refund or apology! So again, there are many other food options in Las Vegas. Do your stomach a favor and CHOOSE SOMEWHERE ELSE!

VMt8c-tRp1lnjj9QLgz1KA.text: We had lunch here this weekend, overall a decent experience. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are delicious. The shrimp tacos are tasty and the fried ice cream is interesting! Nice place for a quick lunch- I'd suggest hitting this place if you're staying at Hard Rock, other wise don't waist your time.

xBeuMIvom1DJ2Tn6vDkYOQ.text: The pork/pineapple tacos are amazing! Our server was friendly and upbeat even though they were closing soon. Prompt service and hot food!

0we8wKaYGmhftmEJyVYESg.text: I use to come here for happy hour and loved it. But stopped by the other day for tacos and they were gross. The crispy shrimp were not crispy. They felt and tasted like they microwaved them. The tortillas were rubbery and cold. Where did their quality go?

Nm5OEIgAwppWym8ZtXoxHQ.text: This place was nothing very exciting or innovative. But it's Mexican food, and it's pretty hard to mess up Mexican food. The only thing that was pretty lack luster was the margaritas. We got a pitcher for $48 and let me tell you there is nowhere near enough alcohol for that price. Everything else tasted pretty great. My boyfriend and I shared the gringo tacos which were just traditional crunchy tacos with lettuce, cheese, tomato, and onion. And then we shared the fajitas which had all red peppers which I like since green peppers are normally served and they are pretty irritative on the stomach. Honestly this place is definitely 3 stars to me but the server was nice and attentive enough for how busy she was, so I'm giving it 4 stars instead. Food and drinks are a solid 3 though.

h0vJKx_YZW0avtF_RERTjg.text: Oh my gosh!!!! This food made it perfectly ok that the Hard Rock did not have a buffet. The service, the drinks, the food!!! Mmmmmmm

OMf5RgoVES8wEb7gvFiMmw.text: Best mexican food I've had in a long time they also have someone making fresh flour tortillas ... loved from the decor to the food.

AE5d9ziSD0yb4JheiEutKQ.text: Great spot right next to the pool at the Hard Rock Hotel.  I've been here many times, but haven't written a review yet.  The food is always good and the service is excellent.  This time I got the jalapeno popper appetizer.  Filled with cheese, wrapped in bacon, and fried.  Uh, yeah, you can't go wrong with that.  The jalapeno was not too spicy.  Chile Verde - EXCELLENT.  I would recommend getting this.

jG3lbunLpr9fABe2jl-0UA.text: Average tacos. Really cool ambience and loved their cheesy corn dip. Their tortilla soup is fantastic.

2reK5X-oGoS7qM2QNACi4Q.text: Came here for lunch on a weekday and loved everything about it! There was no wait and we were seated immediately. We chose to sit outside. I liked the decor and the murals on the walls. We were immediately brought chips and salsa. So delicious! Our server was pretty cool and gave us great service. They have some good lunch specials. If they don't give you a lunch menu, just ask for one. I had the lunch size pink tacos (so good) that came with rice and beans and the husband had a chicken bowl. We both had a house margarita to wash it down with. Excellent margaritas! Don't forget to order the Churros for desert- you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros!!!!
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mural on the patio wall

Aw5BT87yAQNJYnSX0eVBVQ.text: Me and my girlfriend went for dinner. It was about 80 degrees that day so we sat outside. Right by the pool had a nice view with great ambiance. We had the sangria, guacamole, and jalapeno poppers, and the corn queso. All of it was great!!! Will definitely come back

gC6GtkqQSnfQ8WdZAetBrw.text: The service was very slow and very poor customer service skills. We all went in as a group and they made it very difficult to split the checks and still tried to get us to pay other checks because there new guy did not understand what he was doing. Our waitress was very short with us and took a long time to get our food and rarely got checked on after the food arrived. The manager attempted to help us but was very rude even after we tried to be patient and get it all worked out. On vacation and heard great things but after our experience, I do not see what was so great about it.

WptLUPFbmI8DQpta7YJkKg.text: For years, Pink Taco has been one of my go-to happy hour spots, with cheap eats and two-for-one drinks. But when my brother came to town recently, my husband and I decided to splurge and hit the PT for dinner. (It helped that I had $100 comp to use!)  We started with a pitcher of sangria and an order of bacon-wrapped jalapenos. For our entrees, my husband had the carnitas; I had the chopped salad; and my brother had six street tacos (one each of several varieties). The pitcher was pricey at $48, but everything else was $1 off when we used my player's card.  I LOVE that chopped salad, a nice blend of lettuce, turkey, hominy, and pepitas. I always thought they used jicama as well, but when I read the menu more closely, I saw that it was apple. A weird choice, but tasty! My husband loved his carnitas as well. He asked for no cilantro, so they brought his big chunks of pork with onions, tomatoes, and guac on the side. This let him create his own soft tacos with delicious cilantro-free toppings. (There was a LOT of meat there, too, so he had a nice leftover meal.) My brother was not too impressed with his tacos, however. Didn't care for the tortillas (too thick) and was not a fan of the fillings (although he ate all of the fillings and left the tortillas behind).  The salsa, as usual, was pretty bland, and the sangria seemed a lot sweeter than in years past. But my husband and I both enjoyed our food. And the price was right! After using our $100 comp, we owed less than $2 (pre-tip)!  I will still return for happy hour, but it's nice to know that other items on the menu are just as tasty as the cheaper offerings. Just a little more expensive ...

ZJChZOo1c1ljLLLHyjoY6g.text: Yes. Had lunch here on a random Saturday. Not too busy but service was a little lackluster. Great food, okay service.

eHus5c00r_sP4Nl7VunKgw.text: While staying at the Hard Rock my husband and I decided to try Pink Taco for lunch one day during happy hour...We started out with the house margaritas and the complimentary chips and salsa provided for the table.  I loved that the tortilla chips were actually pink!!  We ordered steak nachos and guacamole for our meal...and  everything was really great. The service was quick and the atmosphere was enjoyable. Planning to go to Vegas soon and Pink Taco is definitely on my list of places to eat!

Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zonkey Fries

1lD44tHw96pkvJJunvOWCA.text: How can you possible mess up on a cheese quesadilla .. they did . The flour tortilla I had for my tacos tasted like nasty mission brand tortillas . I will say if it was not for the great margarita I would never ever ever consider coming  back here .. maybe ever ever ever

fnnUjFQ9erEQONLdsgav5Q.text: The Nachos are heaven! Cool atmosphere in the restaurant! The service was decent at best, when asked for extra tortillas for the fajitas they charged which I just found a little ridiculous. But all our meals were very yummy and I would definitely go back on the next trip.

Io3eRaBGToxSq8W6iBPkYg.text: This place is good, drinks and food are really good, staff is welcoming and on top of things. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, drinks are great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar, michelada&#39;s are great.

145_FtN-7Ee4LcBZFNltSQ.text: One of my favorite spots in Vegas. The atmosphere is hip and vibrant and the servers are always fun and friendly. My favorite is the corn fritters - they're a must. The guac is also great. Several friends enjoy the fish tacos and shrimp tacos.  They have recently changed the rice and we all agreed it's weird - very buttery white rice with peas. Odd for a Mexican restaurant. However, everything else was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tacos were great. Really weird buttery rice with Asian vegetables.
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla.

W9S83-METTbBYLngGmimAA.text: My bestie loves this place and I can't understand why at all. The service is bland, the food is bland, the atmosphere is bland. I was meeting a friend and got there a little early. The three hostesses at the stand were less than friendly, but they seated me right away. 10 minutes later a server finally comes, but she was nice. I ordered a Michelada, and it was GROSS.   My friend showed up so we ordered ceviche and fajitas. The ceviche tasted like the shrimp was already cooked and then mixed in with lime juice, which it's supposed to be cooked BY the lime juice, or something like that. It just didn't taste right. The fajitas were okay, but the tortillas became crispy as soon as they cooled down within a few minutes. I had one and was done.  I switched up my drink for a margarita, and that too didn't taste right. It was sickly sweet. I couldn't even finish my tiny margarita. The bill was almost $100. I'm glad my friend offered to pay or I would've felt extremely cheated and maybe would've given just 1 star.  Definitely NOT my cup of tea.

bhnpQa5WlIzm8nMHdf2a5A.text: Yeah.  So glad to update this review.  A longtime favorite for 13 years and then had some issues for a year or so.   Glad to report, they must have worked out the kinks and we are happy to be regular customers again.    The salad is to die for.  And our new fave is the steak entree.  The little chicken sandwich on happy hour are awesome and the bartenders make the best chambord margarita in town.

rAdcqiq5m5MSzHzUacpJsQ.text: This was my second time dining here and this was the worst. Had a chicken tostada before the concert and about 2:00 am I was throwing up and had diarrhea. I contacted both the hotel and restaurant and still have had no response? So if your going there beware

blhCsZPRlZ0wSr2dKeAnfA.text: Extreme tourist trap. Watered-down food/drinks for ridiculously pumped-up prices.   My GF and I shared a pitcher of Cadillac Margaritas ($57) which contained 6 of their margarita glasses worth and neither of us had even a tiny buzz when we were finished with it. There seemed to be no Grand Mariner in the Cadillac mix either.   We ordered their Queso Fundido ($10) which should have been just melted cheese and chorizo (as the menu said) but the dish they served us was mostly some gross enchilada sauce they poured into the dish to dilute the cheese with. Yuk.  Pink Taco Las Vegas might be fooling the tourists from around the world who are unfamiliar with Mexican food, but for people from the US who are Mexican food fans like us this place ain't nothin' but a rip-off.

TeX0eOIeZb_wpo86rCedXQ.text: Holy heck this place is amazing. I love their chicken tacos they're by far my favorite. Great customer service and all round awesome experience.

7IRRrkDZeS7ma4yCvhXXmQ.text: With all the places in Vegas to chose from, this place definitely needs to kick it up a notch.  The atmosphere and ambiance are great...so if you were looking for a place to grab a basket of chips and some drinks at the bar, I'd be down.  But the food was just OK.  It could be that I am spoiled when it comes to awesome Mexican food seeing that I am from So Cal where authentic and awesome Mexican joints are on every corner.    Since it was just "OK" for me, I really don't have much to say about the place.  Don't get me wrong...the food was edible and tasted decent, it just wasn't memorable or anything to write home about.  If you are in the casino and hungry, give it a try.  Everyones taste buds are a little different anyway.

pTy5FN1NEe9tpgyr9XHgVw.text: Decent food at Hard Rock Hotel. Margaritas are yummy. Tacos are good and portions are good though prices are high for Tex-Mex.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tacos

7inN7pzytlTH5edmwCQVrQ.text: The pink tacos were yummy, but the chicken was a little dry. The drinks were strong & tasty. Our awesome waitress recommended the kinky bitch- which was delicious. They have a variety of tequila flight options and a full bar. Seating inside and outside, with misters outside to keep you nice and cool.

4A1YfzYJlbUCXTMfUArBSQ.text: I just didn't see what the hype was about. The meat wasn't seasoned and my drink taste like juice. The atmosphere was boring and I just didn't get the umph of it

Kx9YuNB-mc6EYeLF2Tom6A.text: I have heard raves but my dining experience here was honestly forgettable. The ceviche appetizer was just ok, and the chicken torta that we split was decent.   We went with the $21 endless margarita deal because it seemed like the most cost effective way to enjoy margaritas. The first one was perfect, but the 2nd was way watered down. I'll definitely  do a signature  margarita  in the future. Bonus points for being located in the  Hard Rock and the cute decor/ fun atmosphere.  Minus points for the  sometimes non existent service.

EbCgDu3xypP5JEn2Lc7yig.text: Checked in with a group that had a reservation. When we arrived they were not prepared for us and we still waited for 5 minutes to be seated, even though they were not busy and most of the tables were empty.   Never received 2nd cocktail that was ordered. They couldn't break up the tickets for our group (less than 12 people) and that created an entire new set of issues when trying to check out. Couldn't see our own tickets to check for accuracy. Basically I ended up doubling the tip without knowing it because I NEVER SAW the actual ticket and didn't realize the gratuity was already added on.   Waitress asked if we wanted both rice and beans and everyone ordered them, however it did NOT come with the tacos so it was actually an extra charge. I have never been to a place where rice and or beans did not come with a taco platter so I was a bit disappointed that we would be offered something that it typical comes with and then charged for it. (And no, I don't know how much they were as I couldn't see my ticket at the register)   The chips that were provided and the chips in the Nachos were the stalest chips I have ever had a restaurant in my entire life. There is honestly NO excuse for stale chips. None. I had fried shrimp tacos and they were OK. Nothing special or memorable and the tamale was the same way.   Side note about the restroom and this does not effect the review (in the hotel - but right by the restaurant). Ladies...beware. There is a reflection on the floor and you can see any neighboring person in their stall via the the reflection on the floor. It was a little shocking to say the least.....   All in all, a total disappointment.

lb1EzErrudqYoQUbbxsFwg.text: Street Tacos, I had Crispy Shrimp ......fire!! Mexican Cuisine.... not at the top of my dine in or out list, yet this joint is pretty cool...staff & decor!

EKLz28ktCkC4Vm2PMoVb8g.text: Food was served room temp. Wait staff seemed rushed and suspect the food was delayed waiting to be picked up. Flour tortillas were so thin you couldn't use tthem for making fajitas. Place was so noisy conversation was impossible.  Had the food been warn it would have been just mediocre.  Will never return.

In_U1OvZO1BSckXhSXSO3g.text: Just got home from here an hour ago, took me time to digest the food until i got a chance to write this review. Me and my lover both choose the oysters, we were both in the mood for some fish. So to start off the taste was alright, they however were cooked right. The flavor was okay, i did have some lemons on the side just for some extra taste and they went somewhat good with it. Boyfriend said the same thing about this dish. Overall place is alright looking wise and the vibe, its OK! giving this place 3 stars, and i think its plenty.  Btw service wasent the best mainly why 3 stars is what I'm giving.

OSU7LA9iUyFGXmYPOck_PA.text: This place is awesome. The service was really nice & quick. The zonkey fries are awesome, try them! You won't regret it. The food was really good, we had zonkey fries, tamales, a blue balls margarita & a pineapple vanilla margarita. TRY THIS PLACE!!! IT'S SO GOOD!! XD

66fd_-zq9hS-auC_kruZZA.text: After checking into the Hard Rock, and making our way to the pool area.  We thought, lets grab a bite, so we made our way back into the Pink Taco.  We waited to get sat in the outside area connected to the pool,  After about 10 minutes we were sat (there were several tables open out there, and I hate when you have to wait to be seated when there are plenty of open tables.)  We decided on the appetizer platter for the two of us, and it had a couple of things to snack on, to hold us over for dinner.  Sweet corn tamales, cheese quesadillas, chicken skewers, carne asada skewers, taquitos and guacamole.    The guacamole was a very small portion.  The cheese quesadillas had NO FLAVOR.  The chicken skewers were over seasoned and dry.  The sweet corn tamales were good, and something I really enjoyed.  The taquitos were ok.  Overall I would say pass on this place after the meal we had.    You get free chips and 3 types of salsa when you get seated, and that was the best part of the meal for both my wife and myself.  The service was OK, but I would never expect that much from a chain place like that.  Overall, I would have rather ate at Taco Bell.  It is way cheaper, and has better overall food, in my opinion.

RV-rqIl5dPQUxPrTBQMa9Q.text: Best happy Hour in Vegas!  @ the bar and bar tables 2-4-1 Margaritas! 2-4-1 Beers 1/2 off Appetizers, Including the Award winning Nachos!

71jR7J3uoq4F_jInpYIu3w.text: I carried out from here and took it back to my room.  The girl at the counter was really nice and took my order.  I had to wait a bit, but it was ok.  We had an order of guac and shrimp taco's.  They were really good and super filling.  One order was definitely enough to split between two people for a snack.   For the pool crowd, I don't think you can come in here without "proper attire".  When I was waiting there were two girls trying to order some food in their bathing suits, but they weren't allowed in the restaurant, but they could stand at the door and order.

y3Aftr7B22Zl1herH5va7A.text: LOVED this place! Loved the food, loved the ambiance, loved the drinks, loved just about everything!  -1 star for the waistresses. They are quite the snobby type.  Other than our waitress, the food is great and so are the drinks. I thoroughly enjoyed their pink tacos! You could imagine my disappointment when I completely forgot I wouldn't be able to reheat my leftovers in the hotel room :(

dTa0tdfFZihhrnkqns1Hng.text: We stopped by here while checking out the hotel and casino during our Vegas trip. Decor was awesome and we chose to sit on the patio which was overlooking an awesome pool. Our waitress came by and was different, not sure what was her deal but she couldn't hear anything we said. We ordered a margarita and a mojito. Margarita came and no mojito. Five minutes later she came by and I asked about the mojito. Apparently, she didn't hear my order and didn't apologize just walked away. The wait for the mojito was not worth it, it had Malibu rum in it and tasted like sun tan lotion. My mistake for not reading the ingredients. I ordered ahi tuna tacos, they were great minus the sweet fruit salsa on top. My bf ordered shrimp enchiladas and was brought shrimp tacos, oh well he ate them anyway and they were good. We didn't complain just wanted our check and to go somewhere else without our awkward waitress. If she would of asked if we wanted more to drink, we probably would have but she was too busy getting others orders wrong probably. Food was ok, service not so much.

mt8TLzcT5KsNqU_HlUKXlQ.text: The food here was really good! The only complain was that the service sucked, we got our food before the appetizer and chips and salsa after food?  but I noticed it pretty much sucked in every restaurant I went to in Vegas. I guess they don't care about tourist lol that's why no one got any tips  lol

OVgRS3nI7jSm_h0E1c3lhg.text: I recently had my first experience at Pink Taco and I was completely satisfied.  The Mexican-American restaurant is located inside the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino.  The restaurant is within walking distance from the famous Rehab pool and gives you an opportunity to get away from loud party and get a bite to eat.  The dimly lit cantina has a nice Mexican aesthetic to it and is very warm and welcoming.  I needed to get away from the XFANZ Expo and was wanting a bite to eat, so I headed towards the restaurant and bar.  I opted to try an appetizer and I went for the house made guacamole and chips.  I accompanied the guacamole with an ice cold Corona, which only seemed appropriate.  Within a few minutes, my fresh guacamole and chips were delivered.   My initial reaction was that the guacamole was good, but not great.  However, I added a splash of their house salsa into the guac and it really kicked it up a notch and made it much more flavorful and delicious. The three house salsas were mouthwatering and varied from a non-spicy salsa to a lightly spiced salsa and lastly a spicy salsa.  Two Coronas later and the guacamole in my stomach and I was a happy customer.  I highly suggest checking out Pink Taco if you're at the Hard Rock; I'll definitely be back to try other items from their menu.

qNN1oWebEqyXnS2NUpGxpw.text: I eat at Pink Taco Sunday afternoon of every Vegas trip I've been on - - - meaning I've eaten there about 50 times.  This past weekend I was underwhelmed.  ....and I was STARVING.  The Guac....eh.  We left most of it : (  some sort of weird flavor we couldn't put our finger on.  The Chips are always awesome & they still were.  The salsa was a little different, but still good.  Although, they continue to serve them in tiny ramekins & the only way to have them replenished is by almost tackling a server to get their attention....which sometimes you just don't have the energy to do (sunday morning.....) so you just sit there with empty salsa ramekins....hungry-eyed, hoping they'll bring something else soon.  The Queso dip was the most disappointing thing I've ever tasted : (  It's usually so cheesy, with a bean accent.  this one was mostly bean dip with a lump of non-melted cheese blobbed in the center.  We tried to keep it mixed up, but the cheese kept blobbing with itself and turning hard as it cooled off.  It was just sad, b/c that's the main thing we come for!   .......It was impossible to get the attention of our server so we just ate it as is and felt pouty.  The Chicken Enchiladas w/ green sauce were great as usual - They're definitely a safe bet at Pink Taco.  haven't let me down yet.  All in all, the lacking service along w/ the clumpy cheese dip are reasons I will probably try another Mex restaurant out next time.   I'm sure I'll be back to Pink Taco.... unless I find another place in the meantime.

8ECMPl6FWEzTl3F6QgohXg.text: Came endorsed by buddies of mine. My marg was totally solid and I ordered this chicken dish based on the recommendation of the waitress - it was cheesy and yummy! Prices were good....relative to Vegas.

ZEoZo_c4_RzGYJDlFGUXdg.text: I love the carne asada fries at this place. It's inside the casino. Kinda hidden but I am sure you will find it if you ask.

yviC3y-f8EXyYoOcB6X8pw.text: Both nights in Vegas, we ordered food to go from here and took it to the room, so I didn't get to experience the dining here. But the food was great, reasonably priced, and fast. Not a bad idea if you're staying at the Hard Rock.

89MDY85v2FcbK-6ESWDrgw.text: Absolutely the best mexican place in Vegas.  The atmosphere, the music and the food seal the deal.  I had the carnitas platter, and it is excellent.  the spices they use on the meat is wonderful, the chips and salsa are fantastic and the margaritas are perfect.  It's a bit off the strip, but worth the walk or the cab ride.

RROAxIaHCtGAfgepdjV2ow.text: Wow, for an Americanized taco place in the midst of Vegas craziness to be decent, much less good? Four stars for sure.  They have the basic meats.. beef, chicken, pork.. with corn and flour tortillas. I like a little more variety of beef (like a certain PART of the beef) but hold onto your stomachs, it's pretty safe to say they don't carry my favorite part here =/  The meat was flavorful and not too tough, the veggies were fresh and the tortillas weren't too starchy, in fact, they were borderline home made status.  Drinks were good, and apparently they have Happy Hour? Niiiice.

9J9qpmjOZT1qotW4gm1mUQ.text: Not terrible, but I probably won't be back. Food was so so. Drinks were inconsistent. Every margarita I had tasted different and none of them were quite right.

z8vgNw-dzT-H-R6kbofUkg.text: Our experience at pink taco was great our server very attentive very nice she recommended just the right drink sorry i can't remember her name glasses with tattoo sleeve. The food was super good we will definitely be back

9mRAVFWPT-qWEALLoqKhBQ.text: Mexican food was mediocre. However service was great, very friendly staff. Its a touristy place located in the Hard Rock casino. It was a good experience. I recommend it if your in the area.

dORzGRcJVcGjtba_UoqzAA.text: We were going to see Rascal Flatts at The Joint. We were told this is not a great part of town and the crowd was different than the strip. But Pink Tacos was recommended. We loved it! Expect a line to get in, it's worth it. Loud rock music of course. Skulls and cherub angels is a bit strange for decor, but the vibe was fun. The service was great with multiple servers taking good care of us. They are serious about their food. This is no Mexican dive. There is indoor/outdoor seating and it borders the pool area. So the food - I had the Pink Taco Combo, which was yummy even though the enchilada was white cheese and I don't know what sauce. The pink taco was delish and yes they really are pink. Someone is making fresh tortillas in the window at the front of the restaurant. They also served a great presentation including a rib kabob thing that i was too full to try. My hubby had the street tacos which was not too much food and very good. Our friend had the chicken fajitas and she thought it was great. I would definitely go back, just park valet. The history of rock museum everywhere in the lobby is very entertaining, especially if you are as old as we are and remember buying the albums and going to concerts back then.

nQWFl2zISfxzsT8sMxD2kQ.text: I was introduced to the Pink Taco approx. 10 years ago, and it has become a tradition for us to go to Pink Taco either at the beginning, or end of our trips to Vegas.  My favorite item here is definitely the shrimp tacos. Over the years they have scaled back a bit on the quantity of the tacos (which is why I'm only giving 4 stars). 10 years ago, they would serve 4 shrimp tacos along with beans and Spanish rice. About 6 years ago, they scaled the dish back to 3 tacos, which was still enough food, but was a slight disappointment. Now they have scaled down to only 2 tacos on the dish, with the other half of the plate consisting of beans and rice. The tacos are still just as delicious, and the amount of food was just  right to fill you up.  Our waitress, Cristal, was very attentive and friendly. I would definitely recommend requesting to be seated in her area.

MktRKDxgRfWzox8Cnrf5Vw.text: Admittedly, I was completely plastered when I came to eat here but I have to say my tacos were AMAZING!!! After chugging down 30 oz. of pure alcohol at Rehab, Pink Taco seriously hits the spot. Their chips and salsa is also so delicious! i couldn't pick out a favorite salsa, they all have their own unique taste. Though it's far from the strip, I think I would definitely come back to eat here. Mexican food always hits the spot after drinking.

rwhGgW4lkIk6EgXZd-9t7Q.text: Ventured forth to the Pink Taco for my birthday dinner, happily clutching a restaurant.com gift certificate in my chubby little hand. It was a warm Sunday evening and since we are both smokers, we opted for patio dining. The Rehab party was in full swing at the pool, which borders the Pink Taco patio, so conversation at normal decibles was not an option, but the people watching was pretty good. Lots of hard-bodies strutting their tats and designer sunglasses. But I digress. Back to the chow ... I had the carne asada platter and it was good - steak was tender and flavorful. My friend had the carnitas, which was disappointingly dry. The freshly made tortillas were mucho goodo, and the trio of salsas that they deliver with the chips are quite tasty! The rice and beans were ho-hum, but it is pretty hard to make those jump off of any plate. Margaritas were yummy, but overpriced, although this IS Vegas and we WERE at the Hard Rock, so it was expected. Service was average. I did appreciate the waitress giving me a heads up to check the seat cushion before I sat down, since "Rehab"-ers sit on the patio a lot and the cushions can become damp from moist booty. I will probably return in the future, just because it is one of the few restaurants in town that has outdoor seating where the tobacco-inclined are welcomed.

NCeUdUhAI0jtp3oplp_KWA.text: We came here before seeing bon Iver in April. We didn't have a ton of time so we opted to sit at the bar. Half of the bar has machines to play on... entertainment while You wait...   They don't have a very big wine selection... I opted for the chardonnay. It was warm out and we were eating veggie fajitas wrapped in lettuce wraps... definitely not a bad mix. They do offer an extensive tequila selection and some pretty tasty tequila cocktails. I wasn't looking for my infamous hangover from mixing.  As an appetizer we ordered the guacamole with raw veggies, chips and salsa come standard here. And as entree we ordered the veggie fajitas in lettuce cups, prepared vegan. I appreciate that they offer alternatives like veggies to chips and tortilla wraps. Everything came out very quick and hot... and just as ordered. We were both impressed with the speed and accuracy. It tasted flavorful and The veggies all had the right amount of crunch. The entree came with beans and rice. It was definitely enough for two, so be aware of that when ordering. Everything was also extremely fairly priced for being located in a casino... which was also rather surprising.   The service was friendly, quick, and accurate. Make sure to tip accordingly, they work hard and deserve it. I would definitely recommend stopping by here if after the pool... or before a show.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole with veggies and veggie fajitas in lettuce cups

uHtwcVHoDqkG3-5BhwDKUg.text: Avoid sitting at the bar. Waiters will not take your orders and pretty much avoid you telling you that they cannot help you, leaving you at the mercy of the bar man which will ignore you.  We only ordered the nachos and two drinks, they did not brings us a still water we asked for. Very disappointed for the level of service for this restaurant.  We wanted to eat more and they did not setup our napkins and cover plates.  The food we tasted was good. But after being ignored by the bar man we decided to leave.  Not what you would expect for a restaurant in Vegas.  Take your money elsewhere.

yj1wyXXQe5Uov7TqDq2w1A.text: I love coming here! The food here is soooooo amazing! This time around I had the pink taco, that blew any taco ever out the window it was so good! Bacon wrapped jalapenos are always a must! Definitely get the gauc and cheese dip too! All the drinks are super yummy as well! I loved my jalapeno margarita!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qFfI-zzBN-kJFSoOM3BnpQ.text: It's a nice looking spot to chill and eat but the food can be summed up as....meh. Not terrible, just not great either. -The seared tuna appetizer came with a sauce that just doesn't go with it. Like ketchup on pizza.  -The Cubana michelada was just all lime. No spice or flavor to it. -The Cadillac margarita was good, standard, but came in a small jar which sucked as other restaurants will serve a bigger size for the same price.  -The asada burrito's meat was crunchy, hard, and even cold. Lacking flavor.  Again, nothing you'll hate, nothing you'll love. No real spice to flavor  to anything. But the place is cool and the staff was nice.

21KjwPUV_CDBoAoO9DQ8eQ.text: I'm wondering if the restaurant is under new management.  I used to frequent Pink Taco quite often and bring out-of-town guests on occasion as well.  The food used to be much better than it is now, and especially disappointing is the chips and salsa, which I used to order to go because they were so good.  Not any more, they are bland and taste like they came out of a bag.  They used to be really thick and crunchy, and tasted homemade.  Nope.  Also disappointing was the taquito appetizer, which was not worth the price they charge for the portion size.  Overall, I'm disappointed in the decline I've seen since my last visit.  With all of the good restaurants in town, I probably won't be back to the Pink Taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken enchiladas with red &amp; green sauce... I guess you have to ask for sour cream... I requested no beans, so that was good.
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chips used to be SOOOO good, but not anymore.  Bland and taste like they came from the store. Used to come JUST for the chips &amp; salsa :(
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny taquitos!

IyZFm_OZjdpztarrpivrMA.text: Ah, the Pink Taco.  The party doesn't stop just because you want to eat. This Mexican-inspired restaurant / tourist trap with a clever name will do its best to give you a little breather, allow you to refuel and gather yourself and then get you back out into the thick of things.  Among some things that stood out were the margaritas and specialty drinks. Just because you're not out in the party doesn't mean you have to stop the party and these drinks are a good way to keep everything loose. If you're feeling a little wild you can test your luck with the tequila / Mezcal menu.   Beerwise it looks like the venue has a contract with InBev. Besides Budweiser products, Goose Island, Shock Top, Landshark and south of the border beers Corona, Modelo and Dos Equis were available on tap or by bottle.   They do serve food and it's okay. Your standard Mexican-inspired dishes are available and while I will say that my meal didn't knock my socks off, it was filling and did its job. Like I said above, the party doesn't stop and I almost feel like the food is a little bit of an after thought in the restaurant's mission statement, which is a bit disappointing since you're paying Las Vegas prices.  One quick parting thought... this place is really really loud. I sat at the bar and I had to stand on my chair and lean across to order from the bartender. It's definitely part of the atmosphere, but please keep it in mind if you're wanting to talk to who you're dining with.

MjDRnnUbtAP0vyRojrMH-A.text: Underwhelming. The al carbon street tacos were a bit dry. The rice was like microwave bag rice and the beans were black but still mushy. We weren't impressed. Staff was friendly and we had prompt service. I expected more from a hotel restaurant.

DSU_FijnZFKALbeGIarOXg.text: After a night rocking out with what could very well be one of the most iconic bands out there ( Journey! ) this was the default selection for late night munchies. Its located about 10 steps from the Joint.   While i cant really go on about the food ( all 4 of us shared beers and nachos) i can tell you the decor has that very Hispanic high end barrio decor going on if that makes any sense at all.   Our server was great and kept coming back to check in with us. The bar area has a great decor. What a fun place to hang out for beers. My wife was totally hung over the next day lol. ( lightweight)  I can imagine all the sun burned, drunk college kids in here as it faces the communal pool area. Good thing it was late at night to avoid all that spring break riff raff. Gross.

Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_fD2wpT8M3De-UQ7QzrgpQ.text: A little pricey but it was one of our favorite places to eat while we were a little tipsy and enjoying our time at the Hard Rock Hotel.   Complimentary chips and salsa that we kept on craving, huge nachos with melted cheese all throughout, and fresh tortillas that you can actually see them making!  I enjoyed the patio seating with the view of the tropical pool and the sounds of the waterfalls.  Plus our waitress was peppy and funny. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nswm9UsXa7TQ7RBP_sTs9g.text: The perfect place to eat if you're catching a concert at Hard Rock. You can also make reservations, which is nice. We went both nights before NIN in Nov/Dec 2018. EVERYTHING we got was delicious, and not badly priced for being Vegas. The bean dip is a steal and well worth it. We also had queso dip, enchiladas, a variety of tacos, and margaritas. I don't think you can go wrong with whatever you choose. Service was also great and the decor is fabulous.

MjbssjkyTt1si9RacT9S0w.text: I went here with my husband and best friend , my husband recommended it we wanted to get some poker chips from here before it Hard Rock closes and wanted  Mexican food for dinner.   The food was neither good nor bad it was just average , I would have done a three star for the food but my main  issue was the service.   Our waitress had a general disinterest in even being around us , I'm really not sure if she may have been having a bad day or what but it seemed it was with all the staff. They were just .....there .....  I asked for napkins 5 times I had to get up and get some from the bar area after I had to get up she finally brought some to the table. She talked over everybody at the table and cut us off which at least at that point we had her attention she spent most the time ignoring us . My best friend asked for hot water for his utensils , she never brought it so he just wiped them down , after we were done eating she said oh I forgot your hot water do you still need it ... no booboo we are done lol.   And we didn't get any refills on our water or soda the whole meal so half my taco was still in the back of my throat after we finished and on my ride home.  I don't think I would recommend-

_cPp1pTApgAi8Yo5iOBUwA.text: We made a open table app and made reservations they were spot on and seated us quickly. I had the signature Pink Tacos and let me tell you I had a food orgasm! Every one else in my party had great food also. Definitely a must try if you like unique food.

mygISyqoRwS--ob7zdgXcw.text: We came here last Sunday. Sevice was good and food was excellent. We ordered pork chile verde and steak fajitas. Both amazing. Definitely, we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chile verde

7v8oD-yQfTyVhjUWSurpiA.text: If you stay at the Hard Rock and don't feel like going far from the hotel I would recommend Pink Taco. In the beginning I thought Pink Taco was a strip club but they actually have a taco served with a pink tortilla. Yes, my mind was in the gutter. I can't help it, I'm in Las Vegas. Anyways, the prices for the tacos are a bit high but it is expected especially in a hotel in Las Vegas. The hostess and waitress were very friendly on our visit. We were seated right away and our waitress took our orders in a timely manner. She also came by frequently to check on our table.  I ordered the shrimp tacos and the queso bean dip which was delicious with the house tortilla chips. The tacos were a bit small but did taste fresh. If you glance over by the front entrance you can see one of the staffs preparing fresh tortillas. The average price per meal with a beverage is around $25-$30. We were pretty pleased with the experience and we actually came back a second night. I should've stuck with the tacos but instead I ventured out and ordered the tamales. The sauce on it was very salty. The side of rice and beans wasn't that impressive either.   The restaurant is worth trying if you're staying at the Hard Rock or if you're near by. I can't say it is a restaurant that I will go out of my way to try out.

B8UpVLvckeBvL8GpnjbD7A.text: The atmosphere at the Pink Taco is badass. Service was excellent and more than accommodating! The graffiti made for an excellent back drop on a spur of the moment photo shoot. We had drinks outside then asked to eat inside. Both servers were great and obliged our every request. The margaritas were either a little weak or made really well because they went down smooth and were very delicious! I'd highly recommend this establishment for dinner and drinks. Not to mention, their fried ice cream was to die for!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1cuoubPVILKlGa10p41cJw.text: Pretty excited to see Taco Tuesday advertised within the hotel... disappointed to discover it's only valid for LOCALS.  Why would you advertise inside the hotel by the guest elevator only to deny guests the same access as "locals".   Considering it is advertised on a Tuesday - being off peak for Vegas and the hotel has such limited dining options already, this should be an incentive offered to IN HOUSE guests for staying mid week.  Bad marketing management by pink taco and the hotel for allowing this practise.  I feel this is discriminatory practise by both restaurant and hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TACO TUESDAY - local only

nxdFoML_x6HViA4Wu6RVRg.text: This place has some pretty good Mexican food. They have a wide variety of tacos, enchiladas, soups and entrees. We were in the restaurant for about 15 minutes before seated and this was around 8 PM. Probably not the best time to have dinner since a bunch of large groups were coming in before their night out. Considering the larger parties at that time, we were seated pretty quickly.   When we got to our seat, just like other reviews, we too were not approached by a server until 10 minutes of sitting (could have been longer!) That's a long time when you're hungry. Even though it was our first impression of our server we gave her the benefit of the doubt. After she takes our drink order our free chips and salsa arrive. So delicious and the salsa was bomb!   Ok so after our chips and salsa arrived she brings us a round of waters and then a party of 8 gets sat right next to us. Honestly it was probably another 10 minutes until our main drinks came back to our table. She obviously saw this party when she dropped off our waters and she still hadn't approached her new table. Look, I used to be a server and I know how to manage my time wisely. It's obvious she was not doing that. I started to keep a close eye on her. She had one more table that we saw her taking care of who already had their food down.  I did see her across the bar a few times gossiping to another server/employee. Apparently this employee is more important than the people she is supposed to be attentive to.   Idk what she did, but she disappeared in the back somewhere and then some time later she finally came back to take our order. I would totally understand if she came back out with some food or possibly helping out another server but no!  she took our order and then greeted her new party of 8. Not only did we get delayed service but so did this other party which could have easily been avoided by not gossiping on the clock.   Whatever, anyways.. food was great but this place could improve on their hospitality.

Foib_jXBnMyCpFBAVHgr0A.text: Solid happy hour with $6 food specials including a 2 taco combo from 5-6 pm, I believe.  The food itself is decent - the taquitos and tacos are solid and the quesadillas pretty standard.  It's convenient if you are at the Hard Rock, and is decently affordable with decent portions.

0tbDzK9gh6m4Kbwo7VTJ0g.text: The tacos are barely mediocre. I got 2 of the "Famous tacos" & only ate one because the meat had absolutely no flavor. The shrimp taco was just okay to me, my bestie liked it. She also got one of their beef tacos and said the meat was flavorless and didn't finish the taco itself. I'm a taco addict so for these to be less than impressive says a lot. Quesadilla app was good!

IxfCYcpVZyD6525zoHT7-A.text: It's food.... not really impressed nothing I can really say that was good about it. Cool atmosphere. The Corona's are super cold.

eSoYHAHSCIamqgZhdclzxg.text: Pink Taco features fresh Mexican flavors with California influences. The Dia de Los muertos-inspired and kitschy decor makes for a fun and convivial atmosphere. Glowing tequila bottles, hand-painted skull murals, Mexican folk art, vintage low-rider bikes and hanging star lamps are just a few of the eclectic design accents at Pink Taco. There's a nice selection of margaritas, mojitos and speciality cocktails, which you can order by the glass or pitcher.   We ordered the namesake pink tacos, shrimp tacos, fried ice cream dessert and some mint mojitos. The standouts were the fried ice cream and the pink tacos. One of our servers claimed the fried ice cream was one of the best fried ice creams out there. She was right--it definitely something memorable. A large scoop of vanilla ice cream cloaked with crushed Frosted Flakes and then deep fried to a golden brown finish. It is then drizzled with caramel and chocolate sauces and laid in a fried tortilla shell. The pink tacos are a fun selection. These pink-hued handmade tortillas are stuffed with grilled chicken, pickled pink onions, black beans, salsa and fresh avocado slices. The perfect Rehab diet food. I wasn't too keen on the side of rice. I love fresh and fluffy Spanish rice and there's tasted like something straight from a box. All and all, a solid plate.   In the warmer months you can relax on their outdoor patio, which looks out onto the famous Hard Rock pool.   Pink Taco is a fun Vegas hotspot. Come for the creative drinks, funky decor and plenty of eye candy.
