-Vg492N1CDUfEysWOW3fVw.text: Pink Taco is amazing!! Chicken & Steak skewers are so flavorful!! Would recommend to anyone for great food, great music and rad company!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

anRZsDE9C2WakSQ8txMi7Q.text: Today will be my first day trying pink tacos food! I work at the Kelly Cardenas Salon in the Hard Rock and yesterday I got to do a shampoo blow dry for their general manager Cindy Faraci. I was so blown away by her personality and kindness, it was such a great experience for me that I'm inclined to give a review before even trying their food.

KMSnR92H4bG4lZgflR-z4A.text: This review is mobile posted, so I will keep it short.  Good service.  Good chips and salsa. Hot habanero salsa!! Tuna tacos had ridiculously stale tacos. Like, yesterday stale tacos. Totally killed my evening.  Mediocre, at best. Would not recommend.

NnMUARbp-1EuHUiHxtrb6A.text: Two words.  Shrimp Tacos. Go for the guacamole, salsa and chips to start, move into a delicious plate of Fried shrimp Tacos and wash it down with your favorite cervesa .. So yum.

0QQugVPv1Fqr3KD4_EmELQ.text: B+ for drinks; B- for food; A for great looking girls  Now, let it be known - I am a big fan of Pink Taco. But, as the locations have slowly closed around the western US, this location is my least favorite.  Not sure why they don't carry the best thing: BRISKET TACOS -- the other locations had it, and the Century City location still carries it.  OMG - it's the best!  I've been 5-6 times to this location at the Hard Rock.  The food is just okay, nothing great.  They do have great chips & salsa, delicious margaritas, but food - eh.  This is a great hangout, though.  Always good to pop into before/after a concert or a night out with friends.  Rumor has it, their website states, that a sunset strip location in Hollywood is coming soon!  Bring it, and bring it soon with the Brisket tacos!  Other locations may be San Diego and Miami.

1ixLH1owVQnnoWnyrObjTA.text: The food here was really good. It was filling and tasty. However, when compared to other taco joints or mexican food, it is just very average. I love mexican food and the food here lacks the authenticity of other places... But this should be obvious since its in a casino.  My problem is that they are very very pricey. For two people, it was $54. The food was good and it was discounted for gamblers, but if I had to pay over $50 for the quality I would be upset. Definetly people should come here and try it out, just know the quality isn't worth the price.

Rw7tgcoL9KL30RRvPW33Kg.text: Super delicious! Had a wonderful server, cannot remember her name but she was attentive and helpful. Ordered the Chicken Fajitas and the Pink Tacos. Both were delicious and kept us full for hours after.   Had we not ordered the (delicious) $14/each bloody marys our tab would have been very cheap and reasonable. Would highly recommend it, sans the super expensive non happy hour drinks.

AiopwblB-p4qTOVZPj92QA.text: The Pink Taco was great! I got three tacos. One pink, one chicken and one shrimp. The shrimp was my favorite! Service was fast and friendly. Can't wait to go back to the Hard Rock and eat here again!!

0Ftza-530XKjR3sGjiEjPQ.text: So delicious!! The Diablo nachos are super amazing and the pink taco plate is just as good!! The food does not disappoint at all!!!

Aq6WdE1Ozg1bV7QOmMRbgA.text: Was here for Halloween 2012. My girlfriend and I loved this place.  The food was more expensive than it would be if it weren't in a hotel in Vegas. But I expected that when I came in here. Its Vegas after all.   Anyways. It was midday and we were here for "breakfast" It wasn't crowded. Got seated almost immediately.  It is VERY pink in there. Pink tinted lights and what not.   Had the Queso Fundido. My mouth still waters thinking about this stuff. Its like a super creamy cheesy bean dip.   I had the burrito and it was good. I liked it. I do not remember what my girlfriend had. I think it was the Nachos. I am pretty sure that it is the Nachos. They were good I seem to remember.   Chips and salsa were good as well.   Overall we were very pleased with our experience here.   Oh and the selection of Tequila was very good. I didn't have a drink here, but I saw that they did have a good selection.    Every time we talk about Vegas, we talk about the Pink Taco and how we cant wait to go back the next time we are there.

7zVNsQNUOQP7MBZi2WLMWA.text: Pretty disappointed. I was staying at the hard rock and heard a lot of hype on this place. It really fell short. I had pork and steak tacos. The pork tacos were super dry with no salsa, pico or the like. The steak tacos were okay but not great at all. I would be willing to try it again but not impressed.

YbClQqhZP5r9iqee46WFlg.text: far better Mexican food in the valley... The place was dead so I don't really know how to rate the service.... the food was like Chili's and the prices were like an upscale Mexican restaurant .... I think the people coming from a day at the pool or a great concert must put them in the mood to review this place better? Go to Viva Mercados and forget Pink Taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bad food!!!

Mqqrprs9KViJDXizrTJ5yg.text: I've tried Pink Taco at other locations and this one was by far the worst.  I usually enjoy Pink Taco but ugh... definitely not here. Slowwwwwwwwww service, they kept confusing our orders, and it took us 5 times of asking to finally get our waters/drinks. The food is okay and the ambiance is super cute... but shit if you have a set schedule, go somewhere else. Or if you're super starving and grumpy and not in the mood to be patient... go somewhere else.

zErUYglLX06f6M06hjLm0Q.text: An okay place for lunch. We happened to be at the Hard Rock for a pool party and decided to grab lunch beforehand. I got the fish tacos, which were okay. The nachos are pretty good though and it comes with 3 different types of salsa. I wasn't impressed by the food, but it's a nice place to hang out and have a couple beers.

O3BXQUMzcp9v5QUSUF2CXg.text: A Vegas favorite. Bomb dot com. Ambience is great! Sit by the pool  outside for dia de los muertos art explosion! Nursing a hangover ??? Order the ceviche!

E559lzwo_P-a79TLNzT2pA.text: Went in to gift shop and got no service. Went in to eat and got no service either, we stood their next to the wait to be seated sign and staired at the workers and the workers staird right back at us. After 20 min of wasted time we left along with 15 others in our group. ( I point out we showed no disrespect or anything else to be treated this way!) Needless to Say Margurettaville (spelled wrong I'm sure) got a massive tip!

danpwMzLiBTEzT2BvsXTDA.text: Don't waist your time here. Service is BLAH and food is nothing special. Their happy hour food is a joke. One star for the beer and one star for their free chips and salsa.

KHFOYnpjtLHCgmAD0HB28Q.text: I love the Sabana De Pollo, I've been ordering it since Pink Taco opened! Another favorite of friends' are the Chicken Enchiladas with Tomatillo (green) Sauce.

H84GJoDc-DnxvAykerWl3w.text: Came for the new Sunday all you can eat brunch.  Food was great!!! You must try the bloody Mary's!! So good!! Service was pretty good. In short, I'd return anytime and would recommend to anyone else.

wWZtgMgknkw_vQ76_ULEAw.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant by far. Whenever I'm in Vegas I always make sure to eat here, and buy a souvenir tank top. Love the decor and murals painted on the walls outside. Waitresses are always friendly,  and food is always prepared quickly. I have typically always eaten lunch or dinner here and have loved everything I've ever ordered, however,  my latest visit was for brunch and although my chilaquiles were good, they weren't quite as delicious as expected. I was a bit let down with that dish. But their cocktails are always good,  the bloody maria and the horchata colada don't disapoint.

sTX2aat9yX1xhfRqniTSTg.text: It has become a tradition to leave Vegas with a belly full of pinks tacos. It's the best hangover medicine a doctor can prescribe. Try the signature pink tacos and the shrimp tacos. Super amazing. The atmosphere is alway amazing and the staff are super friendly. The drinks can have a work on but regardless the food is magnifico!

Zbd__85H57xE7qIdFDbsjQ.text: I had the Hotchata Colada, I consider myself a horchata expert. Sadly, it had a nasty fake coconut chemical taste. But! The savior was the carnitas. I had the carnitas torta an it was one of the best carnitas I have ever had.

zkmRBgZp-x8_wIi-O1L3HA.text: I only came here during happy hour. Let me make this easy:  - Sit at the bar. Bartenders are awesome and you can play some touch screen poker. We came up! bout $1.50 ;) lol - 2 for 1 Margaritas, yup. - Guacamole is so good. And chips and 3 different kinds of salsa right away? Why, thank you, don't mind if I do.  That's all I experienced, and that's all I needed.

SVLBiEo_h5mR1hQahzpwJA.text: Been here many many times while staying at the Hard Rock always great fresh tasting food. First time ever  stopped in for happy hour today. Ordered the HH tacos. BIG MISTAKE! These were simply deep fried frozen tacos with some lettuce and salsa thrown on top. Didn't finish one of the two. Grease dripping down my hand. Just terrible.

5vuG3eV7JQgSZfsLHUZ1Cg.text: This place is very fun and the food is great. Love watching them make fresh tortillas. Next time I'm in Vegas I'm going to come again.

lkmobqw-Bi2Jxplv5QXUtQ.text: The hostess was anything but nice. Wouldn't even acknowledge us while she counted money and receipts. There was a table open right in front of the door and she made us wait 15 minutes while she finished.  The server was the best part she understood we were hungry and brought us food and drinks as fast as she could.  It's not her fault the music was loud and horrible, and that our food was greasy and gross. Left her a good tip even though our ears were ringing and our stomachs hurt when we left.

TX_394wKWgEkGL2Hf09N3Q.text: Great ambience! Delicious food! Margarita... Ehh not so good. Margaritas are my go to drink and I couldn't quite put my finger on what was wrong here but it was not very good. The food on the other hand was delicious which bumps my rating up to 4 stars. The Carne Asada Fries were delicious and you can't beat $6 at happy hour.  We also had the Chicken Taquitos and I give them a thumbs up as well.

MFDoJ-NMcDhgopkMi5ShJQ.text: You know, I would totally love this place if it wasn't at Hard Rock.  It's right next to Rehab shithole douchebags pool. I seriously don't know how these people can listen to the same techno dance music over and over again.   But, other than that, I loved their food. I ordered a chicken tostada salad which was very fresh and had pretty good amounts of chicken. Their guac is so delish. I couldn't stop eating it. It had a little kick!!   Service was bleh. Not that great but not that bad either. We needed refills on our drinks and when they dropped off our food for a table of 8 they bolted and didn't ask us if we needed anything. Super annoying.  I probably won't be back only because of jersey shore douches that like to come here.

t05WGMW_CdydweadjZo5mA.text: Skip this place. You're better off eating a wrap from the cafe down the way or trying to stomach cigarette butts off the strip floor :)

mEMP08lbuNGhnTrYsSTqsg.text: Pink Taco is ok. Our server was really nice and helpful! Always filled our glass without us asking. Only thing I have to whine about is the quality of the food, and pricing. Obviously to me, I feel that there is some sort of unwritten rule that says "the ratio of good quality food must be equivalent to the price". I feel that this ratio is a bit off where it leans more towards a high price/ low grade food quality ratio.  We got a $12 pomegranate Margarita which was of course had that big round house tequila kick to the face! But that's a given...its a margarita.  $5.99 Fried Fried Ice Cream- Don't be fooled. It a big scoop of ice cream in a generic, but fancy looking ice cream cone cup. I mean I'd be sold on it if it had some sugar and cinnamon "churro" like seasoning to it, but it was plain. Then the choco syrup had some weird taste to it. Like it was spiked with alchy. I'm all for spiked drinks, but spiked syrup? Nay..  $12.99 Baja Fish Tacos- SUPER SMALL PORTIONS! The fish slices WERE SMALL! I felt like they must have gone through some serious cut backs since the BP oil spill. I mean it's like they killed their pet goldfish and served it to me in a tortilla (poor goldfsh!!!!!)  $8.99 Chicken Skewers- Thumbs up to tenderness...but my sister wasn't too happy to find  nicely redish pink center to it. SMH.  Service is nice. The restaurant decor is fun and festive, but food is just not worth it. Thankfully the awesome Yelpers on here knows where the REAL tacos are!!

7PI75rxr3CZnxEy6Pucvpg.text: Great atmosphere, great service, great marguerites, SOGGY TACOS and pretty sure the beans came from a can. Other than that  Vegas Ya!!

tNF-s2SdplRruDJNiGXy0w.text: Oh, Vegas. You're such a sleaze. The sleaze knees. You know how to make everything sound raunchier than it really is.  Like tacos. Pink taco..now if that isn't a graphic innuendo, I don't know what is.  One might take it the wrong way. As in...is this a "lesbi-honest" kind of restaurant...or is it open to all orientations?  One might also upset a family from Idaho if you pass them in the halls while talking on your iPhone saying "I SO want to eat a pink taco. Or maybe THREE!! Damn, I've been craving them ALL WEEK!!"  Settle down, people, it's a tex-mex taco joint. Take away the sleazy name, and all you've got is your standard mexican fare, where the only thing that's gonna get you hot and bothered is the hot sauce. :)  Anyway, so I order the pink tacos, because I rationalize that if they're going to name the entire restaurant on one entree, it must be the fucking bomb. Well, it was 'aight. I think it tasted better than it really was, because I was in town for a work convention and I was surviving off protein bars and almonds the majority of the time. You could probably just serve me refried beans in the shape of a taco, and I would have thought that was the best meal on earth at that very moment.   But hey, I'm not complaining. It was way more affordable and much tastier than the convention center food. Not saying it's so good I want to come back kind of good, but it does the job, the servers are nice, and the place had a chill vibe.

TUSyz9vIV5xGOj51DR8GKg.text: I wrote my original review about 5 years ago. I haven't been back until last week. I gamble at the Hard Rock Hotel and because I do so HRH sends promotional literature in the mail. Pink Taco was having an all you can eat special for Taco Tuesday. SOLD!   I actually came in to Pink Taco twice that same week. Once because of the Taco Tuesday special and second because I had a voucher to use.   Upon my return, I sat at the bar at lunch time during the week. No one was at the bar other than myself and the bartenders. I was greeted by the bartender and within minutes I had a beer and 3 tacos in hand.   Al pastor - ROASTED PORK, PINEAPPLE SALSA Shrimp -  RED CABBAGE SLAW, CHIPOTLE CREMA, AVOCADO Carne Asada - PICO DE GALLO, COTIJA CHEESE  I asked for no cheese on my carne asada taco. Everything came out fast AND correct. And each taco was SO good. The asada I would love to taste w/ a different choice of sauce or even salsa. It needed a bit more flavor than just pico de gallo. The bartender was a sweetheart. Couldn't have asked for better service. 5 stars on this day.  When I returned again that week, I was hungry for some of tasty tacos I had earlier in the week. Like last time I sat at the bar. Again, like last time no one was at the bar. And much like last time I arrived when the place wasn't busy, noon. Baffled both times I came in and it wasn't jam packed for lunch.   I ordered the all you can eat tacos for Taco Tuesday.   Gringo - CRISPY CORN TORTILLA, GROUND BEEF, CHEDDAR CHEESE, PICO DE GALLO, SHREDDED LETTUCE, SOUR CREAM Al Carbon Chicken - PICO DE GALLO, COTIJA CHEESE Al Pastor - PICO DE GALLO, COTIJA CHEESE  Like last time I asked for no cheese on my tacos. When the food came out, guess what was on it? CHEESE! Not a huge deal, as I can eat cheese, but on this day I just didn't want cheese. I ate the food as is and just like last time, the food was spot on. It was a bummer when the food came out incorrectly. The bartender who greeted me was very enthusiastic and friendly, started out strong until this happened. There was nobody else at the bar, but he was distracted by another employee and game going on.   Pink Taco has certainly stepped up their customer service since the last time I was here. Still could use some work, but has grown.   My tastebuds approve this message!

C5bcPl4_Qf2a75knFaMWYw.text: First impressions:  housed in the back of the hard rock, on the way to the paradise tower, is a brightly lit pink taco.  On the inside it feels like an adobe cantina that is decorated with low riders and other flashy trinkets.  I initially went in to get breakfast, but the hostess let me know that they only serve breakfast Friday and Saturday. She was nice enough to suggest a few other restaurants that did serve breakfast, but I still wanted to give this place a try.  Food:  Chips and salsa (free): My wife and I are very big on the free chips and salsa as it is usually an indicator on how the meal will be. I was very happy with this dish!  Just because it is free doesn't mean it doesn't represent the food at your establishment,  and this didn't disappoint.  I am a bit of a wimp when it comes to spice but it had the perfect bite for me.  Chicken tacos ($12):  The chicken tacos were loaded with ingredients and flavor.  I wanted something light that could fill my breakfast craving, and also fill my belly. It was very tasty!  I chose flower tortilla and it was fresh and warm. The waitress brought me some Tapatio, they are hot sauce of choice.  Honestly, I didn't need it but I enjoyed it!  I added the rice and beans for four dollars, I just wanted to see what it tasted like, and it was fine.  It tasted like a standard refried beans and rice, but I appreciate that. I'd rather something standard but solid rather than inventive and bad.  Bloody Mary ($11):  I didn't care what vodka, so they used Svedka.  This was another example of standard bloody Mary ingredients tasting great! People go crazy with their bloody Mary's, and it can become too much or overwhelming. This was a classic and it held up.  Service:  Claudia was my waitress, and I usually don't put names in my reviews but this experience was outstanding! She was very familiar with the menu and gave great suggestions, brought me my hot sauce, and reminded me to use my players card when checking out.  I had no complaints about this experience, and it gets a five-star for me! Would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice and beans
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tacos
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tacos, Sriracha Bloody Mary

8-DErLnDwfxJU3ttFBZ0Ig.text: Located in the Hard Rock Hotel, the Pink Taco has absolutely killer Mexican food. I got a deep fried Carne Asada burrito, half topped with a delicious red Mole' sauce, the other half in a smoky green Chili poblano sauce. This thing was huge, stuffed with steak, rice, black beans, the burrito was deep fried, nice and crunchy. Two big thumbs up for the Pink Taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried Carne Asada burrito

sTg4QjNrbx0HrIg_53O0sA.text: You can't really NOT go to a restaurant with a provocative name like "Pink Taco", so we gave it a shot. And I wasn't super impressed.  We made a reservation for six people at 8:30PM. We got there right at 8:30PM and were told it would be just a couple minutes as they set up the table. There were empty six-seater tables everywhere, so that was a bit annoying to hear. At 8:45PM, we were starting to get a bit frustrated and that is when the hostess told us "They're just clearing off the table, it'll be a few mins." What is the point of a reservation if y'all aren't going to have it ready at the actual time? Reservations seem to be more of a "guideline" here.   We were seated once the table was ready and it was moderately busy at this point. We made it a point to select our food/drinks and order them all at once since it took a while for our waitress to show up. The waitress just didn't seem to be super charismatic which I think I understand - she probably gets pummeled with drunk assholes all day/night and maybe assumed we were another. But...we were not. Just trying to enjoy some grub.   Speaking of grub, we were not disappointed here! Boyfriend and I had the steak fajitas. I felt they were a bit pricey but you are in Vegas, so this is expected. They were $19. They had plenty of beans/rice/guac and handmade tortillas for the fajitas. They also asked how we wanted the fajita steak done which I was super excited about. I've only ever had chewy and gross fajita meat, and it was nice to have something medium-rare. The veggies were perfectly grilled, too...having been used to soggy veggies this was refreshing! Green sauce was tasty, and guac was good too.   We got the tequila flight for $15, where you can pick one from each style of tequila. It was definitely interesting. With a 20% tip, the meal was about $70 dollars. Seems like a lot for some Mexican food, especially when you can get some dank Mexican food elsewhere in LV.   Although the food was good, the service was not - on all fronts. Waitress, hostess, etc. On those grounds, I probably wouldn't come back to Pink Taco unless somebody really wanted to go in the group I'm with.

kzzBThwN6CPF8todtIeMTg.text: We had an annoying server. You know the kind who doesn't care. Comes to the table after you have had the food a long time to check how everything is. The kind who lets your glass go dry and makes you wait for ever even while your eating. The kind who isn't very helpful when your trying to figure out what to order.   I ate here two years ago and loved it. Tonight I went with the pink taco which was good but ordinary. Last time what ever I had was amazing just couldn't remember think it might have been quesadillas because they make fresh homemade tortillas so my guess is I might have gone that route because there are few things better than fresh made flour tortillas in my opinion.   I remembered they had an amazing very hot salsa and it took a few minutes to drill it out of the server. Well worth the dollar upgrade fee in my opinion.   My other guess is I probably had guacamole last time because that's generally one of my favorites. But this server took the order and ran off before I had the chance to add it to my order.   I still enjoyed my meal. Diet Coke and chips with no green stuff. I'll take pink any day. Even with an annoying server this place is pretty good. And I'm someone who is very particular with my Mexican food

Ax-aspkpt-v20yIeCEEZ7g.text: We were famished on the way to Rehab and Pink Taco happens to be located in the same hotel right next door.  Our waitress was super friendly, great customer service!  I ordered the cheese enchiladas which comes with rice and beans...very tasty!  My friends ordered the shrimp tacos which also comes with rice and beans.  I am now an official fan of Pink Taco, best option before hanging out all day in the pool and drinking at Rehab.

UXGZYtXIdfBiJDJNSiUl5A.text: The food is ABSOLUTELY amazing . A Foodie's dream.  But Juliana has been absolutely horrific.  She took almost ten minutes to come over and greet us and take our drink order. She never brought our food to us personally Someone else had to run it to our table.  She Never once checked on us to see how our food was.  We had to ask for refills on our water and soda.  We then had to ask Anthony, who is a absolutely fabulous and has a killer mustache. You should go see it and him,  So. we had to ask him for Togo boxes    She then brought the check,  we asked for fresh Togo drinks because ours were watered down, and she said " uhhhhh.  I'll bring you cups." And because That's not what we asked for, I proceeded to ask Anthony to help us  and she stopped and said to us " don't talk to him, he is NOT you waiter" she then said to Anthony " don't go get those drinks"  so I told her  "well Juliana your service has actually been terrible actually, so we just wanted to get our stuff we asked for and go"  she then decided to argue with me and tell us that we  " rudely interrupted her while she was greeting guests"  so. Bring your butts in to the Pink Taco,  just decline any services from Juliana.

_29gQ3YJASzOt1sf_B78KA.text: Of the last few visits here, I most enjoyed my time at the bar. I had their sangria for the first time, and I recommend it. I was also given chips so fast at the bar, it was like they magically appeared! The salsa isn't spicy enough, but the chips are muy bueno. Also at the bar, my mango margarita was very good! Service at the bar was beyond fine, and I was always offered another beverage.   During a visit in the dining room, the shrimp tacos were the best of the lot we had. The beef tacos were OK, but I didn't love the fruit pieces (pineapple?) on them. The bacon wrapped jalepenos appetizer was ok, but also a disappointment. The taquitos are our go to item, and they never disappoint! Portions are good sized, and they do offer happy hour in the dining room. Happy hour is not offered, however, during Joint concert nights. Beware! The atmosphere is usually quite lively here, and the decor seems appropriate and inviting at the same time.

Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cFJ8W6mLuR2uvN5G_MFWYA.text: Pretty average. One of the more affordable places to eat inside the hard rock. They have a number of different tacos to choose from. I tried 3 and the best was definitely the Specialty Pink Taco (with chicken). I love the pickled onion on it. The crispy fish taco was not very crispy and actually tasted very fishy. The spicy mayo on it help cover up the poor quality fish a little. I also tried the ground beef taco which comes in a crispy shell and this one honestly reminded me of a Taco Bell taco. My friend ordered the Heavos Rancheros off the brunch menu and that was pretty good. If you are at the hard rock I think a better choice of places to eat would be Culinary Dropout or FU kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xl0K-Mgw9r-BgXHM-62xxQ.text: I went to Pink Taco for lunch with some girlfriends. We were at a conference inside of the Hard Rock. I ordered strawberry lemonade and the chicken fajitas plate. They also brought chips and salsas to our table. The fajitas were average. Not great, not bad. The service from the waiters was fine, but my friends said the bartender was rude to them (it was very crowded due to the conference, and apparently he was irritatedl). I wouldn't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KpNFEOXiOhIWN2lDigTrHA.text: I'd describe it as fine, but hardly the best option you have for the money, at $15-20 per entree.  My girlfriend and I shared a few $7 appetizers. She had the grilled octopus herself and loved it. We shared the chicken taquitos and vampiro chicken tacos. The taquitos were average. I wish they were crispier.  The chicken taquitos were pretty good though. They were very flavorful, but definitely on the salty and fatty side, and lacking a complementary flavor. I thought it tasted way better once I squeezed some lime on it.   The tortilla chips were below average. Our first batch wasn't warm. The second batch was only slightly warm. And both weren't crunchy or flavorful at all. It felt like they weren't the freshest either.  The service was fine, but not great. We sat at the bar. They did a good job of keeping the tortilla chips coming without us asking for more, which I personally appreciated, although I could see others not liking more food being shoved in their face without asking for it. They weren't very friendly though. I liked the vampiro chicken tacos but forgot what we ordered, so I asked one of the bartenders if he could remind me what is in this and he just said "chicken" and walked away. I thought that was a little cold.  I ended up feeling sick afterwards. My girlfriend didn't, and I initially figured it was just me. But then I was talking to my girlfriends mom after and when I mentioned that we just ate at Pink Taco, she mentioned that she doesn't like it there and got sick when she ate there. So idk, maybe somethings up.

d_HOztQtREokFbsEimVkqw.text: Deliciously flavorful Mexican food !  I have a very discerning palate when it comes Mexican food and Pink Tacos definitely hit the mark.  The chips and salsa are super tasty, as the salsa has a smoked flavor to it, it's not just tomatoes, onions, and cilantro thrown together.   My party had the street tacos, chicken enchiladas, nachos, fried chicken burrito, and my vegetarian wife had the chicken tortilla soup, minus the chicken.  Everything had flavor, meaning each ingredient had a flavor, it wasn't just a bunch of ingredients thrown together and then seasoned.  I would highly recommend Pink Tacos and will be back again soon!  They also have great happy hour specials.

fN0ubg5SsCOPEeKubotSmg.text: First time going , I honestly was not expecting the tacos to be good but they were really good , decent prices big thumbs up for them . Only thing I didn't not like was I walked in and the place was kind of empty and it took about 5 minutes before anyone knew we were standing there , once seated mostly everything was good , just that the server did not refill our drinks ,5 stars for good food

raZuOzmnd4H0BcG-WR57tw.text: The Hard Rock has some of the most amazing staff. Every restaurant was quick, friendly, and very chill especially at Pink Taco.   The pink tacos were tasty and filled me up quick. The side of beans and rice definitely helped with that.   The chips and salsa are so tasty I was shocked. Not too thin of chips but also not too thick. The salsa had lots of flavor that put you right there.   This place was good and fast. If you want something easy to grab, tastes good, with good service - go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VrnrsOAw-JHiFqytGW_wKw.text: Located in the Hard Rock hotel. Decent Mexican food, quality server, decent prices for Vegas. Unfortunately they only offer red or white wine one choice of each and don't offer a corkage fee/option. That's my drink of choice so a little unaccommodating. My only real complaint is they don't tell you that if you are going to the concert, right next door, you can't bring in your leftovers. I understand no outside food, but it's literally 10 steps away. They won't store or hold it for you either. If that's the policy, the server should mention before you order so you can plan accordingly.  Tequila sampler was fun and reasonable.  Would rate a 4 if not for the wine selection and leftover frustration.

g6sPr-9mODfvKmT8hpfP_Q.text: This review is for happy hour. Please check out my revised happy hour menu as it has recently changed (as of Jan 2018)  Overall I feel like if you can make the time, happy hour is a great value. We had a $30 food credit to burn between me and my husband and we put it to good use. We got to try a lot of different things:  Steak skewers - These were fantastic. We liked them so much we got a second order.   Grilled octopus - pretty good. Not a huge portion but I'm a fan of octopus and it ain't usually cheap so I thought this was a good value.   Vampiro chicken tacos - Eh I wasn't crazy about these. I'd skip them next time. They were fun to try.   I also wanted a salad but didn't want to pay a lot, so you can actually order a half salad which was perfect because it was just enough for me.   My husband also liked the 2 for 1 beer special going on.   All in all a solid choice for happy hour to try some fun stuff. We will have to come back for a regular meal although it won't be as cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Mexican Chopped Salad
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vampiro chicken tacos

3YZPqd2gshJrz8na-YV87g.text: Should have been 5 stars for Brian D but his partner (black dude) ruined it... over charged for a drink and was texting on his cell phone. Make sure you sit in Brian Ds section and only order from him so he can treat you right! Happy hour is good. They have good margaritas and vegetarian options.

eyguj6JJNufYeHNdidc9ow.text: We stayed at the Paradise Tower in the Hard Rock on our last night in Vegas. Convenience is key especially when it comes to meals and pressed for time.   We walked into Pink Taco on Saturday night, it was pretty packed but our group of four was sat right away. My friends got the fajitas, tamales, tacos and I got the burrito. The plates were really big serving and they had to take boxes home, I finished my burrito there. It was really good.   We also ordered the guacamole for the table as an appetizer, yum! It was gone lightning fast. Service was good, not exceptional or poor. Prices inflated because its Vegas but on par with everything else on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

il46QwSnLepG0ymLwoKRDw.text: All my friends said I had to go here when I went to Vegas for the first time, so I went.  I did like it.  I really liked the drinks.  We sat outside in the backyard, which overlooks the pool and was nice.  I think I'd prefer that than sitting inside.  We had chips and salsa, and coming from TX, the salsa wasn't half bad.  We also had the Tostada de Mariscos...which were really tasty.  And... of course... I had to get a shirt...because what female doesn't want to walk around with a "Pink Taco" shirt?  LOL  :)

9wuA0o6rtnLpXA68NZyy8w.text: I always have to drop by this place at least once when I visit Vegas. It's a pretty cool spot that has the poker machines at the bar and lots of seating inside. You get a view of the pool area so during summer you can see all the action aka drunk people lol.   So I always tend to get the regular tacos because their tortillas are freshly made all day long. I can admit I think the flower tortillas were just way better then the corn but that's my opinion. I tried the pink taco for the first time and it was really good they have pickled onions on top. But to be honest it's the deep fried ice cream that always gets me. For some reason this time around maybe because of the holidays they gave us 3 different kinds of deep fried ice cream. 1 regular which I think is corn flakes around it, the other fruity pebbles and the last coco pebbles omg it was to die for. Trust me you won't be let down trying this spot out. I mean who doesn't love tacos and alcohol lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried ice cream special
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panty dropper

PUmBQJF5k_OBWuLepikBAQ.text: Was very surprised at the food. It was really good and fairly priced. We got two orders of street tacos, the special Pink Tacos and the pork tacos with pineapple salsa. The Pink tacos were different than anything ive ever had but so freakin good. The pork tacos were good, but i would have rather had more of the pink tacos! Also the pink Cadillac margarita was amazing! Totally recommend if you are at the hard rock!

M6IG7hHmD1O3gV8k8I71KQ.text: Everything was going so well! You walk in, and a woman is making flour tortillas, and the service is as warm as their tortillas, but then they forget about you. It's been about forty minutes sitting here, And she hasn't even checked in on us twice!  Food is good, but service definitely doesn't want to make you come back.

0gxNiPYwn63RuWoBLMm3gw.text: Appetizers: Guacamole - The guac was blah... we make better guacamole at home.    Tamales: I ordered a Jefe's Especial tamale... it was delicious!  Lots of flavor!  Fajitas: My husband ordered the combo fajitas (chicken and steak).  The meat was so tender and flavorful.  Lots of veggies, rice, beans and the tortillas are amazing, so fresh!  Street Tacos: I ordered 3 Al Carbon chicken tacos.  Again, the chicken had lots of flavor!

YUwow7KYqfMCeH52uiMq6A.text: Service was good. Food was awesome. Amazing guac and salsa. Only issue: ordered virgin pina colada and got the real thing. I'm under 21.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing chicken burrito. Best green sauce ever
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb.com chips and dips. Alcoholic piña colada when asked for virgin

x12jnivr83GgHY5Y5IsOog.text: The staff was very rude to my party- I complained to the management - nothing was done- I even talked to the manager of hard rock! Nothing!  All the manager of the restaurant said was he was not a nice person!! Really - don't go there- no one cares about the customers !! No one at the hotel cares either! Very disappointed with hotel and restaurant!

30q1oeL3NjarF8VBOj4PCQ.text: Food $10 lunch special. The tacos were ok. It didn't have that much meat but it was tasty enough. I would've like a variety of tacos instead of getting three of the same tacos. It came with beans and rice. The salsa and chips had no flavor and the salsa was too watery.  Decor Reminds me of a Hooters.  Service Excellent service. Then again there were only a few of us here.  Would I come here again? Probably not.

R9CB9_Ec2sYi8_pj5HyjYQ.text: What happened Pink Taco?! Ever since you updated the menu, the carne asada tacos have not been the same. First the portions got smaller with an attempt at "gourmet plating, then regular size portions were brought back but the quality of the food was not as good as the first time.  I use to love eating their carne asada tacos, but no more. On this last visit, the meat was so over cooked it tasted like very dry and old beef jerky! They no longer use real guacamole! Instead, they squirt avocado crema which is very nasty! It is a pale green color hue with a mayo aftertaste! Gross!!  The margaritas were a little too sweat and I recall them tasting way better in the past. Not too sweet and you could  taste the fresh squeezed lime.  My friend had the grilled fish tacos and she said her fish was not fresh and was dry!  The chips n salsa are good, the service is fine and they have a great bar to gamble and watch sports. I miss the old Pink Taco menu. Please bring it back Harry Morton!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos

JFwps1JXuZXPwfz5lrF7EQ.text: Stayed at the hotel for a meeting. Manager wanted to eat at the Pink Taco.  Got horribly sick, diarrhea, nausea, fever, couldn't get out of bed for three days. It's been six days and just starting to feel better (still queezy). The place should be shut down.

4gHQWLITFrMIWSNT7ZvfqQ.text: The skillet fajitas are about the only thing worth getting here. I don't know if I wasn't drunk enough to appreciate the food or what, but it was extremely mediocre.  Chips and salsa are generic, salsa lacks any sort of kick. Not sure why each table gets two bowls of the same salsa either, unless someone made a mistake. Speaking of service, it was also very basic- barely saw my waitress, was never asked how the food was, only got a smile out of her when we got the bill.  I had high hopes for the ahi tacos, but the fish, though fresh, is not marinated or seasoned in any way- rendering the order bland, basic, and boring. For $16, even downtown, it should have some sort of flavor.  Subtracted an additional star for lying about happy hour- HR website says it's 3-7PM, Mon-Fri. Waitress says they don't have one, when I mention the site she states it's at the bar only, and there is no food on it. Not True, but apparently they don't honor it if there's a performance on premises that day. You'd think they'd encourage people to eat on property and spend more money, guess not...

C14keFirhBw7eNQrN9GQHQ.text: Went for brunch. Service was good & food wasn't bad. Would I crave it & go out of my way to go back? No.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

Lcs4cSk8u1HTauEytU0ZGQ.text: It's okay. Food is okay. Service is okay. A/C would be nice. It's scorching hot inside, and outside (during the day). Only savior is a breeze outside in the evening. 24 Hour Roberto's across the street is much better.

I-mrRok4fR5LPCTHNTo4cQ.text: The stuffed bacon wrapped peppers are a must. Very delicious. The carne Asada was delicious. Service very fast and friendly. Would recommend if you are staying at the Hard Rock. Drinks are a little pricey and just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed bacon wrapped jalapeños.

c0RteD9NC-bFi5ZXIBuFzg.text: The watress Heather is great and food is excellent and friendly. We spend our Thanksgiving dinner here.

QTh8HABcSLDXHGQLJb7SzA.text: Pink Taco serves up pretty decent tacos. Even better if you're drunk (they have a full bar). Come here when you need a little food break from Rehab (pool party) next door. It's right behind the pool party located at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino.   The chicken tacos were the best. Well seasoned and had a good amount of sauce. On the other hand, the shrimp tacos were lackluster. They didn't have any sauce ( I used some from my chicken tacos) and the fish was fried. I was hoping it was fresh shrimp and instead it tasted like it was previously frozen. Please, make the shrimp tacos with all the same fixings as the chicken and they'd be much better.   All-in-all, a cute place with cute decor and good tacos!

QR8NwEz_GmcnBofDmMHjCg.text: Out for an early Galentines day. First time here for all of us. We checked the online menu before hand, so we didn't take to long deciding when we were there. We saw that they had a happy hour unless there was an event at The Joint ( which for a Friday night that is almost a guarantee). When we got there, we told them we didn't have as many in our party that we reserved, so she asked us to wait while she pulled the tables apart. Mind you there were only maybe six people in there.  We chose the bench when we booked, which is pretty hard. We asked about the happy hour. When I told her what we saw online, she told me that it had changed the beginning of the year. The times shrunk by two hours, it is only happy hour at the bar, but she did ask the manager to accommodate us and make an exception. For being a pescitarian and not being able to eat flour, there wasn't much on there for me. So, our waitress helped me choose something.  The employees were really nice. The food was good and the drinks were great. My first time have white sangria, and I really liked it. It looked like they also have out door seating, but not completely sure. I have wanted to try this place for a while, and I am glad I finally got the chance.

bd6ZZpcfQAKQbkdJhPSGng.text: Thank you for handling our food service issues so well.  We certainly understand that things happen, but it's all in how the restaurant handles the problems. You guys did  a great job and we appreciate it.  The second round of food was delicious!!

7M8NipQ1gKP59HbSLZJs5Q.text: Food was great and service was good although it was a little slower than I expected. Although the restaurant was busy I would have expected more staff possibly, a lot of time was spent waiting on drinks.

hXHa0TIFEjjD5A-TS5ncqw.text: My girlfriend and I Ordered some appetizers and drinks, our waitress came back and wrote down my girlfriends order then took off without taking my order. Didn't see her until she brought the check. We split the food and it was delicious but I wish I could've enjoyed what I wanted to order. I couldn't bring myself not to tip her so therefore I'm writing this review. The food is great, just don't go when it's busy I guess!

gwLn7vxuH0P_tdj4GzMuQw.text: A group of us are working at the Hard Rock this week, so we head to the "pink taco" for lunch. The idea of a party of ten clearly freaked out the hostess even though the place was a quarter full. Then they tried to seat us outside where its 106 degrees out not quite understanding we're in business clothes and not bathing suits. Not the best training here for the FOH it seems. Once we were seated the service was fine.  The food is white people Mexican, so that's what to expect. Most people love that shit so go nuts. My veggie burrito was OK, although the sauce on top was pretty bitter and no one seemed too stoked on their food. Once again, what do you expect.  The worst part is the name. I'm a pretty crass person, but the idea of a business meeting full of foul business bros coming up with this idea for a vagina innuendo and then probably hi fiving about it gives me the fucking creeps.   I'm going to open up a competing place called the "Salty Pickle"...maybe it'll serve "Cock-tales". Hi five bro!

QGXM4JZCwekono-gyowOnQ.text: Ate dinner here around 5 pm on a Friday. Overall service was terrible - indifferent and inattentive, and the food quality was mediocre at best. It took a LONG time to be seated. There were several guests standing with me waiting to be seated, and several staff 3 feet away, but none of them acknowledged us, no one told us someone would be there to seat us shortly, not even eye contact or a smile. So totally unacceptable given they really were not that busy. When my food was delivered it was lukewarm and really only average taste. Recommend avoiding this place.

NtHJLp63gUFdkfddsMkKpA.text: Pink Taco Margarita where have you been all my life? Hibiscus Juice + Lime + Tequila, you naughty naughty girl!  give me more. $10 each? ok. its Vegas.  ok, ok, ok. I am calming down. take a breath. inhale. exhale.  (clears throat ) Yes, the Pink Taco Margarita is a lovely drink. The Pink Tacos were actually just ok, but I like the pink onions. You get three, and they are little, which is good because the are pretty filling. It comes with rice and beans, but I asked for a salad instead.  We all ordered the same thing and were more satisfied by the innuendo than the food. The service was ok. not memorable.    I had to talk my boyfriend out of getting a pink taco shirt because although it is funny to those who understand that it is a bar and a pun, it comes off as really trashy to everyone else. like my mom.  by the way.....their motto is,  "Eating Out Never Tasted So Good". ewe.

f2ZedIAcJtP5sD1zjPePzg.text: I thought the Pink Taco was pretty good. I am not sure about the who gastro intestinal issues other reviewers have had, and I am not sure anyone on Yelp really wants to hear about that.   Here is the long and the short of the matter. This place is solid. they make all of their own tortillas and chips. I really liked the shrimp tacos. They did a nice job of cooking the shrimp without over cooking them. In addition they had fresh avocado and a spicy mayo sauce thati was just fantastic.   They always have cold beer and rock on the radio. The atmosphere is pretty electric and the wait staff is very friendly. Make this spot a place to go on your Vegas trip!

uWN8OME-HhGyT04fbYG4Iw.text: ***UPDATE: 6/23***  Again, GREAT pink tacos (chicken, etc.).  Tried the app platter this time..split between 4 ladies.  YUMMY!  Had the guac...also yummy!  Great service, SUPER FAST...server didn't mind us walking to the bar in order to take advantage of two for one margarita happy hour until 7pm.  Left incredibly stuffed.   Found out that for parties of ten or more reservations are not usually allowed unless the whole party wants to eat from a set menu for a minimum price of $30 per person, not including drinks.  We happened to speak to a great gal who was able to help us out a bit after a few days.   ********************************  Happy hour margaritas are the best....friday until around 6 I think.   Tacos are yummy.  All food is yummy actually.  Fun crowd.  : )

GQ5j17UGScnB-QK07YiRmQ.text: The Pink Taco is a mediocre place with a clever name.  The clever name suits the Hard Rock clientele perfectly so the place is always bustling.  I came here for lunch once and had to get a seat at the bar because there was a lunch wait for a table - that's definitely different.  Unfortunately, the wait is more a reflection of the 'hey, who wants to eat at Pink Taco (giggle, giggle)' mentality than of the food.  I've had better Mexican food at a Chevy's for chrissake.  There's just nothing fun or different about it.  The restaurant itself is visually interesting and there's balcony seating by the pool, so that's nice.  Nice just kinda sums up the entire place.  And who wants to be called 'nice?'

qm-UfMPBg44gJALzaNAQjQ.text: I don't know why people think this place is good. Although the service is great this place does not serve authentic Mexican food. To begin with, the rice is not Mexican. They serve white rice mixed with canned vegetables. The salsa is also not freshly made. The nearest taco shop has better salsa. I ordered  a combination plate which came with a Chile relleno, a veggie taco and a rajas tamal. The veggie taco was the most edible thing on my plate. It cost $18. Maybe I am being harsh because I am Mexican and I know what Mexican food should be like. I also ordered a guacamole appetizer and that was a 3.5 out 5 stars. In all, this place is way over priced for the quality of food they serve. Good luck if you come here.

ScbufauL56HHcMY4q9jDsg.text: Pretty darn good. Fresh, fun and delicious.  The tortillas are all homemade in the front of the restaurant and are awesome! The chips are also fresh and very good.  The pink tacos are pretty original with pink onions (pickled?) beans and grilled chicken. They come with rice and beans. I didn't care for the rice  - it was pretty tasteless and boring.

DcA3NlllRgbQogFqH4KfRw.text: My favorite Mexican food joint in Las Vegas.  YUMM  Okay, this is one of the ways I judge a Mexican food place, the chips and salsa.  If the chips are good, I will ALWAYS be back.  Below is a typical order that I get with friends.  In case we someday meet, you'll know what to prepare yourself for.  Appetizers:  Queso Dip and Beer Battered Rock Shrimp.  Entrees:  Mexican Turkey Chopped Salad, Carnitas Platter, or Sabana de Pollo.  Stick with these favorites and you won't go wrong!

IpA3ZrDhBVMyiO-jDwth7Q.text: Stay away.  I've eaten at the Pink Taco three times and got food poisoning twice.  I should have known better, but I thought the first food poisoning event was a fluke and decided to go back.  What a mistake.

j_oW2psQ2L8c8R1Bpq0pcg.text: Wow...overrated much? I eat out practically every meal, and on this occasion, I was having out with some co-workers to snag an early lunch (around noon). We were seated right away, but it took the server a good 10-15 minutes to bring us water, or ask us if we are ready to order food. This was pre-lunch rush, so I don't understand what took them so long. Especially because they seemed well-staffed...actually a tad over-staffed??? Many employees were hanging out doing nothing, and it was a bit aggravating to wait for someone to really notice your group.  I ordered an appetizer (which was decent, but small portions) and the Pink Taco Platter (chicken, beans, picked onions, avocado). Honestly, the food was terrible. Chicken was sorta cold, the beans were mushy, the picked onions didn't do much and the taco shell was oily as hell. My colleague was a bit underwhelmed with the service delay, and how we were practically full before our main order was even taken (Due to the abundance of complimentary tortilla chips being served by our non-waiter).  On the drive back, all of us mutually agreed that this was a very underwhelming dining experience. I wouldn't mind going back to this place for the drinks, but when you have a place called Pink Taco that serves shitty tacos...its game over!

m-KbIQ9bHOGxgUYGL5zdtw.text: I love gambling, partying and obviously I love to eat so naturally Las Vegas is one of my favorite places to visit. I have been to Las Vegas a few times and Pink Taco has always been one of my favorite and more afforadable places to dine. Unfortunately, on my last visit, I was a bit disappointed. I don't know it if was my selection or if they have just simple fell off, but the joy I typically have eating there just was not there. The portion size was good, the prices average and the service was what you typically expect, but the food itself was just not that good. I ordered the Carne Asada Tacos and it lacked something (aka flavor). I had to added so much hot sauce to make it taste an ounce of what it should & steak naturally has a bit a flavor so I am not quite sure why that was. And although they use fresh corn tortillas, it still could not save the taste of these tacos. On the other hand, the chips and salsa were pretty good, but I hardly expect that free chips and salsa can make up for mediocre food you actually pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito Tradicional
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gvSPiMCTM45q_VLZ-xTiiQ.text: With a name like "Pink Taco" you'd be a fool to expect authentic Mexican food. This is a place to drink and be seen, and not experience good food. My fish taco was a little heavy with the oil and the salsas were a bit watered down.   Note to self: only buy drinks here next time.

trkaQI2z41zA7Xji63g3pw.text: I live here in vegas and I love this place.  For a strip resteraunt it is cheap and has a great and fun atmosphere, one of your best casual dinning places on the strip.  The food is great and taste hand made, there is a lady usually making tortillas from scratch when you walk in. The chili rubbed skirt steak is dynamite and all the tacos are good too.  The chips and salsa also rock.  If this place wasn't on the strip I would eat here more.  Do expect a long wait but what do you expect.  Better than T&T at the Luxor.

5_csrV-tk7qM440MuA4fTw.text: OMG, where do I start? The atmosphere is sooo cool; it fits nicely in the Hard Rock Hotel. It doesn't get any more rock and roll meets cool mexican restaurant.  The service is fantastic! The food is amazing! You have to try the sweet corn tamales! When we travel, I don't like to eat at the same places because I want to experience more, but we ate here 3 times on our last trip to vegas! It can get expensive, especially with cocktails, but overall, awesome and worth the money!

Hcop6OZO-nDaNPEsXwI1jA.text: Came here during our visit Super Bowl weekend. Although the food wasn't terrible- we came for happy hour and there were girls coming around our table and giving away free apps and got to try their margarita, so that was nice. Can't beat free tasty food right? Well the nice experience was soon forgotten the second my boyfriend pointed out a huuuge cockroach!! It was literally the size of a small rat, and I was squirming out of disgust and freaking out as I watched it crawl around and under bar tables thinking SOMEONE would notice a huge cockroach running around. No one noticed! I had to get the hell out of there before I started puking all over the place. I will never Ever return!!! Iccckk!!

pTMX_30ABMjeCy4f7rOIyQ.text: How can a place called the Pink Taco not have killer tacos on the happy hour menu?    I had high hopes for this place and they let me down.  Service is slow,  corn tortillas were not good, steak filling was ok, and drinks were a little watered down.  The only really good thing was the bucket of warm chips . This place should take a happy hour lesson from Tommy Bahamas!  They have killer tacos!

-TH3Z9QO5HJnkuu1aWDZbw.text: This place was OK... i hadn't eaten all day so I decided to come down here and sit at the bar by myself at around 6:00 PM to get some food in me.  Mexican food I guess... I ordered the grilled salmon dish... came with some grilled veggies and some potatoey mash and some kind of glaze... it was good.  not great, not bad.. just OK... overpriced I guess, but everything in Vegas is...the salsa that comes w/ the free chips was really weak.. they give you 3 salsas and they were all weak.  Nothing really special about this place.... kinda what you expect from a Vegas-hotel mexican place.

yGuUI81e0LJCKWpcnvC7Gg.text: Pretty good food and great service, but we were sitting next to a really really really drunk guy who threatened to beat us up just for glancing at him.  He was removed pretty quickly though, so that was nice!

TNWpM3vdvlxRstFWHVy5QQ.text: Good tequila! We waited a while and the food was ok but we just had appetizers. We have been there before and had a 4-5 star experience. We had the pink tacos last time and they were great. The service was also better last time maybe because it wasn't so busy. I would recommend them still and will give them another chance.

okMUvoeJTIgGjWO6ogE_2A.text: Stayed at Hard Rock over the weekend and tried Pink Taco for the first time in LV. Good service, cold beer, and tacos were pretty tasty. I rate it a 4.5 out of five, as the salsa didn't have much of a kick. Definitely worth another trip Definitely would revisit!

KdGnkTVZVZXFBxQfDizSAw.text: Well im going to start off my first review with a really good one.  In june 2008 me and my buddy were going to an august burns red/ as i lay dying concert @ the old joint @ hard rock. We had time to kill so we ate at pink taco. I ordered the chimichanga meal. Around 12 bucks at the time but man it was awesome . Had some chipotle sauce and free chips and salsa with guac.... Awesome. And usually coronas taste a bit burnt and bitter but not here. I mean they taste really fresh and heavenly. This place is legit!

qjzOwSwz7j2E5Zc6JDHgAA.text: Authentic Mexican food. The fish tacos and quesadillas are to die for. And yay for the happy hour deals!

wEhI_LxcjsRRD2uxYYO_hw.text: I had a good time at pink taco; The chips were warm and I loved the margaritas. The food was satisfying, nothing extraordinary but not too bad. Nice decor, a little dark but who cares when you're in Vegas. The pool is right behind the restaurant but I haven't been there yet although it looked pretty inviting... lots of eye candy.

k7MX29srds2qsDLr62PRKA.text: i didnt know what rating to give. its a toss up or should i say -- its a crap shoot. hahha 1.chips and salsa - good 2. vegan salad and rolled tacos - good 3. beer and tequila - goooood 4. is where i have a problem - seeing guys from AFI ? does pink taco get another star cause we seen those guys?? - good?? 5. eating pink taco 2 days in a row - not good!!! unless you need to "cleanse" if you know what i mean.

XNzVo3LGU5rJPSoFxXIO4w.text: The place is mediocre. First of all, I may be biased because I'm not one who goes ga-ga over Mexican food. But, they do serve a nice portion of free tortilla chips with 3 different salsas which was very nice. I bought a cheese and chicken enchillada meal which was decent, but like I said Mexican food to me is just bleh. We sat outside and they have outdoor heaters, sadly the heaters get way too hot and the temperature can't be adjusted--either it's too hot or you just leave the thing off cause it feels like you're getting sunburned sitting under it. Once the meal was over, they give these fortune cookie-like pink tacos. Honestly, they taste like shit. Everyone at the table took one bit and put it back down. Ick. Anyway, it's a good place for groups and service wasn't bad.

d67FjngR5du_UAcj3tQ95g.text: This place is soooo much fun! Great food and good concept. Who doesn't like pink tacos??? If you wanna start off a night of drinking this is the place to go. The location is not the best. It's in the old person casino- but I think its worth the trek.

I6J05iiiEXZ3GoOa9uHJxQ.text: We used to frequent this place quite a bit when we were locals and were happy to return. We split a pitcher of sangria and it was enough to make us happy! We also ordered the queso bean dip (love this stuff!) but the real standout were the potato taquitos. Soo good and unexpected! Our service was excellent and allowed us to take our time to finish that pitcher without felling rushed. This place is worth a visit!

aG2nUa1DMZTDqGJJlXytkg.text: Stopped by Pink Taco before the Santana show, great happy hour deals. Chips and 3 Salsas were fresh and tasty! The guacamole seemed over priced, but was worth it! Burrito Mojado was great! They had some new drinks on the menu, I had the Chupacabra...SPICY!! but loved it... not for the weak. Wife had the Pink, which was watermelon and mint, very refreshing. Great attentive service, highly recommend.

hbUEXRJro8RYkB4wYRuXKQ.text: No trip to Vegas is complete without stopping at the Pink Taco.  I love it.  The food is fine, but on a nice day -- say around 2 or 3 pm with the breeze whipping through the restaurant, I really feel like I'm on vacation.  Next stop: the Hard Rock pool.

vv1rqfhX-pYkWxyHETfcFA.text: The Guacamole had no flavor. Not necessarily memorable. The meat didn't taste authentically Mexican... but that's coming from an authentic Mexican. It was decorated nicely and I like pink tacos though, so... 3 stars.

VU5VZD7kE46QbUw13GTM6g.text: Ten years ago I would have recommended this restaurant. Today I cannot recommend it. The chicken is frozen and then heated. The cheese they use is nauseating. I took one bite and could not finish my meal. In the menu they do not tell you what type of cheese they use. The margaritas are weak. My tastes are not extravagant nor eccentric. I had looked forward to a great meal having not been there in ten years, but ended up being disappointed.

T5MfQsbOh0Qb54OYgdwA-Q.text: $45 all you can eat tacos and margaritas. Tacos were delicious, margaritas were OK.

zNuaP0PIAUMWHUthFHq37Q.text: Had the Mushroom Swiss with mayo..The hot dog was not good at all with a ton of mayo and hardly any Swiss. I will not go back considering that a lousy hot dog is $8.

hfkG6Sm_CGbmq6UMNz2w9g.text: One of the better values in vegas, this hip bastardized mexican place is pretty freakin good.  I got the baby back ribs marinated in some watermellon reduction.  Flan for desert was great.  1+ extra point for ironic  sexual innuendo in the name.

uK-5HkeBcuoRX9i-Fv9qqQ.text: I seriously think this place is super cute! A couple of my friends & I decided to eat at Pink Taco before a concert that we went to at the Hard Rock on March 25th, 2012. When we were planning our Concert day, I looked Pick Taco up to see what kind of food was served there. Two of us wanted to go there and two others wanted to go to Johnny Smalls. But when we got to the Hardrock we decided on Pink Taco because it was closer to the joint and because it just looked cute. We were taken to a table as soon as we got there. The atmosphere was great, and the service couldn't be better. The waiter was fun, and made us laugh. He checked on us a lot, as did other waiters. I really didn't know what to choose out of the menu and the waiter suggested the "Sabana de pollo con chimichurri". It was amazing, and had so much flavor. It was also afordable. All of my friends chose different dishes, and at the end they all loved the service and the food. Awesome, I cannot wait to go back!

0Fe0V6WBUOp3Tfj1sF4fPw.text: This has to be the worst Mexican food ever.  I'm not picky about authenticity - on the contrary, I grew up on Tex Mex and love it.  But I'm astounded that anyone could actually mess up queso dip.  It's spicy cheese dip, how did they manage to make it so totally gross?  Maybe it was partly because we had a divine meal at Nobu the night before, but it was awful and I would not eat there again.

4X8MACCpAxbWuSO16ewnCw.text: Happy hour 4-7. 1/2 off apps and 2-4-1 beers. Glad I went, my appetizer platter was tastey and HUGE! Went well with my Coronas. Nice way to start your trip in Vegas if you aren't ready to blow all your money on food.

1dGfuczsdRMohbD6-ptfIw.text: Hmmmm...naming a restaurant with an obscure anatomical reference is a bit distasteful. It is like naming a a pet store " The one eyed snake" or a seafood joint "The bearded clam". Maybe It is just my mind being in the gutter at all times. As for the food. I am not really a huge fan of Mexican food, so my review may already be biased. I had the asada burrito and it was nothing great. The meat was not any better than any other Mexican joint that I have experienced. Being located in the Hard Rock hotel, it definitely has a party like atmosphere This place is more about the social scene than the food.Party like a Mexican rock star!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

z7PlylbdgzZjQjYvTVa5GA.text: 07/04/08 - When I first walked in I was like WTF??? A taqueria inside of the HardRock Casino??? but I gotta say the atmosphere and the vibe was awsome! Lots of hot ladies getting their buzz on and decent music makes a good combo. The Talent was HOT also!!! The hostess was looking mighty proper! On top of great service the "Panuchos" (chicken tacos with pink onions) definetely hit the spot after all the beer!  They were really good! I would definetly eat here again.

haPwNFRW8qkJCtjTLcppfQ.text: the chips and salsa's were a great way to start and we hoped a good sign of things to come but we thought dinner went downhill from there. Food was bland and not real fresh. The staff was really attentive and we thought our waitress was top-notch but can't remember her name due to the all night bender which usually follows dinner in Vegas. I may go back but the Chile Rellenos is off the list now.

dkY_fGk6u0dooS33P4gp8g.text: If you like copious amounts of sodium, this is your place. They could easily rename this restaurant "Salt Death" and it would fit perfectly.   This is no place to write home about.   Do yourself a favor, get a beer or two at the bar before going to a better venue, take a picture in front of the PINK TACO neon sign, and then leave. Forget about this place, never go back.   I had the Chicken Fajitas, but I could have easily eaten the same exact meal at any Chili's restaurant or Chevy's any day of the week. The chips and salsa were decent. We asked for a top-shelf margarita and it was not that great.  The only amusing part of our meal was a large boned girl sitting at the bar with her friends. Her ENTIRE ass was hanging out the back of her pants. It was amusing, but did nothing to give this place more than 2 stars.   Sorry Pink Taco, I will never return. Just another part of the Hard Rock Hotel that sucks.

fzeZUM-rlteAJOPrLz_onQ.text: The food was disgusting!!!!  SALTY... coming from someone who orders salt on their Margarita rim. The beans were so salty it was just ridiculous, tacos were just as bad! Not to mention the fire alarm was ringing through our entire  lunch with no explanation as to why. The Hard Rock Hotel  gave us some coupon for a free Margarita but they couldn't take it because you have to sign up for some rewards program or something,  fine (not necessarily their fault ). Yet I  can't get over how disgusting  and salty that food was. You couldn't pay me to eat here again. 1 star by default. .. you can't do negative stars!

vqJHzEF1JpgiO3Cb2N-V9Q.text: this is a five star rating as you'll read by my review... but I'm afraid of the dreaded yelp bot hiding my review. So, first off, listing the address as Paradise road really doesn't do THIS taco joint justice.   It's located smake dab in the middle of The Hard Rock Hotel's Rehab Pool!!!    Are you kidding me?    You could go over to Chipotle on the strip and enjoy a taste of mexico amidst car fumes.... OR, sit like I am, looking out at a year around bikini season.   I don't even care if the food is good at all.   Oh and by the way, there isn't a friendlier staff in the business.   thanks folks.

ZL_mAQdHUCSPoDRTZWOXxQ.text: I come here a couple times a week.  Always cute girls working and only place you can jam out, get a great view of the pool and eat chips, salsa and a pork tamale for under $5 with a players card. Great value.

5IwG24kp0-AHsiC5rjySBQ.text: Pink Taco certainly went down hill this year.  My friend and I had been dying to return since our fabulous experience back in 2009, but we were sadly disappointed with our stale tortilla chips and wilted Vegetable Tostada Salads.    The worst part was that we had missed out on a 4* Japanese meal to dine here instead.  Our hopes of reliving the enjoyable Mexican experience were sadly squashed.

STEbYX89pkQbCc_DShYWfA.text: Fabulous upscale Mexican inside the Hard Rock Hotel.  They make fresh tortillas all day. The street tacos are the bomb- you get 3 per order and can choose from shrimp, mahi, shredded pirk, chicken and more. Super fresh guacamole and house made chips. Great house margaritas too! Love this place!

vEmQHDMYN9NzEa145x1llw.text: Dear Pink Taco, I so wanted to love you ever since my mom came to a catered event her several years ago. When I was picking out Restaurant.com certificates, I just knew I had to have you in my life. I love "upscale" Mexican food, and was hoping you could deliver. Sadly, you did not. Your hostesses sat us very quickly and I applaud the quick chip and salsa delivery. I didn't realize how hungry I was until your delicious salsas were in my face and your warm chips were breaking all over the table in my impatience. Little did I know this was to be the best of the meal. Your server took approximately a year to even take our drink order. Then, throughout the meal, he proceeded to commit two cardinal sins in a restaurant: asking if we were doing okay with his hands full and his back 3/4 turned away from us, as though we were an afterthought, and the second, putting the check down before asking if we wanted anything else. Pink Taco, this server did not earn his included 18%. On to your strange food choices. I ordered your famed Pink Tacos, which had little flavor until I added the aforementioned salsas. The tortillas were good, the pickled onions too, but the chicken and black bean paste were dull. I so wanted to like your taquitos, our chosen appetizer, but the flavor was strange and by only receiving 3 tiny taquitos for $7.50, I sighed for those who would pay full price for them. The bottom line, dear sweet Pink Taco, is that you have all the potential for a great awesome upscale Mexican food reinvention--great decor, interesting menu items, and a provocative (albeit silly) name. Somehow, you missed the mark and I hope we can be together again under better circumstances. Love, Molly T.

26Wla0sWsOaKuPwL_tGBqQ.text: Food is always amazing but the service is a hit or miss. The Shrimp Tacos and queso dip are the best. It is a bit pricey but you are inside The Hard Rock & the food is worth it :)  The bar & music is great & if you sit on the patio you can see the pool from your table which I love.

o4bdBZAoIy-cjerj23yd7g.text: Perfect hangover meal. We couldn't make it very far and decided on pink taco. It was very tasty. I enjoyed the burrito and guacamole, and the Bloody Mary was good even though I only took two sips. Nice atmosphere and staff was very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fDJG-E7bwd9rYU7vD8Jm2A.text: Try the relleno.  It's delicious.  Gr8 Mexican food Americanized nicely.  Beans, pork riblets, burritos enchiladas, tacos, etc are yummy.  Cocktails are off the chart but not cheap.  Fun ambiance w/party bar.  Service is swift and cordial.  Pink Taco is a cool eatery.

rcMR6HGIvegYgNkVZTi22Q.text: What a huge disappointment.  I am local and work in the vicinity of the Hard Rock.  The Pink Taco is generally pricey so I usually save lunch there for a special occasion and was willing to pay extra because of the quality of the food.  What have they done to this place?  First, they changed the menu and my favorite meal was not on the menu.  SO ok. . . I will try something else. . . The chips that came out were dripping with grease, and mostly not edible.  The chicken wings contained the driest chicken meat I have ever eaten.  The meat seemed frozen and old.  The chipolte ranch dipping sause was tasteless, seemed thin and watered down with no heat.    The taquitos were burned, served with a lump of so so guacamole.  I tried mixing the guacamole with the tasteless chipolte ranch sause to try to get something that tasted good and had a good texture.  This didn't work.  The margarita which was $12 tasted like a cheap glass of lemonade. . .Come on people. . .at least get the margurita right!    The manager did comp the chicken wings. . .We noticed that the people sitting next to us were less than thrilled with their meal as well. . .Whoever is in charge of this place now should be ashamed for taking a place where you could count on good atmosphere and good food into a gastronomic nightmare.    It will be a long long time before I go there again, if ever!

3HqqBbTPchPrgVVEpGs5Sw.text: Well where should I start. The service was horrible, it took them 20 minutes to ask if we wanted water. Then another 15 minutes for them to give us the chips that come with the table. We asked for the guacamole and chips and it never came leaving us with another 30 minutes or so waiting without an appetizer. The four of us order steak burritos which were good so that's why I gave them two stars. My overall experience was not good here and I will never go back to this restaurant. There are many wonderful places out there.

zUO5M5EQ0qIi_T8kJTvTrA.text: I take back what I said about the portion size of the chicken nachos changing. The chicken nachos appetizer is back to being huuuge. And it's still extremely delicious. Service here is always incredible. The deep fried ice cream apparently isn't on the menu anymore but they still serve it if you ask!

1MJu7Y4JwUnRyYoJVihVWg.text: The oh so famous Pink Taco.  Came here for Superbowl Sunday. Kind of dead if you ask me.   Had to try it. Was I blown away? Most definitely not. Service was okay. Would I come back? Probably not.

SXgncPvwK4RcZMnbcn5T4g.text: I do love this place. It is a bit of a tourist trap, but I like coming here, the food is good, the beers are cold and they chips and salsa don't stop coming. It has a great atmosphere and the staff are always happy.

csTaKMu8Qwl3FrxY3wA6Qg.text: We went here for dinner this weekend for something quick and easy before going out of the evening. The food is  over priced and not great Mexican food at all. I got a burrito with steak and it just wasn't good at all... My girlfriend got the fajita and I would recommend that dish over my burrito. I would go back and try the fajitas next time, but wouldn't go out of my way.

h658v_whTIQILdhFMqGk5w.text: I have eaten here three times and always gotten the nachos. I'm very big on nachos and this place has the best I've ever had.   The hostesses are always kinda rude, especially if you come in from the pool.   Service is decent, but those nachos are what bring me back.

fCyXBAZtITM9C8FqwvcEOg.text: Cool location and atmosphere.  I wasn't too impressed with my food however.  Guacamole with veggies was rockstar however my chicken burrito wet was the opposite and the chicken inside was quite dry.  I think with a little more marinading the chicken could have been great.  The margarita selection is good as well as many great tequilas.  I would return but order something else.

qKxyLAjY37Q0r9chrFi8xw.text: Both of the times I ate this food, I asked for it to-go so I could take it back to my room and devour it in private. The corn tamales were not very good. The quesadillas were good. This place just gives me a huge headache being inside of, but that's how I feel about most of Las Vegas, so I can't give it too much guff.

S5aynFW_DqJexHUgWDGjzw.text: I come here every time I go to Vegas. Good food and drinks! They always seem to change the chips and salsa though.

rq4G-0xpxa7I-VCH0FRM-Q.text: Awesome happy hour. Service was great. Food came fast. Everything tasted amazing. Best Salsa I have ever had.

W9tXwxnlQh2Z2QR7xAgNFg.text: I eat here on occasion the food is great service is decent if you order the quesadilla sometimes they'll hook it up with extremities other times they'll charge you i.e. Sour cream, guacamole. But that's only half time 50/50 but then again your in a casino.

0eV83e-_z-XcdKvFzwkOeA.text: Came here for happy hour because we were stating at the HRH. I was excited to try happy hour, but only a few of the appetizer offerings were 50% off. The waiter said that margaritas were buy one get one, but when the check was presented it us later we had been charged for both margaritas to find out that it's only the HOUSE margarita that is buy one get one free. That wasn't explained to us at all and pretty much ruined the chances of my ever coming back here again.   Ordered the tortilla soup (which was not a happy hour offering) which was pretty delicious and filling. We also got the appetizer platter and out of all the things on the platter I only like the sweet corn tamales.   Overall I would never come back here again and would just walk out of the hotel to get my meal fix. One suggestion for Pink Taco would be to have a clearly designated menu for just Happy Hour drinks and food - a lot of people would get screwed over less this way.

XUxGJjMeOlu1BdMtnK-3Tg.text: Pink Taco...clever name guys.  I visited this restaurant located in the Hard Rock Hotel on the last evening of my visit.  I ordered the fish taco plate which came out incredibly fast!  It seemed like the food was on our table within minutes of actually ordering it.    My hypothesis is that they have figured out how to manipulate the time-space continuum and are using this knowledge to gain that much needed edge in the restaurant business.  I could be wrong.  But, I digress; my girlfriend had come here before and loved their chili relleno.  So much so that she got it again!  Being from San Diego, it will be hard to please my appetite for Mexican, but Pink Taco made a valiant attempt.  I would not feel right giving this place a 4-star rating just because my dish would not hold up to some of the spots I'm used to in SD.    I would recommend it to anyone visiting the Hard Rock.

ARcRrQ7hsUPdN5SXV2lqbQ.text: Food is terrible. Chips were stale and the salsa tastes like it came from a grocery store brand. Tried the quesadilla for an app and burrito for dinner, neither were very good. Decent happy hour but if you're looking for restaurant option based on food taste and quality, I'd recommend skipping this one.

pTBCUEFS9FpYIa2oDuPpUw.text: This is a great place for breakfast lunch and dinner. Killer drinks and a great view too, they have a fabulous Sunday brunch that is second to none. The tortillas are all homemade. Cocktails are to die for

4aiATLL8sjC6hlFRa-wKYg.text: This place was a total surprise. We were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and starving when we arrived, so we decided to try it out. My margarita was great. The shrimp tacos had a great flavor and the portions were great especially for the price. I would highly recommend this place.

XCCDVy15mahJyxByfpb7rQ.text: Tried the KISS Gene Simmons inspired "All Hell's Breakin' Loose" Sizzling Molcajete last night.
