ajX51MhdM8gWOz5NwcmLoQ.text: Food was pretty good, but the terrible service received by bar tender, the black haired tattooed girl (Tonyah), ruined it completely.. Service was extremely slow, when asked for a refill, it was forgotten about, had to remind her 3 times for it. Then when asked for the bill to be split up, she responded with "Well they asked for it all together" (referring to the other two people in our party), then walked away. We had to flag her down again and she approached us saying "So how do you want the check",  I had simply asked for it to be separate, then she responded to me saying "Well I'm asking them" (referring to the other two people in my party) and rolled her eyes. I have never received service poorer or ruder than the service I received tonight. I am extremely disappointed that Pink Taco would allow employees to be that rude to their customers!

2vmftBu6nkjiq8UoEqdV0w.text: Found this amazing amazing place while we were out on vacation. Just finished competing with my fiance and we were looking for some delicious shareable food. The nachos were great to start as was the cheesy street corn, but the highlight of the night were the bacon wrapped stuff jalapenos. By far one of the best appetizers we've ever had.   Perfect combination of food.   The tacos were great as well. Definitely suggest this place if you're out in that direction.   Great service and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy corn, bacon stuff jalapeños, and the tower of nachos

ihSCFegZPhiqD36PyiPaPg.text: Pink Taco is a great place in the Hard Rock Casino.  Friends and I came here before seeing the wonderful Magic Mike show.  Service was friendly and quick without any chance of missing the show.  Of course they bring out complimentary chips and salsa for the table, but we still had to try their Zonkey Nachos.  Wonderful coverage of toppings that include guajillo sauce, queso, black beans, jalapenos, guac, sour cream and pico.  You can add chicken or carne asada but we opted out.  These nachos are great on their own and easily sharable. Nacho lovers like myself enjoyed these immensely.    Since there were 3 of us, their Street Tacos include 3! Perfect.  Plus you can order different options for the tacos.  My friends opted to try the famous Pink Taco as I opted for the Carne Asada.  All of us enjoyed our choices.  My taco had great flavor with the pico and cojita cheese.  Next time I will try the Pink Taco I promise.    Since it was my birthday, the waitress brought out a birthday surprise of their churros with ice cream on top.  So happy I was able to enjoy this tasty treat.  I would order these over and over again.    I plan on returning without hesitation.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street tacos - Carne Asada and Pink Tacos
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zonkey Nachos

58cF_74f_tzBRoBgIfxLUw.text: This location follows the tradition of the one in Hollywood, so expect that funky and funny decor, with the ambiance to match it. It's inside the Hard Rock Hotel, so it's geared towards a younger, more open clientele. I suggest you eat pink tacos here, so order the different versions they offer, they are all tasting great! Not sure if it's that pink pickled onion or the pink tortilla, or the beer next to it, but they go down great! Service seems to be spotty here, we had to ask someone if there was anyone tendering the bar, since no one showed up for a while. But once we had a bar tender everything was smooth and fun, they like to entertain with the customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K4Nf0_ydiHMhF0LpLYp9Lg.text: We came here for dinner before we watched the Magic Mike show for my niece's birthday. We made reservations and it took a while for us to be seated when we got there. Once we were seated they brought chips and salsa but our waitress took forever to come get our drink order. She took forever with everything honestly. When we asked if she could split our check because there were 8 of us she said, If I have time I can do it. It really wasn't that busy in there but I guess she wanted to make sure she got her gratuity. The food was ok and so was my drink but I felt it's just overpriced for what you get and the service being so crappy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tacos
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice and beans and condiments that come with the fajitas

Yy-jQkgJQ97s96XSmATZ5Q.text: The wife and I went to Pink Taco for dinner before heading to the Wednesday night Nine Inch Nails show at the Joint.  With the exception of Nobu and Mr. Lucky's, Pink Taco is likely the longest running restaurant in the Hard Rock.  Unfortunately, the food, the drinks, and the overall experience have seemingly been untouched by the passage of time.  I had the Pork Chili Verde ($14) and the wife had the Chicken Tinga Enchiladas ($13).  I liked my entree, a tasty if otherwise unremarkable braised pork in a flavorful green chile sauce, better than she did hers.  There was a small service slip as a food runner delivered my wife's correct entree, but with refried beans instead of her requested black beans.  The error was corrected promptly by our server.  We both had margaritas.  I had the Golden Cadillac and the wife had the Pink Cadillac.  Our drinks were fine, but nothing noteworthy other than their price.  Surprisingly (or perhaps not surprising at all), our drinks were more expensive than our food ($15 and $14, respectively).  In my opinion, though, they were a little overpriced even by Vegas standards.  On the whole, the food and drink was pretty standard Tex-Mex with a Vegas resort markup.  Pink Taco wasn't bad nor was it exceptional.  It was pretty much exactly what it has been since its inception.  As such, it has gone a bit stagnant, stale, and easily forgettable.  There are plenty of other places in town doing the essentially the same food and drink, but doing it better and at a better price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chile Verde

w8oHOtpkNHzdjTkLaH-pFQ.text: Pink Taco has been a convenient and delicious dinner option for me twice now before seeing Magic Mike. The service has been friendly and quick on both visits.   I love the flavor of the salsa that comes with the complimentary chips to start the meal. The Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos are delicious. It's hard to go wrong with bacon, loads of cheese, and jalapenos. The Zonkey Nachos are huge and were more than enough for three of us to share as an appetizer. We all loved the flavor of the sauce on the nachos and that the toppings were evenly covering the nachos. I could make a meal of just the nachos.  On my first visit the tacos didn't wow me. They weren't bad, but not the best tacos I've ever had. On my most recent visit I had Our Famous Pink Taco and thought it was delicious. The taco was a little on the greasy side, but everything in the taco worked well together. Our waitress said tacos could be mixed and matched. I'd recommend getting this as one of three tacos since it's on the heavy side.   The Churro dessert was so yummy! It was served as churro bites filled with caramel and topped with a nice scoop of ice cream. Our waitress overheard us talking about my friend's birthday and later appeared with a complimentary and delicious dessert. Nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon - Wrapped Jalapenos
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Chips &amp; Salsa

aMdvMox4FqQiQfzDrf7vLA.text: When a restaurant is "cleverly" named the "Pink Taco", I'm kind of expecting the lowest common denominator when it comes to food....so color me pleasantly surprised on the visit I had here. I went to the Hard Rock to visit my old Army bud who was in town and at the last minute he tells me he wants to go to Echo & Rig. Yeah on a Friday that's not going to happen without resos so we stayed in house and went to the Pink Taco.  There was a short line to get in but another set of friends got here before we did and secured us a table so in we went. We sat down and got two baskets of chips and salsa. My biggest weakness at Mexican restaurants are freshly fried casera chips and salsa. The ones at the Pink Taco are top shelf. The salsa was outstanding.  Minor annoyance. We arrived for happy hour but according to their policy on a day there is a concert at the Hard Rock, well, there's no happy hour. Interesting. Plus our waitress failed to tell us this before our friends went to the bar for drinks so they came back to the table not happy.  For my entree order I got the Zonkey Burrito wet with al pastor. I was shocked by how good it was. Now, the al pastor was tough enough that I would have mistaken it for carne asada but man it was overall flavorful and delicious. Inside the burrito was meaty with some pico and the red sauce was outstanding. I would definitely get this again. Our server was very cool even though someone in our party was a bit intoxicated and needed an extra bit of patience. Overall, other than the happy hour snafu I've got nothing bad to say about the Pink Taco. The food was delicious, the atmosphere was fun and the service was good. I'd go again which is the highest compliment I can give a place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet burrito with al pastor. I was surprised by how good it was. ($13.99 + tax)
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips &amp; salsa. The salsa was top shelf.

a_62Lq78ANbYaw6o9wi3YQ.text: Gotta love the motel  ... throw a little pink into the mic and ..Bam !! The decor and food are a good match !!

aVl4QB122-tFcUiyD1C8Fg.text: Located inside the Hard Rock, this restaurant is very neatly decorated and gives off a cool vibe.  Upon arrival to your table, you'll receive a basket of chips and tasty salsa.    I ordered the cheese enchiladas and they were pretty small.  They were too salty for my liking but not enough to turn away.  Our service to a party of eight was 5-stars.

abXnIGrjfqjj3biWSoN6wQ.text: Pink Taco looked like the best option for a quick pre-concert dinner in Hard Rock, and it was very convenient, as we didn't have to leave the hotel!   = F O O D = They start you off with complimentary chips and salsa. The pink chips are a cute touch.  + PORK TAMALES ($14): Even though you can get a whole bag of tamales that taste just like these from Costco for about the same price, this plate is probably the best bang for your buck. Two tamales with a side of rice and beans really hit the spot, and it was so comforting.   + GUACAMOLE ($9): Jesus, did they use cruelty-free, free range avocados to have it cost so much?? I didn't order this, but my friend was totally caught off guard once the bill came in. The serving is not that big, and it does taste good, but...$9 for that?  = S E R V I C E = Service was excellent! Our waitress was friendly, and answered all my questions. There was a vegan in our party, and she was quick to find menu accommodations for her.  Don't go out of your way for Pink Taco. It was average at best, and expensive for what it is.   ==== Food: 3 // Service: 5 // Environment: 4 // Price: 2

WtjtPfQJCFYmJ_dEdc-BJQ.text: Yes! Great place to eat before a concert! They have delicious margaritas! I ordered the street tacos and decided to try pork for a change. It was a good call on my part, I loved the taste with the salsa they topped it with. I think it was a mango salsa. My friend ordered the nachos, it was a really big appetizer platter! The dish would be good to share with a friend, so keep that in mind when you go here! They do take reservations! So you can plan ahead!

0svLlkakJuf1zd6dzpvlWg.text: When going to a Mexican restaurant inside a Las Vegas hotel, one must always go in with some side eye. You know what you came for (tacos), and you know it isn't going to be super cheap, so just suck it up and eat.  The inside decor reminds me of when you mistakenly walk into a bar on a tourist trap street. If you squint really really hard, hey you're in Mexico!  The tacos were good, nothing fancy. Margaritas were on point. If there's a show at HRH that night, there's no happy hour, which sucks.

BLkzjhztfVmcb-Y5bhbeMw.text: First time eating here and was pleasantly surprised. Our waitress was extremely busy, but always took great care of us. Loved their chips and salsa. Also our entrees were yummy and the margarita pitchers were a great group option. They weren't super strong, but they give you a cool Pink Taco key chain with each pitcher you order.  I had the carne asada tacos and I tried one of the shrimp tacos, both were very tasty. I'd definitely go back if I'm craving some Mexican food.   Tip: Get the bacon wrapped jalapenos if your looking at an appetizer, so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos were tasty!
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OIfjhW2m7yfxE2cmbHbVOQ.text: I have had many delicious tacos from my time in CA.  The pink tacos are really unique and delicious.  It starts with the reddish color of the tortilla. Even more unique is that although it is a soft taco, the shell has a slightly crispy exterior.  It's hard to describe, the lightly crisp exterior adds a great texture to the overall flavor of the taco, but it is nothing like a standard taco shell.  The chicken in the taco is balanced out with the flavor of the pickled red onion.  I never thought pickled red onion would be in a taco, but I'm glad it is.  What a fabulous flavor!  By the way, you do get 3 tacos per order.  You can get refried beans and spanish rice added to your order for another $4.  Free chips and salsa are good as well, but you will enjoy the pink tacos.

ktQF7n63qttK7SO2eOs0Jg.text: Not terrible, but not a first choice for tacos on the strip either.  If you don't want to wander too far from the hotel, I can understand eating here.  But go a few blocks down for that of you can.

RBMf2bNQmQYe1wcfUwWisw.text: I'm giving this even two stars because of the friendly wait staff, the fun environment, and a few items I did really like.  I ate here twice while working on a production at The Joint in the Hard Rock.    The items I do actually like a lot: the salsa, the ceviche, the guacamole, and the fruit salad.  Those are all worth snacking on if you're there for a few drinks and light food.   The tuna tacos are okay but a little bland, and the fish tacospretty flavorless too.  Mostly the rest of the food is bland.  When I say "bland", I don't mean salt-free; I mean just cardboard-flavor-like.  The refried beans taste canned, and the rice is just run-of-the-mill "blah".  None of the entrees really tasted that great, and other than a fun atmosphere and snacking, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there again for the prices they're charging vs. the quality.   Honestly, I'd rather eat at Mr. Lucky's inside the Hard Rock any time over Pink Taco.

sZPIU0aIcVdePr4sBGTROg.text: After I got over being a 14 year-old and laughing at the name, I really enjoyed my food here.  The portion size was VERY big (wasn't able to finish my rice and beans), and I probably could have avoided the chips (which are pink) and salsa before had to save room...  But either way, I was happy.  The service was friendly and prompt, and the atmosphere was OK as well.  The tables were a little awkward for me (the height of the seats in relation to the floor and the table was weird), and the environment was extremely dark, so I'm giving it a 4/5 this time around.

nDtHTxWledeJn-FH-Ae8QA.text: If you are staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, this is a great place to grab a seat at the bar and have some chips and salsa.  The food is pretty good too for Mexican Food in a Casino Hotel.  Nothing like a shot of tequila, a cerveza and some tacos to start or end your night in Vegas.  This hotel has some great food places inside.  I love going solo here, so I do not have to wait for a table.  I just want to sneak into the bar and get my food.

oKGIF1T3vnagIoAGHt7dxA.text: The portion sizes are good but wasn't happy about paying for spicy salsa. Margaritas are good tho !

lha3Gp5Viu8NKn-XnZQBbw.text: Went here after the Whitesnake concert. We ordered the chicken taquitos for an appetizer and they were good.  I ordered the street tacos, al pastor. Can't go wrong with street tacos right? My boyfriend ordered the chicken Milanese. Both our plates were bland as could be! My tacos had a pineapple salsa which was the only tasty thing on my taco. The meat had no taste to it whatsoever!! No seasonings. It was completely unflavorful! I didn't even eat all 3 tacos. My boyfriends chicken was covered with a bunch of leaves. Maybe to try and hide how bad the chicken lacked in flavoring? Maybe it was a bad night. I don't know. But for $58, worst meal I've had in Vegas.  My stomach is still paying the price for it this morning. I gave 2 stars cuz the chicken taquitos at least we're good!

V0rOEp3IMJb6-9a4qDrH-A.text: Great food but service could be better. The waiter didn't offer even once a refill for my drink

FU6ivkLy4fs4g9dQLTyzyw.text: Their service is really fast and the food comes out fast but then again it's just Mexican food.    Their nachos are ok but a bit of a rip off considering the price.  $4 extra if you want steak or chicken on them.  Their burrito is alright but there isn't really anything in it besides steak, beans, and rice.  They put this weird sour cream on top and put the lettuce on top as well.  It's a bit bland and tasteless really.  Their chips and salsa are alright but also a bit bland.  The salsa is too watered down.  I had an interview here as well and the manager only hires girls to be servers.  Every girl that would go up to be interviewed he had some creepy smile on his face.  Then again, what else do you really expect in Vegas?  Anyway, the food is a rip off considering its Mexican food which is extremely cheap to make in a restaurant but that's just Vegas prices.  I don't know if there is a trick here with their sides or extras like at Lucky's.  I haven't been here in a few weeks because it's so overpriced.

uD-jEw4PNmGdRSFToKW-ng.text: How can I say this nicely?.... could not have been worse; unless you like totally smoking hot, U flavorful, over cooked food. The strawberry margarita tasted as though someone poured an entire sack of sugar in it.  The chips were pedestrian. I'd rather have Tostitos!  My pork taco was dry, over cooked, and the street tortilla was too thick.  To add insult to injury, when I asked for a cup of decaf  to wipe the flavor of the margarita from my palate I was told they didn't have any !! What more can I say

IXiusxjnr4A-XhOC5CkDLg.text: We were staying at the HardRock and decided to go down and eat here. I had some many tacos which seemed reasonable but once I started eating I felt something odd and realized it was a fingernail from my taco. I showed my coworkers and they all wouldn't finish their food. Once I showed the manager she wasn't even really apologetic. They comped my main course but made me pay for everything else. I understand things happen but what turned  me off was the lack of customer service

g5Hpk2TkSMhBlMw6q1u_FA.text: I'm giving two stars as the service wasn't bad. But the food, oh my god the food, is terrible. The steak burrito I ordered had less flavor then the rice. Even Cholula didn't help. If you're sober go somewhere else. Or just get drinks.

yZoZwd3XMzvj1YVTJcA7Tg.text: This place was VERY accommodating to my group of wet, drunk, hungry friends after our day of partying at Rehab. I don't remember what I ate, but it was definitely tacos, and I remember it was good. Nice staff, good service, and good food when you're drunk. Nuff said.

NROAu4i9idPmFFw9XXY97A.text: Not busy and food just ok. Sat at the bar and the bartender not good with service.  Not knowledgeable on the menu.

8yaZJDeZ0ZNmR9UIlNwqqw.text: Stop! Think your going to get a refreshing margarita for a hot summer day cool down?Answer=Wrong  Margarita is either made with Country Time Lemonade or possibly vintage Crystal Light. Tequila is probably Kirkland brand. Bottom line is Un-drinkable! Waitress replaced to be kind but she new it wasn't going to be any different.   Restaurant was slow so bartender couldn't use that excuse. It's just a cheap mix that yields big profits $$$$$$$$$ & $.  I gave it one star because Carnitas were edible. Hot dogs are also edible but when in Rome.   Any positive reviews about this place probably were made by binge drinkers who spent way to much time in hard rock pool and needed a beer sponge versus going to a hospital.   Should have listened to majority of Yelp reviews. Now I'm a believer in the power of yelp.

PNlFDvJrOSV1nKEpYaphlA.text: Eh. Not that great for food. I ordered the sampler platter and the chicken and beef skewers were served cold and dry. The cheese enchiladas tasted processed and commercially produced. My wife's mom ordered the mujado burrito and it was salty and soggy with the flavors all very bland. Luckily, the Hardrock comped our meal up to $80. I don't recommend Pink Taco for meals.

aZdq3sGIiYj1znUXicyFoA.text: Customer service was excellent as was the food. Got the fajitas. Then finished off with the churros which were absolutely amazing. I will for sure be returning.

_k3UW8ZonUkP9CXmqEZ0DQ.text: I was very disappointed in the pricey bad food. I ordered the pork lunch truck tacos and my husband got the chicken enchiladas. The place smelled like vomit. I would have rather eaten at Pepe's. The only good thing was the waitress was nice.

Jg59NuiIwUbApyz7ic3kjA.text: What can I say? I Heart Pink Taco!!  While staying at the Hard Rock, I stumbled upon Pink Taco while feeling ravenous after an awesome day at the pool.   I scanned the menu full of enticing entrees and finally settled on the Pink Taco Entree. I wanted something solid and an entree with the same name as the restaurant is most likely the best meal on the menu.   I was not disappointed.    it comes with three delicious soft shell tacos, beans, and rice. The tacos were full of flavor and so juicy. I dabbed some hot sauce over it and I was in absolute heaven.   We all loved it so much, my group and I ate there four more times during our trip!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A_nVVq8PAipENqQhcMvyeA.text: I had the beef tacos and thought they were really good... We got there for the happy hour where they were doing 2/1 margaritas which were made really well and the staff was very nice..  The only drag is that Hard Rock is the hang out for the local turds, tourist Goomba's and the wanna be rockers... That was the only thing that took away from this place.

0DTrgaIUYf4fhptDO9BBfA.text: I love this place, I always go and get the Diablo nachos. Food is always great, but the service always pretty bad.  The food is also overpriced and everything is extra. The vibe is cool and you'll have plenty of time to see it all while you wait for your food to come out. Not worth it.

PQn2HAjw6ofzZsbrecjxNg.text: I went here super excited! I read the reviews here and couldn't wait! I waited for about 30 minutes. Finally got a table.   First things first, its a little dark in here which is fine.....BUT, they had black menu's with tiny white writing so it was difficult to read. We started off with the chips and salsa (it was free). The chips could have been much better and so could the salse. They bring out 3 different warm salsa's. We didn't like any of them and decided to order regular pico de gallo w/ guac. The guac was really good. I asked for a lemon to add a little more of a zing to it and it was yummo!!  I had the chicken taco plate. The chicken had a weird flavor, like a hint of chocolate or something...my tortillas were soggy underneath, I couldn't pick up my taco without it ripping and falling through. The rice and beans were very salty, and I love salt....so that should say it all.   I wasn't happy with my meal at all. So I called the manager and told her my frustrations. She told me that "the tortillas get soggy because they are kept in a warmer then put on the glass plate, causing steam... in the end softening the tortilla" She took the combo off the tab.  So basically, for a soda, guac and salsa.....I Paid 13.87  I wouldn't recommed...

G-YhFo_55-3Br7DmF7BqeQ.text: I was excited to finally eat here. I ordered Carne Asada tacos and rice and beans. The food was great the chicks were hot. The chip and salsa were good.

PdrVOLXa8-hZKE9fIWGetg.text: Food was good but not great. Service was blah. Never even got a water refill.

sjCSjb3NyWmHg2C6Fd1lgw.text: I was in love with the LA location and was looking forward to eating at the Las Vegas location. Um, DISAPPOINTMENT! they didn't have the pink margarita, which was my favorite. I did get the margarita though, but it was more like a sugarita. I took three sips and was disgusted because all I tasted was sugar, water and lime. The nachos were good, but everything else was blah. The location also isn't pretty as the LA one. The Nachos and customer service earned three star because everything else sucked.

vJe-5sVjD3bLJowUi0Aclg.text: Very good food. Great atmosphere. Loud music. Fast service.

F5PFZLhevL1GgiDL19j5RQ.text: Wow, after hearing so much we went for lunch and left disappointed.  I always ding if I don't get asked two questions:  "How is your food?" (shortly after it's served) and "how was everything?"  I didn't get either of these questions and were done with our meals before the server came by to clear the plates.  The rice was horribly undercooked and the carnita's were tough.  My masa tamales were decent.  The salsas served with the chips were decent but as a whole I've eaten at a lot better mexican joints than this.

V3b-7e7pi77Yt0_aaNKVeA.text: The chicken tacos were the bomb!!  I havent had such good tex mex in a while and this is up there... the guac was great too...Because I went on a Sunday I also got to laugh at all the drunk tourist coming out of Rehab...boy oh boy...what a fun Sunday!

JgLAZUfBJuNP9RjGS-5zRw.text: I'd just like to start off by saying I came to Vegas celebrating my birthday with a large group of family this past weekend. We had heard great things about this restaurant and since we were staying at the Hard Rock hotel, we figured, why not? Arriving to the hotel from a long drive, my group and I were beyond hungry. As expected at a restaurant on a Friday night, we did expect a wait to get seated and for the food to take some time. First off, we had waited about forty-five minutes to more than an hour to receive our food. But before receiving any plates on the table, we had asked our waitress how much longer we had before our food came out. No reply or acknowledgment. The waitress ignored at least three of my cousins who asked and walked away. We kept waiting with our growling tummies until another cousin of mine walked in to ask another waitress. That same waitress spoke to her manager and from reading the manager's lips, he said "fuck it." Whatever that meant, it confused some of us. Soon after, another waitress who apparently was a manager herself barged in to our sitting area to check out what the issue was. We told her and responded with, "Smile, youre in Vegas.... bitch." Regardless whether you're in Vegas, New York City or Los Angeles, there is no need to wait over an hour for mediocre food. Or to even receive that type of attitude/service. Mind you, when the food was finally sent out, it tasted as if they warmed it up in the microwave. End of story, horrible service, mediocre food, poor management. Pink taco needs to step it up, "you're in Vegas!"

o4KVDetgdABtENE9s2F8qw.text: Spend your money somewhere else!  Service was awful, food was barely warm and everyone made you feel like you were bothering them.   Ordered guacamole right away and never received it.  Food order came out with wrong items and the food server was iratated with us like it was our fault.  Waitress comes by and picks it up and just walks away and comes back later with another plate.  No apology and never came back to ask how things were.   We live here and there are plenty of other mexican places with better service and food that would love to have our money.

x_lVt6y6hLtQJfkSyIhxEg.text: OMG. The best chicken nachos you will find anywhere and cheap! Haven't tried much else on the menu. Kind of expensive for Mexican but I guess it is the Hard Rock. The margaritas are great also, a little expensive but worth it. Quick service and you get free chips with three sauces. Yum!

j-xb-iNurBpG71S1UgOKLA.text: Loved it! a group of us went here for dinner and it was soooo good, I had the carnitas tacos and they were off the hook. I will definitely be going here next trip!

3WvOMIARaVyb-ABicZ2I9A.text: Excellent food and cool atmosphere I found the prices reasonable as well. I had the sabana de pollo and it was Awesome washed down with don  Julio anejo

9J_1b_hWg7ifRjuOkxZUGw.text: Run-of-the-mill, chain restaurant Mexican food. Service was slow on two separate occasions eating here. The rice and beans are sub-par.

0RfnLpXt_Py6vx5rYn0RTQ.text: I ate here in April.  Appetizers are half price during Happy Hour, which makes them a reasonable price.  I had the chicken tostada salad as my entree, and it was delicious!  The food was good, and the atmosphere was fun.  The chips and salsa were yummy.  I would eat here again.

BkQVL2gyiArBGiXsviT3dw.text: As much as I love me some pink taco (obligatory luis m love of the pussy eating reference) I have never actually ordered a pink taco here.  I have had a few of their other menu items.  Their enchiladas are good, the chilaquiles are passable, the rajas and potatoes are a cheesy gooey delite, and the tacos are decent.  Probably a 3.5 star place but being located in the Hard Rock hotel/casino which is known for it's eyecandy and being so decently priced for a Vegas eating establishment makes Pink Taco a must stop at some point during your stay in Las Vegas.

woiBpwkXRq2s7qB_67Ihiw.text: For Mexican food outside of Texas, this was very good. I had 2 other fellow Texans with me and we agreed. Fun place, great locale. The light green salsa was my favorite.

_1h7MNNPFOVGpg0l1f1HGQ.text: Shrimp taco was great. Beans and rice didn't mix well with overall flavor but the green salsa made up for it all!  Reasonably priced.

0Zsl1pX2fzKF5Vp1Grbw_w.text: Amazing food, great prices.  They serve three salsas with the free chips they give you, all of which were delicious!

R_S_0k-b9FFV0oolK_e2Sg.text: We have been going there for years, I don't know what has happened. The salsa is boring, the Sabana chicken isn't as good, and they used to have the best flan in town. They got rid of it and replaced it with some nasty pineapple flan. Even the soda is so watered down its gross.

loAxLvkl88nPmCO4w6QV1Q.text: Happy Hour (correct me if I'm wrong, it's been a while): M-F 4-7pm 1/2 off most appetizers 2 for 1 Margaritas  The happy hour here is a steal.  Let me give you an example.. the appetizer platter is $7 after the discount.  It includes 2 chicken skewers, beef skewers, quesadillas, and tamales.  Along with the free chips and salsa, 2 people will be stuffed for slightly over what you'd pay at Taco Bell.  If you want to splurge, get 2 for 1 margaritas, and now you're stuffed and drunk.  The only bad part about the place is the happy hour is only in the bar, and it can be a fight for seats. Don't bring a group bigger than 4.  The service is always terribly slow to get helped by a waiter, so expect to be waiting awhile.  Once you order though, the food is up almost instantly.  Then you'll be waiting for your check the rest of the evening.    As long as you set your service expectations low, and value expectations high, you can't beat it.

6eVMovxE7WX2NIadi-cKuQ.text: I love this Pink Taco location. I usually order the delicious enchilladas. This trip I ate at the bar for Happy Hour. I ordered the flautas and 2 margaritas for $15. That was all for the price of one margarita at other Mexican infused joints in Vegas. I was very pleased with my food and drinks. The service at the bar was great. I can't wait to go back and get my Pink Taco fix.

1Fgxa7Zs0GfqkgrRcQuLtQ.text: Whether or not you appreciate their 'cute' name,   the menu and recipes are top notch and I've never felt pandered-to by the waitstaff (it's not like tilted kilt bs) -  definitely love this place.

R8avQ9D_qcx-Rr5w-zNm2w.text: The queso bean dip here is divine!

-Z1e9Vb9ouIBQJkicVQnjg.text: Good 'cheap' eats for Vegas. I'm a lover of tex-mex and rock n' roll!  Mmm...chips and salsa.

hdURPDypWQ0R0-QJXp91-Q.text: the food is soo yummy. large portions...we had to wait kinda long for our food, we kept eating the chips and salsa-not bad!  Fun atmosphere! The service as pretty good...just hated waiting for our food!

40LD43AAhzTQgU7yWc4sjQ.text: Decent food, decent vibe, located in the hard rock hotel.   A nice solid spot for visit.  I got their pink taco was pretty good. Would come back again.

l5EhkVP6AvHL1hC-n0B3Lw.text: A group of six of us went to Pink Taco last night.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the food for for the price.  First we all had drinks.  I chose a standard blended margarita at a ridiculous 13 bucks.  It was like a ten oz slushy with not much alcohol served in a standard bar glass.  For a 13 dollar margarita, I guess I was expecting something bigger, maybe presented in a cool way.  I ordered grilled fish tacos and they were fishy tasting and mushy.  Not even tasty, another disappointment.  My Bf ordered chile verde.  They brought him a cereal bowl sized portion of it which was cold to the touch.  It was obviously something meant to be microwaved, because it definitely was not freshly prepared.  The waiter apologized and disappeared and brought the same bowl back ten minutes later.  It had obviously been warmed again in the microwave because now it was too hot to touch.    The chips and salsa were the best thing about the meal, as they were frequently replenished.    Our meal was nearly 200 bucks for the 6 of of......NOT WORTH IT!

KQlTT4wAQ9bSPVsrVw_UDQ.text: Had the Ahi Tuna tacos, they were very good...their guac is good too.  I ordered a glass of wine at the bar which they just have one kind called Red, it was gross and $12 dollars...their drinks are overpriced, I'll just be ordering meals there for now on.

JNMpe9WG28NYHh4iIJCIuQ.text: Really? You can't go wrong with this place. I love the atmosphere, with the big high top booths. They are not wood chairs, they are soft and squishy, so that makes you want to stay longer, and hang out. The servers were friendly. I ordered the chicken nachos, but unfortunately for me, they were a bit too spicy. I did send them back, and ordered a simple chicken caesar salad, which happened to be the best chic. caesar salad I've ever eaten. No lie. I loved the way that the grilled chic. tasted, it was amazing. So, although I didn't have a traditional mexican entree there, I did enjoy my meal very much.

f1iNxe7XCDZEFuxfgxQFLQ.text: The Pink Taco was pretty good.  I had the panuchos which are their signature dish.  I wasn't expecting the flavor to be so good.  My first bite of rice was sort of bland, but when I started eating the beans and the tacos the rice was perfect.  It complemented the rest of the food.  The tacos are "pink" tacos because of the pickled onions added to the top.  I had a pomegranate margarita martini.  It was very good!  I would go back if I happened to be staying at the Hard Rock again.  It was quick, easy, and tasty.  I'll have to check the Happy Hour specials next time.

ih-P7YmJ2KiQiX_G5Smc6w.text: We visit Vegas yearly and visit Pink Taco yearly as well. We love the hard rock for some gambling and daytime drinks. Pink Taco is included.  Had fish tacos, guac for app, some ritas and beer.  This always stays on rotation.  Service is fast and food is always good.

eqPx428hyJ2bALN_XeDxIg.text: The food and service are nothing spectacular, I'd go back again because its a cute place, and its Pink Taco =)  It's a hip place to grab a bite, a drink, and people watch.  I saw Carey Hart the last time I was there.

23oIywAH18wOVnjO0buMfA.text: Everything had a middle of the road franchise restaurant feel to it; not great but passable.  I would not rock this pink taco... well not again.  I think that 3 stars is generous. The tacos were ok nothing great. I am from california and we have some killer mexican food. The theme "pink taco" was entertaining but that was really not that entertaining. The wait staff was rude and not very attentive.

SUz3UEl8akBB5aIibrhuQw.text: This place has a great happy hour but when we went there the waitress did not advertise it to us at all, we had to ask her about it. I hate that. If you have a happy hour, you shouldnt try to hide the fact that you have it. Let customers know!! It makes them happy!! DUH!!! The food was good. Margaritas were yummy. The atmosphere was great, I loved the decor.

BrvLTDNfAzqjb0QA8PptvA.text: This is a chain but great authentic Mexican restaurant. Everything I've tried was delicious.

2BvcWLAGG4XR70by5OacKQ.text: I almost forgot that I ate here once. What I can remember about this place is that the food here was very average, but with decent portions. It had a very sports bar feel to it and the atmosphere is very loud.  This is one of those places where you dine with friends then leave and could forget that you even stepped foot into it at all.

Z06z0MuJsYZQeQ8IRJ8iiA.text: This was our 2nd choice since Mr. Lucky was kinda busy. It took a while to be seated cuz the hostess was away. But the waiter was prompt. I really like the chips. They were warm & had a soft crunch. I am not a salsa eater, so have no opinion on that.  We shared the sampler appetizer. Overall it was fine, although the chicken was cold. I sure did like the little sweet tamales! The appetizer was just enough food to not weigh us down, so we could move on to the next destination.

DBt7uJRY_kWxCIcFjGQt2w.text: The cadillac margarita is very disappointing, not enough alcohol. The pink tacos were decent but my tortillas broke apart as soon as i picked up the taco. The service was horrible, we asked to start with guacamole and chips and they ended up bringing it out with our meal. When we told them we didn't want it anymore the waitress shot us a dirty look, she also didn't check up on us at all

AT0lg2RsXKjz4Xcgw1ynhw.text: The chips were pretty damn good and the food was made from good quality ingredients.    I just can't believe I paid $10 for a fricking burrito.  It wasn't even that big.  For $10, I want a burrito I can eat for 3 meals.  They do have a really huge selection of tequilas though.

LFRxVeZniTfHnZdPsxSJcQ.text: What color is your taco?  I threw a birthday party here with 18 guest and one very surprised birthday boy. Doing something like this anywhere can get expensive quick - doing this in Las Vegas can break the freakin' bank in no time flat. This is one of the best venues I found. The food is not mind blowing but it is good. The restaurant is located inside the Hard Rock hotel which is fun and very close to the strip. So all and all this is a fun bar that serves decent food at reasonable prices. Great for groups. Good services and great party planning services.

0iy5Br1nyoLIDfYNJe26RA.text: We go here whenever we see Kenny at The Joint, but this year we were disappointed.  Everything was just meh.  We even returned the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Who does that!  Beans were dry.  The only positive was the nice staff and flour tortillas.  I think this tradition has come to an end.

iCcW9Pc0U4VKl1HR05zXBg.text: How have I never reviewed Pink Taco!!! This is our favorite place in Vegas. Even though it's a bit of a hike to get over to the Hard Rock, it's well worth it. We also take a little stroll around the casino after we eat and see some of the cool memorabilia. Anyway, Pink Taco...I love the decorations and the vibe and the food is awesome. Tonight my husband had the carnitas and said it was the best he'd ever had. I had the Pink Tacos (without chicken since I'm a vegetarian) and a cheese enchilada. It was hands down the very best enchilada I have ever had. I don't know why or how but it was just off the charts good. The pickled onions on the pink taco are reason alone to go there. Everything we have had there is highly craveable. The chips are super fresh and the tortillas are made in house. Tonight the Adult Entertainment Expo is at the Hard Rock so it also made for some excellent porn star people watching. Yay Pink Taco!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Pink Taco...sorry it was super dark in there but I promise it was pink and freakin awesome
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9tYT_PPkMFbkUNAgcb5cfg.text: SUNDAY BRUNCH - all you can eat for $25   I really enjoyed: Bread basket Blue corn pancakes!!!   Oysters  Brisket wrap (if you like fat, which I do) Deviled eggs   I didn't care for: The shrimp ceviche - not enough lime, should have been served with chips  Lobster quesadilla - too soggy with all the sauce on top, I want a crunch to my tortilla  Clams - strange after taste  There is plenty on the menu. It's nice to sit outside and enjoy the sun.  Looking forward to trying other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams and mussels
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue corn pancakes

3SisOPNglzUzLE8qqbUrBw.text: If you're staying at the Hard Rock, make sure to get a coupon book at the front desks and then a Backstage Pass at the cashier, because you get $20 in drink credit at Pink Taco! My sister got the Blue Ballz margarita, which she loved, despite the super strange name that you don't really feel like saying aloud to your server.   Hot chips & salsa were delivered to our table almost immediately, and they were delicious. We both got taco trios a la carte, and I got the corn as well, which was BOMB. They were out of the corn on the cob so they offered me corn off the cob with the same toppings, which was actually better - consider asking for it that way! Less messy!  My favorite taco was the al carbon with steak. The al pastor with pineapple salsa was good, and the pink taco was yummy but I was too full to finish it.   This + Culinary Dropout are the best restaurants in the hotel if you're looking to stay casual and just relax. And by "stay casual" I mean we showed up in our sweats and only felt a tiny bit judged.

Their tortillas are hand made not from the package  get the horchata colada it was so tasty yumm I can taste the liquor in it so it's not gonna be so sweet like a regular horchata. I ordered the chicken and enchiladas and they were tasty. I don't usually compliment and eat Mexican restaurants because their not authentic and they suck frankly. But this place I do recommend and the service was fast especially being in a group of 8.

The ambiance is casual and fine.  Where this restaurant falls short is the food.  Just tasteless and uninspired.  Boring.  Bland.    Nothing really WRONG with the Pink Taco... it's just very forgetable.  Can't recommend it.

Bb8RhAbFfMKJ_0329TXRFQ.text: We went there to grab a bite before Journey concert and I personally didn't like it that much. I think it's overpriced. My appetizer was so small (check out the picture) and it was 13 dollars. If you happen to be there, get a table outside, at the pool. It is really relaxing.

KpTqLMggkoyPO5MVWlzojQ.text: You can always count on the HRH to rock some great drink specials and Pink Taco's HH keeps that trend alive. There are a number of beers, margaritas, sangria, shots and other decent (Jack) well drinks available for $5 and a few foodstuffs for $5-9. Running from 3-7pm M-F, there's sufficient time to get tequila crazy in this joint. Even with the cold(er) weather outside and the large doors that lead to the pool closed, the vibe is still fun and will lead to an extended session of getting sauced.   From the menu, I tasted the honey-chipotle wings (a nice sweet glaze with smokey ranch. Make sure you tell them to cook the wings to a crispy well done), the Diablo nachos (not as spicy as you would expect, but still good) and some guacamole (solid). Sure, you can't really go wrong with these orders, but they were perfect for the occasion.    All in all, my party of three stayed for 2+ hours and left full (and dirty drunk) for $150 including tax and tip. Not a bad outing.

MJJu8I79XII-5vVQb3Vzig.text: Pretty, glowy atmosphere. Street corn was kind of bland/underwhelming but the house special pink tacos were very good! The chicken seasoning was delicious and those pickled onions mmmm... so good!

rJY-k0DRlt_8c_oLLKfvMw.text: This is our second stay at HRH. The rooms had a beautiful view, however our bedding was stained & the bed mattress had a huge hump in the middle.   While eating dinner at Pink Taco, my husband was verbally attacked by a drunk patron at the gaming area in the bar & the restaurant manager did not call security, which forced us to get up & leave. We also informed hotel management who did nothing.   It is very unlikely we will stay here again, unless something is done by HRH to earn our business back. We flew in for this weekend away & it was very disappointing that you allow good customers & gaming players to be treated in this manner.

FO1bLlCVkLejJnT8ApmRVA.text: Pink is my favorite color. Pink taco is so far my favorite Mexican style place.   Pink Taco is in the Hard Rock. Ok. Getting my head out of the gutter now...  Taco platter: Really good. Quality meat.  Salsa: I'm a lightweight and like Gringo salsa, not too spicy, not HOT.   Burrito was excellent. Good sauce. Full of meat. Cheesy goodness.   My husband loved the fajitas at PT. I thought they were pretty good too. Lots of veggies not spicy and the chicken was  moist and not over grilled.  Service was good.  One star minus for over priced margaritas. I know its Vegas though. ...  In conclusion a good place with good food. Not sure I like pink  food coloring though.

f2-zYI1xZEtpB7DrQ1xqIA.text: Pink Taco is always a good experience! The atmosphere and decor make for great fun!  The service at Pink Taco can be hot or miss. I have had not so great service at times and at other times really great service. I love their outdoor patio seating, with a view of the pool, provides a nice atmosphere with the palm trees and is great for people watching!   I have tried a many things here, and have narrowed it down to a few favorites.... the chicken nachos are great, they have real cheese and cheese sauce....YUMM! (the diablo nachos are good as well, but beware- they are spicy!) The taquitos are very good- I prefer the shredded chicken over the beef, and the bacon wrapped jalapenos are great- definitely give them a try!

CuE1JOVBtKOlUUi6wA1deA.text: My husband and I had a great experience here! We walked in with no reservation on a Wednesday night and were seated immediately.   Our waitress was nice and attentive. We ordered the guacamole appetizer and enjoyed it with the table chips and salsa. Our guacamole has a nice zesty and spicy kick to it that we both enjoyed very much.   My husband ordered the Zonkey Nachos and I ordered the shrimp fajitas. The homemade tortillas served with my fajitas were absolutely amazing! My shrimp was sweet and Smokey and perfectly spicy. All the fajita ingredients were seasoned and cooked perfectly and we both enjoyed all of our food.   I ordered a virgin pina colada just for fun and it was very delicious. It was served with fresh blueberries on top with complimented the creamy drink very well. We will happily return to this restaurant!

D56Uj0m8TwtHhnUzmUx9Wg.text: My, what a few years and different chefs can do!!  I was here for Restaurant Week in 2011.  Pink Taco remains one of the original restaurants at the Hard Rock.  Chefs Bradley Manchester and Mickey Hardin have created a number of new dishes with others that have been on the menu before.  Four of us tried:  House made chips and salsa Churro brioche filled with dulce de leche Chorizo cornbread Tres leches cinnamon roll Avocado mollete Albondiga with chorizo and beef Aguachiles with shrimp, octopus, Serrano chiles, avocado, cucumber and onions Cinnamon sugar doughnuts with chocolate mousse Garlic shrimp with tortillas Tres leches pancakes Chilaquiles Pork chile verde Benedict Mole tots with cilantro Chocolate flan Pineapple cake with horchata ice cream  My standouts were the brioche, cornbread, aguachiles, garlic shrimp, pork chile verde Benedict and the two desserts.  The brioche is so sweet with the dulce de leche that you can't resist it!  What a great flavor!  The chorizo cornbread with jalapenos, zucchini, and cotija cheese is fantastic.  The aguachiles is a very flavorful mix of shrimp and octopus with chiles and vegetables that is a great ceviche. Of course for me, the two desserts finishing our meal were very good.  I'm not sure how long Pink Taco will be open as the Hard Rock transitions to the Virgin name.  I hope it styas as good as it is right now!

_RaIzaYFE2W3VqMJqFiEfg.text: Although Bradley Manchester has been hard at work with the transition to Virgin Hotels, that has not stopped he and Mickey Harden from coming up with some new ideas across the building currently called Hard Rock Hotel & Casino, and at Pink Taco on Saturday morning several items made their debut alongside some old favorites.  A part of Las Vegas for nearly twenty-five years, the California import now old enough to be considered iconic, Pink Taco resides just steps from The Joint and is the only Restaurant besides Nobu that remains since the property on Paradise opened, its self-applied description as a "hipster Mexican Cantina" underselling what is actually a space that doesn't take itself too seriously despite turning out bold and frequently authentic flavors.   Large in size, and best during warm months when the party spills over onto an outdoor patio, it is after making way past a Tortilla stone, kitchen and bar that guest find themselves immersed in Mexican folk-art, everything from skeletons to cherubs surrounding while music plays overhead at a reasonable volume.  The rare place still serving complimentary Chips and Salsa, both housemade and setting a high standard, fans of Tequila will likely find themselves drawn to Cocktails with risque names and pronounced sweetness, the "Horchata Colada" taking an alternative approach with Cinnamon Rum and performing beautifully alongside Pastry Chef Harden's new Churro Brioche with a creamy Dulce de Leche core.  Acting as a sounding board for much of the meal, the reservation not accidentally made on a day when Chefs Harden and Manchester were both present to assist Pink Taco's Chef de Cuisine with new plates soon to join Brunch or Happy Hour, guests not counting carbohydrates will be excited to know that Mickey quietly continues to prove himself as one of Sin City's best Pastry Chefs with two additional Appetizers, Cornbread hot from a skillet riddled with Chorizo plus added moisture from Zucchini, and a Cinnamon Roll topped in Cream, Cajeta and Berries riffs on the flavor of Tres Leches Cake without the sogginess that many find off-putting.  Not ignoring patrons seeking healthier fare, all three Chefs currently pursuing their own fitness goals, guests who cannot get enough Avocado Toast should strongly consider the new vegetarian Mollete additionally featuring Refried Beans and housemade Salsa while those following keto can find big flavors and nothing off-limits in tender Meatballs topped in smoky Sauce or Aguachiles indistinguishable from what one might find south of the border save for their slightly lower spot on the Scoville scale.  Back to Mickey for a moment, his Cinnamon-Sugar Donuts with Abuelita Mousse toying with the idea of Mexican Hot Chocolate and outperforming the fresh-made rounds one will find at Fractured Prune or even Delmonico Steakhouse, it is through considerable effort that Pink Taco's most impressive new plate delivers boldly flavored Shrimp cooked in Butter fortified by Shells and Garlic, each bite dazzling from the fork and even better when nestled in a Corn Tortilla hot off the stone.  Impressed by the veracity of flavors from Veracruz to the Yucatan, Chef Manchester's affinity for the area no secret to those who follow him on Social Media, another new plate delivers slowly braised Pork as a Benedict, the English Muffin perhaps better replaced by Bolillo or Sopes as they do at Broken Yolk Cafe, while Chilaquiles served wet and Tater Tots topped in housemade Mole plus fried Peanuts each offer textural rollercoasters that are best shared given their substantial portion-sizes.  Not afraid to both start and finish sweet, though prices lower than portions or quality might suggest already had several diners over-sated, it should go without saying that Pink Taco's buttery Tres Leches Pancakes topped with Fried Ice Cream are a must while new items including Choco-Flan and Pineapple Cake that eats like a Financier amidst the flavors of a Pina Colada are each "works in progress" that already best other Mexican Desserts served throughout town.  FIVE STARS:  Intentionally inauthentic, but simultaneously embracing flavors and techniques that continue to please guests from a variety of backgrounds, Pink Taco has been doing things the right way ever since Bradley Manchester took over as Hard Rock Hotel & Casino's Executive Chef and the new menu shows he, Mickey Harden and the current kitchen staff have no intention of pumping the breaks until Hard Rock temporarily shutters in 2020 to make way for Virgin.

eWyXQXairZroUQJQhrAaNg.text: I was staying at the Hard Rock Hotel Casino for 36 hours with my co worker and this was a must on our list of places to eat! It's located inside of the hotel so that was perfect, my fat booty didn't have to walk far haha. First and foremost our waitress was soooo nice and helpful and had great recommendations! I ordered the Cadillac Margarita which she suggested and it was on point! They didn't skimp on the alcohol which I appreciated but it wasn't too strong where I couldn't drink it! My coworker and I weren't super hungry so we got the jalapeno poppers and a order of the pink tacos. I'm still dreaming of both, they were both the bomb.com! We can't wait to make another trip to Vegas just so we can eat here!!

QJ5Q3X1NqbBqjbd_H9fg4A.text: Aside from the colorful decor with a festive feel, the rest of our experience here was quite disappointing. We are staying at a hotel across the street from Hard Rock, and after the long drive, getting back in the car didn't have great appeal.  We walked over, found the restaurant, and got seated in short order.  I'd read that they have some seating out by the pool.  Wrong. The hostess said they are doing renovations out there, so no al fresco dining.  Strike one.  The bus boy brought a basket of fresh chips and a bowl of salsa.  That happened quickly, but he wasn't in charge of bringing waters, evidently. That had to wait for our server.  She came after a while. We ordered our beverages and our entrees at the same time.  Drinks came reasonably quickly.  My virgin lime margarita looked great, but was enough to cause a sugar OD.  I ended up cutting it with water several times.  At $5, it was an okay value, just too cloyingly sweet. Our nephew ordered lemonade, which looked like it came from a fountain.  Not freshly squeezed here. Strike two.  Worst of all - the food was very mediocre.  Dear Hubby ordered fish tacos.  He said they were okay; a little bland, but a good texture.  He didn't realize when the server offered rice and beans that it was an upsell - they don't come automatically.  At $4, it wasn't a great deal, on top of paying for the tacos.  My nephew and I split an order of fajitas.  I've never had fajitas arrive at the table that weren't sizzling before.  I can attest - if they're not emitting steam and making the signature sound of warm food meeting hot skillet, they won't be at their peak. These weren't at a peak of flavor or temperature. There were only 2 tortillas offered; very chintzy!  Strike three.  The waitress never came back to ask how are food was / did we need anything else. Had she, I probably would have sent the meal back for a re-do.  Also, no spoons were on the table, nor came with the meal.  That made it awkward to serve up the ingredients. If strike four was a thing, they reached it.  Overall, quite disappointing. I would recommend trying other options for Mexican food.  Not the fun start to our two days in Vegas that we'd hoped for, sadly.

ElkFa74rFbPoEd35_VzV2g.text: Came in for dinner and quickly ordered a pitcher of the Cadillac margaritas ($60). They were really good. We got the required salsa and chips and they were good. Salsa not spicy but very tasty. We had queso fundido and it was good. A little watery than I'm used to but lot of flavor. Not enough tortillas for my liking. 3 big ones, I'd prefer a few smaller ones. For the mains we had the Pink Tacos and the chicken enchiladas mole. Pink tacos were full and very tasty. Enchiladas were awesome, mole sauce had a nice chocolate flavor without it being overpowering. Service was good, quick and efficient. Place has a nice vibe, had a really good time. When we went you got a free keychain with the purchase of a pitcher of margaritas so there's that too!

X48yccrpp-mAztYuS75Ggw.text: Conveniently located in the Hard Rock.  Restaurant is big andwas pretty empty at 6:30 on a July Monday night.  Great stainless steel bar top.  I had the shrimp enchiladas they were great.  The suiza sauce had great flavor.  The rice was tasty.  The beans a little dry.  Did the value outweigh the cost? That's a close and tough call considering how expensive food is as of late.  The menu was old as in aged, and some of the writing was smeared off from wear.  It had seen better days. New menus would enhance the experience.  The bartender...I didn't catch his name was a cool cat who recommended the shrimp enchiladas, he was a great server.  He refilled my Sprite numerous times and prepared me a Sprite "To Go" in a plastic cup with ice and a damn paper straw.  I think I posted a couple pics.  If not I'll see if I can soon.

gn1DbMw7OQXZy0u_CETqVQ.text: February 20, 2019 Wednesday - 6 PM for Dinner 2 Adults  Atmosphere - 4 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars  Background - We are staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, and since they upgraded our room.  We decided to eat in house.  Atmosphere - Typical Mexican restaurant.  Things that stood out was the kitchen was open, and in the corner was a lady making fresh tortillas.  Food   Drink - Pacifico Clara, a Mexican beer.  I wish they had some craft Mexican beer.    Dinner - A burrito and you can get it wet for not additional coast.  I had the pork burrito and the thing was huge.  I did order the burrito wet, Christmas style.  So half was covered in red sauce and green.  The red was a great chipotle style while the green was fresh and zesty.  The burrito was stuffed with a ton of pork and the fillers was minimal.  Service - What you need from a waitress.  Future - Yes.

I had the pink taco which is shredded chicken, pickled onions, cilantro, avocado and some other toppings.  Really, really, really delicious and filling.  Capped it off with a Cadillac margarita.  Tasty and strong!!!!  The chips and salsa were great too.  Lively atmosphere.

kJ47k-ZoYv-32-LVrAAX1g.text: The chicken enchiladas were amazing! Service was awesome and the food came out right away! We are staying at the Hard Rock and plan on going back a couple times!

gnDuXD9_bBv_veLW7bT_ZQ.text: Copied from my Twitter post:     Ordered the Pink Tacos, dried out, no creama. I thought they were fish until the bartender said they were chicken. Not great, ate 2 out of 3. The Pozzole was so so, have had better, several ingredients were missing, one being the dried chiles. The Pink Taco will disappear after the transition from Hard Rock to Virgin.

b3FnphcjA7q-Oh55BWPf1A.text: We were happy with our dinner. I didn't realize they brought you chips out because they didn't come until after we ordered, but that was a nice addition. They tasted good and crunchy but I needed some salt on them and there wasn't any at the table. I guess I didn't need it I just wanted it - so it's better that way no need for extra water retention on vacation.   We chose to sit outside on their patio and I enjoyed the ambiance very much. It was relaxed and people were having a good time.  The decor is day of the dead and outside it was under pink lighting (hence the not too great pics) It was only slightly chilly on this November night in Vegas, but they had heaters outside that kept us perfectly comfortable.   I ordered a carne Asada quesadilla and my husband had a fried pork burrito. They were both satisfying and the price was about $30.00 with no drinks which is about average for a not fine dining Vegas dinner with no drinks.  My quesadilla had perfect cheese to meat ratio.  Service was good friendly and attentive.   We would like to go back to try happy hour while we are here :)

LAdU9mJLBQQs_B7YWVL4mA.text: I usually order the red or green pozole here and they do a good job. It's a fun atmosphere and drinks are just fine.

5LFkcEIjvYRamzkWH3Pm0A.text: Here for the weekend and came here for dinner on our first night. Chips and salsa were really good - salsa was spicy but super good. Margarita was also pretty good.   For dinner, I ordered the pink tacos which were decent, but I've had better tacos. Given this is a  hotel restaurant though they weren't half bad.   I'm docking stars solely based on the service and not really the food. The waitress was extremely slow - took her almost 15 min to bring our drinks after we ordered them. We also sat for another 15 min after we finished eating for her to bring the bill. I'm typically not one to complain about service either, but she was just so slow!

4B0ZUB1isLubkztgPK62uQ.text: They definitely made up for their lack of flavor last time!!!!!! Last year I first tried Pink Taco and was not satisfied with my meal. Asada was dry and rice and beans were very bland so I took my own advice and this time ordered the fajitas! Our waitress, Angie, was great!!! She told us we could do half chicken and half steak for the fajitas!! (When she came to take our order we couldn't decide at first) The fajitas were SO FLAVORFUL!!!! They come with a little side or rice and beans topped with guacamole, sour cream, and tomatoes. They may have changed their rice and beans because this time they were definitely not bland! They tasted super good!!! We also ordered churros for dessert! They were the perfect amount of sweet for my sweet tooth!!! And the almond toffee pieces provided a great crunch! The creme anglaise had the perfect texture!! So glad we ordered it and so glad we came back! Thanks Pink Taco!!

IcQlFv-9WlFG_RaeJ4QPhg.text: Good ambiance, great tequila selection. Lack luster and mediocre food. We had two margaritas, three street tacos, and posole; our dinner tab was $73!

nIkQZFmG_JgxMi4o8qv1RA.text: Good service and adequate Mexican fare. However, the food and drinks are ridiculously overpriced for the quality and portion size, even for a Strip location. We only ate there because we were at the casino and it looked like a good place. We do not plan to return.

GWa5-NNuP6TQBXBEgpvMxw.text: It has been a while since we had dined here. Last night the server was great but the food was terrible.  Carnitas were greasy and tough. Will not be going back

-LFlW91948NKqJYd51SfEQ.text: My favorite Taco Restaurant.  I LOVE the panuchos! (the pink tacos). The tortillas are made fresh-constantly. The food is very good. The salsas available now are (in my oppinion) not as good as they used to be five years ago, but the flavors are distinct and delicious including the verde and chipotle of the three given.  Once we went in and they had available sword fish for the fish tacos. Increadable!  I must go every time Im in Vegas.  Come Hungry

c7w7NC-yHy6V_q5gcM9KsA.text: This place use to be my favorite haven't been in awhile but the changes to menu are awful right down to chips and salsa never again shrimp tacos especially were the best beer battered and cabbage was best texture and now they are mushy disgusting ewww never ever again

yzERNFUb6eNJnnxbG92wAQ.text: Went for happy hour. Food and drinks were very good for the price. Bartenders were very friendly.

dWwnAALoDiOSa3dXK5b4BQ.text: This place is da bomb! Ate here in Nov. 2014... On a Sat night. Ambiance is super cool... We sat on the patio overlooking the pool. The service was fast and friendly, the food was incredible and the margaritas were expensive ($15) but GOOD! Order the bacon wrapped jalapenos for appetizer!! Best I've ever had. Shrimp enchiladas were awesome and the chile relleno was super good. Lobster tacos were bland and disappointing. Guacamole was great and rolled tacos were yummy. Would definitely eat here again!! Oh and here's a tip: eat dinner here early! Line at hostess stand gets long after 6pm. Great place to eat before attending KISS concert!! Or any concert at the HRH!! Good job peeps!!

riIUV3-MEreZjvx4oPbRbw.text: It was alright. Staff is kinda rude they don't really care, not friendly . I felt like everything was rushed . Drinks however take a while to come by  . I had the chicken tostada salad and it was good . I wouldn't go back to this place just because the staff makes you feel so un-welcomed

QAhhsjwAgHbJIGYfC11cfA.text: As a local we don't spend a lot time in the casinos but we're here for a concert so thought we'd try it. We were seated in a booth pool side of the bar quickly. But we're told that happy hour was only at the bar. We changed seats to the bar and then told no happy hour on concert night. We ordered any way and had the StreetTacos tried the fish, Al Pastor, and the special with chicken. The fish was ok, Al Pastor good, chicken bland. . Nothing like the street tacos in Mexico. There are much better places to get Tacos or Mexican in Las Vegas or Henderson. Over priced not the best food on or off the strip.

YGhm7-OVZMHKZ1Us2xjr3g.text: Let's face it.... the name is the only good thing about this place.  I was pretty disappointed in the hype for this place and it honestly wasn't much better than a Chili' restaurant. They did have fresh baked chips and dip.  There were three kinds of dip which was nice.  But the food was really just average. Maybe if I had more to drink I would have enjoyed it more.  I don't really have any desire to go back

4xtrkCns8qR8Kt0K0v30og.text: It's name is Pink Taco? Get it, Pink Taco? Ha. ha. ha.......... How fast did that joke get old?  The thing is their food is quite good. And for a restaurant in a major hotel it's one of the great finds of Vegas. The decor is fun, and the tacos are worthy.

i0KRmnhpbQuyKiKAuc5sTg.text: Been here a few times..What you need to know the food is great, the service is not.  Although not to authentic, Ive enjoyed all my meals there. Never has superb service.

eoYzbDuXnJMqspS96HBHXA.text: My boyfriend and I went here for my birthday on 10-22-11.  Allison, our server, was amazing and she was very friendly.  I had two Red Sangria's and Travis had three Margaritas.  The food was great and the best part was the Fried Ice Cream with a candle.  We will be back for sure!  Thank you for a great experience!

REP5I0dWXfS17QS1Vd3JJA.text: Whenever I'm at the Hard Rock for a concert, sign me up for the PINK TACO! If it's a day/night, sit out by the pool. Service is great, food is pretty good too. I've never had anything bad there. They know how to get people in and out when you tell them you're on a time crunch. Would try to go here every time I'm in that area and wanting Mexican.

7Vp8t8K1Drf9whVBWILAEA.text: Okay... I like the chola-inspired low-rider bike motif... I HATED REHAB...and the old man liked it (and, we may finally break up after almost 3 years of non-committed bliss : ) )... I kid, I kid.  Needless to say, I was all giggly when the server told us that the meat-market was closed during Super Bowl (the only time he visits)... Yeah for me... too bad for him, and his buddies.   Anyway.  If you enter Pink Taco from the inside, you may just feel like you are dinning at a Chevy's... if you go into this place from rehab, you will cringe a little.  That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GUyeU0PJ5MW9v7xynEl33w.text: Giving one star base on the horribly rude service provided to us by Andrea. My two friends came down for our penthouse for a midday snack and could hardly find any place serving food. This was an easy option and it had plenty of patrons as we walked to the bar. Andrea barely greeted us with words or eye contact as she threw menus our way. Poisoned us with gluten filled food when she told us it was gluten free... And over charged us on alcohol.

Ii6d4bP2TB8FLSCRJHZAsQ.text: I came here a few months ago for the 99 cent tacos and margaritas special and I was very disappointed.  The tacos were very small and the margaritas were full of sugar.  Yesterday, I came here and ordered off the regular menu and it was exceptional.  Definitely, much better quality for the 99 cent tacos.    We ordered the tostada salad and grilled salmon.  Both were excellent, but the salmon was surprisingly good.  I would definitely come here again!

ikgoawJ7mHA-t46RojNpMQ.text: It was just okay. Rubbery steak fajitas and fishy tasting shrimp. Margaritas were good but not $15 good.

vGNH2WVBCJE-oF7k4A2u9Q.text: Mmm pink taco. Wait a second.... What a disgusting name. You know a MAN started this business!  Anywho, after a long morning of drinking at the beautiful Hard Rock pools, one needs to recharge and refuel themselves for the obnoxious amount of drinking that will occur later that evening. Pink Taco is a fun place to run into for lunch for a decent meal. With a name like Pink Taco, you know that everything is going to be just a little hyper sexualized.... Oh and the menus are pink and glittery. Sold.  I'm a huge fan of the Chicken Tostada Salad... Crispy romaine lettuce with grilled chicken, avocado chunks, black beans and some really good chipotle dressing. I've also tasted a few of the other dishes my friends got. I like my salad more but it was still tasty... or maybe I was just too tipsy to really care. Look it's obviously not going to be authentic Mexican food so don't harp on that. Many things in Vegas are not authentic. You would know this if you took a look at some of the "women" on the outskirts of the strip... yeah, you know EXACTLY what I'm talking about.  Overall I think Pink Taco is a fun place for lunch in the hotel that isn't that overpriced! I've never been for dinner or happy hour but whenever I walk by at night it looks like a wild party inside. Oh and keep a look out for coupons or specials online. The last time I was there these two guys gave us their coupon so we got our meal at 50% off! Woot woot.

f0fjprkfegGswBtqYAp1Gg.text: First things first: The diablo salsa is AWESOME!!  It doesn't come with the regular chips and salsa, you have to ask for it.  If you are a chili head, this is the only way to go!!  Their Happy Hour (4-7pm) is fantastic!  I'd be hard pressed to find another place where two people can eat and drink (even if our beer is NA) for $12.  The specials are only available at the bar but get there early so you get a seat.

wpKG6ThelgGS540cYiVt9Q.text: We headed over to Hard Rock for some people watching during the AVN convention and needed some lunch, there was no wait so we opted to try this place.  The service was great, waitress came over almost immediately for our drink order and was quick to bring them back, along with the hot chips and salsa.  We had the steak quesadilla appetizer to start. I opted for the taco trio, 2 were the Pink tacos and I tried one crispy shrimp (which was my favorite).  They look small, but I could barely finish all 3 so don't be turned off by the size. My husband did the trio as well, the Al Carbon with steak. He's not normally a Mexican food fan, but he enjoyed his  as well and added the rice and beans.  Overall the service was great, wasn't to pricey, and the food was definitely good.  My only reason for 4 stars was the table was very small and cramped, my legs were touching the bottom and I was afraid my husband wouldn't even be able to sit there. I also would have liked to have seen a better beer selection, a few craft options would haven been nice. These weren't deal breakers however, if we ever go back, we will wait for a larger table and perhaps drink some margaritas instead!

OZ8ULi91kA2sj9gV9kSPtw.text: I used to love this place and I still do, but not as much....reason... The chips were cold on my last visit.    I come here for the chips, salsa and guacamole so this was very disappointing to me.   We had a table of 6 hungry people and received two baskets of chips, and upon asking for one more basket we were told it would be an extra charge. When did they start charging for chips? The Pink Tacos were amazing as always and the service was good. I will review again in a few weeks to see if changes have been made.

udevooiFM4JjzX7RJu9E6w.text: Good food, silly name, SLOW SERVICE. Came on a Saturday night, there was no wait. Chips are fresh and delicious but after the food came our server was MIA.

4_ZM9chUePhK2xjokxdQiw.text: I came here on a lunch date with one of my friends. I really loved the ambiance, it was so Earthy and pretty. The hot pink sign in the front made it all the more better.  We got chips and salsa. They didn't have pico de gallo, but they did have 3 different sauces to try. It was mediocre, would've been better with pico de gallo though.   We wanted to have room left over for dessert so we decided to split the appetizer platter which included sweet corn tamales, cheese quesadillas, chicken skewers, carne asada skewers, taquitos and guacamole. It was more than enough for both of us and it was all really tasty.   After our food, we ordered fried ice cream and Churros  dusted with cinnamon sugar and served with chocolate cream. Both were to die for!  I had a nice time here. I'd love to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Ice Cream
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla maker
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer platter

rbxRbfu7IYi6Ae4fvuL9Qw.text: Love it here always, service is awesome, bartenders are the best! The food is always good - got fish taco - yumm!

4IaUz6_3I3kLoGZFDrYX0w.text: Very cool place. I love all the skulls and skeletons (De La Muerte). They have a patio overlooking the pool area. The food is hit or miss. I wasn't impressed with their ceviche but i enjoyed my taquitos though. I don't mind coming back to try their other dishes.

GIeABGbMWKadVCy2jO3TSA.text: Sat at the bar today and service was extremely slow, a few patrons actually just walked off. BUT if you can get past the wait then you are in for a great meal. Had the mojado burrito and it was excellent! Chips and salsa were also great. I will be returning for another meal soon.

A73J0mmgFiD0Sf3v-c9EKQ.text: Brilliant timing on a Pink Taco visit at The Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas! Carlos the waiter and a bunch of girls serving things from the new menu. Great happy hour specials, great DJ, great food and the margaritas are always good as well. I've been to three of these locations (two in LA) and love them all!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Nachos!!!!

ASxYh3OtAeBppeG97QsMyQ.text: Pink Taco is great, not too expensive, not too frilly, just good Mexican food. We always order guacamole. I typically get the Carne Asada which is cooked well and served with a cheese enchilada. Wife gets tacos. Margaritas are good, service is quick, we like to come here

wEQDvipmpz164Wq2yWSz1g.text: Excellent service and food! The Head Chef Mr. Mendoza came to our table to ensure that we were well taken care of. Our server Pam was very attentive and super friendly. I had the ahi tuna and Baja style fish taco a la carte...both were so delicious. My husband had the Chile Colorado and talk about tasty! It was full of flavor and real authentic Mexican. I also had a margarita and that was really good as well! I will definitely come back to Pink Taco.

dnrjRGzERegwv2tTJXzO4Q.text: Chips were not fresh very stale! Salsa was okay! Our waiter Dominique was very nice and helpful. Me and my girlfriend ordered tacos steak was okay, pastor was like chicken but okay. Now the shrimp tacos Were the best! Fish taco was alright! Then we had this couple that couldn't stop staring it was annoying!!! Thanks hard rock for the coupon! overall it was okay.

KtKYCnJWOgcWMO60Tnk0jQ.text: Part of the reason I was going to Vegas was to go on Foursquare badge hunts. These hunts proved to be more difficult than what I wanted and Steven grew more annoyed with me as I did my badge chasing. I found out about Pink Taco off of the Foursquare website as a valid check in to getting the Hard Rock Hotel badge. Not only were we staying right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel but the idea that they might be serving pink tacos peaked my interest. One thing I simply love about Las Vegas is that it truly is a city that never sleeps and stores and restaurants are open to the farthest reaches of the night. Pink Taco is no exception. The night we went it was just about to get busy and lengthy waits for a table were about to ensue. We squeezed in just the nick of time.  Once we got seated we had some pretty delicious chips and salsa to eat. At times it seemed like the waiter was spread too thin and there were about two times when we were wondering if we would ever see him again. He forgot our silverware as well but once we were able to get him he seemed eager to please and cheery about his work. I mentioned that the chips were good and indeed they were! I of course had to order the pink tacos. The tacos were chicken tacos that had a purposeful pink hue to them. They were tasty but not by any means really authentic. Not bad eats though. Out of the casino restaurants that we hit on this trip I would have to say that Pink Taco was the best one I went to on this trip!

Xek3vwHE7A4s54Ag37ZpNA.text: This is my second time to pinks, and I enjoyed this visit much more than the first. I sat at the bar without problems, and was given fast service. The el jeff tamale was awesome, the pork tamale a close second. Chips were pretty good too. They have tvs for you to enjoy watching the big game of the night. Will be back if I stay at the hard Rock again!

7M0y0hmmnV4q2oSI2xKeeA.text: I am going to have to just give the pace an ok. I would give it a 2.5 if I could. Not to bad but not great either. The best part is that I had a restaurant.com certificate so that was 25 off by bill. Service was so so. Started off ok but then the waiter disappeared on us. Took forever for him to refill my drink. I ordered a beef enchilada beef taco and a chicken taco. All were average at best, not much flavor to them. I a, not a spicy food fan but even I had to throw some hot salsa on them.
