I ordered the carne asada tacos and my husband had the chicken burrito.  Everything tasted so fresh and yummy. Chips were very good, prices were good...I would definitely go here again.

_jCb-QMDuKPKYHgNLF6-bg.text: Terrible! I had the fish taco's and they were THE most pathetic excuse of a fish taco I'd ever had....and I've had lot's! This place is all show and no go! Food is overpriced with poor quality and a total waste of time.

SW5DNYP-5zzkf6UUc6Fl8w.text: Loved it.  I'm not a huge fan of mexican cuisine but I'll eat it.  This place, I'd actually crave to go back.  I loved the pork burrito with a side of salad.  Yummy.  and fun atmosphere.

hp2b3yKRkQiiX8JCJCg1CQ.text: Went to vegas a few weeks ago w/ a group of friends -- we all work in a restaurants in Boston and tend to be relatively critical of other places service. However, the Pink Taco was FANTASTIC. We were seated immediately and our server came to greet us in under a minute. It was kind of busy for an afternoon so our pitchers of margaritas were brough over by the manager, Christian, who was super friendly and chatted with us. We immediately started to consider how this restaurant was run compared to what we were used to, but everyone working seemed extremely conscientious. In between taking the time to chat with us -- Christian did his rounds and seemed to happily greet every table. Our food came out promptly and the shrimp tacos and salad were to die for. The margartia pitchers never seemed to go empty and we overall had such a great time that we went back again a couple days later. Everything lived up to our expectations for a second time around and Christian and the hostess even remembered us. Overall, probably the best experience we had at a restaurant in vegas -- we were certainly suprised that no other places lived up to our high standards!

aAxlOsoKkp84zJnR1s_lwA.text: For all of the great places to eat in the area, I'd skip Pink Taco unless I were staying at the Hard Rock and needed something fast.  It's pretty standard Americanized Mexican, but I think they dropped the ball in a few key areas.  First off was the chips and salsa.  The chips were A+, some of the best restaurant chips I've ever had.  But the salsa...D-.  They gave us 3 different kinds: tomato-based, dark green, light green.  Each one tasted pretty much the same and had ZERO spice to them.  I ordered the chicken tacos which came with rice and beans and also tried the chicken skewers.  The tacos were basically chicken and pico de gallo on a tortilla.  All ingredients were good, but how about a little cheese and seasoning to the chicken!  The chicken skewers had a little spice to them (finally!).  The service was quick and everything came out correctly, but the waitress was clearly not in a mood to be friendly with a group of 16 guys who tip well.  Her loss I suppose.

yokxP_SrFpTJgl45CWwbmQ.text: Cute name, cute decor. It was a given that I would want to eat here since we were staying at HRH. Add that to the fact that they are on restaurant.com ($25 gift certificate for $10 or less) and we have a winning combination! I ordered the Burrito Mojado with chicken. It is served enchilada style with this amazing Pasllia Chile sauce and a side salad. My man ordered the Steak Burrito Tradicional that also includes a side salad. Both burritos were on the smallish side and pretty pricey, but it's Vegas, right? I'd come back for happy hour and a couple of margaritas.

nrnNCka9h_JzMDnxJ2tzSg.text: Began my Vegas Halloween weekend by doing grub and drinks at Pink Taco. The food was great and staff was super friendly and fast. Looking at the portions I thought I would be starving an hour later, but I was stuffed. It filled me to the point where I couldn't drink beer and had to turn to the harder adult beverages. I gave Pink Taco 4-stars because their pitchers of Margaritas on the rocks, while tasty, were kind of pricey. Eh, its Vegas though, and you've got to pay the cost to be the boss.

w5fW2Mk9uFKqr0SqNElnuA.text: Wow. Stopped in before a concert and ordered a appetizer platter and a couple of margaritas. I am not exaggerating when I say the apps hit the table in 2 minutes and they were luke warm. The drinks came 6 or 7 minutes later. We drank, we left, we won't be back.

AotMiRGfxRAB8jy8XkyNDg.text: The ambiance is awesome. The service was great the food and drinks not so much. Not True authentic Mexican food. It was ok however we will not be eating at this restaurant again unfortunately.

bFPoNaA32rmXzj28SH3YBA.text: What an AWESOME place to eat...total chill atemosphere, killer chips and 3 different types of salsa. BEANS OUTTA THIS WORLD.  So happy this is where we picked to have my daughters 21st birthday dinner.  The cute lil waitresses set up our surprise cupcake tower for my daughter...THANKS PINK TACOETTES.  You guys ROCK!!!  I'm counting the days when I can eat there again...and this time I'm not leaving with out at pink taco trucker hat...so i can REPRESENT in California.  Love you.

33YYMau_vLDxRtHt_wzdcA.text: Could not wait to eat at the Pink Taco on my trip to Vegas. Have eaten here on previous trips & had it on my to do list.  Never again. Service is just bad, food is ok, not great, and way overpriced.  Why eat here with all the other choices in Vegas?  Diablo's at Planet Hollywood is much better.

ZNaZrWY7Dw8UofAtRAb2IQ.text: i tried the chips and salsa they give u before you get your meal. The Guacemole Salsa was amazing.  then my food came out The Tortilla was good. The Meat was bland...to put it simple...it sucked. My drunk brother even thought it was awful.  Sorry Pink Taco, better luck next time look on the bright side the salsa is good?  I gave 2 stars cause the Salsa was that damn  good

FXv4f5GDurnKIO3xecSM3Q.text: I ate at Pink Taco for breakfast while staying at the Hard Rock. I ordered the "El Gringo" with wheat toast. I was horribly disappointed with the food but ranked it at two stars for friendly service and poolside scenery.   FOOD The bacon and eggs were fine. Nothing special. The potatoes came out cold and were under cooked (they had that crispy rawness to them). The cold potatoes were accompanied by cold, non-buttered wheat toast. And, I got cold cold butter when I asked for butter for my toast. No excuse - It's breakfast people and the restaurant wasn't even busy.   We visited Pink Taco a second time to have drinks with friends who were eating. They had the burritos and were also underwhelmed with the food.   SCENERY Basically this is a great place to drink and watch people at the pool. If that's what you're looking for you're likely to be pleased.

b3lYVaiRrhaSB9znjRAMHA.text: Super over priced and the food isn't that good.  The only reason why we've ever gone here is because it's one of the only places inside the Hard Rock Hotel to eat late.  I'm all for small portion sizes, but Mexican food is something that shouldn't come miniature.  I'm sure I'll be back but more out of convenience than anything.

UOZIi49-_yHChEyaIc8JvA.text: The best part about this place is it's name!   The food was fine. Not good, Not bad. It's just Americanized Mexican food, Nothing worth writing home about.. not even worth writing any more of a review about either.

9Yc2j3nYOxKcKn5PIPcktQ.text: I don't quite get how the Miracle Mile Pink Taco is just *so* much better all around than the infamous Vegas one -- not to mention the additional benefit of being located inside one of Sin City's most notorious hot spots (if you haven't gambled with with the B*tches or seen an episode of Rehab poolside, then you probably don't know what I mean) -- you would naturally assume that THIS location would blow all others out of the water.  Nope.  In desperate search of something to fill our bellies before exploring the F&F Ball on Halloween eve, the We Don't Hate Fun club sauntered into a half-empty Pink Taco. Snow White, a pirate, the Green Hornet and Cato all got escorted straight to a table, where they were later joined by a boxer, a bumblebee, and Dexter.  The first four of us needed something in our bellies before the debauchery of the evening began, so we started off with chips and some VERY watery types of salsa.  Three of us ordered shrimp tacos and one ordered fish tacos.  A round of margaritas and beers completed our check.  The later addition to our party just got some cocktails and a bucket of beers.  Small serving of mystery rice, some decent-tasting but generic beans, and two meh-looking eh-sized soft tacos.  Shrimp was cooked in a batter that felt like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for some time, the accompanying "sauce" in it only served the purpose of cooling it down unnecessarily (along with too much cabbage), and there wasn't enough shrimp or fish tucked away inside to justify paying as much as we did per plate.  The True highlight of the meal was the delicious tortilla, but even toward the end of our meal that started getting a bit chewy.  To add insult to injury, our waitress was more of the "two-minute differential" if you know what I mean.  She was lovely, and nice, but it took her about 120 seconds to process anything that she was told.  It definitely made for a great beginning to the rest of the tripped out evening.  Drinks were meh, service was meh (although our waters were always filled, thanks guys!), ambience was meh, food was meh, generally speaking it was all meh.  I've for sure experienced better.

2hdK6ttJQLuuxhKxjEvbiA.text: After landing in Vegas for a little getaway with my boyfriend.. and getting settled into our room.. we decided we wanted a beer and lunch... and then a nap so we could stay up and party all night.. Vegas style. We got to Pink Taco just in time for Happy Hour. They have a very good happy hour menu. We did order off the regular menu. I had been to the Pink Taco  in Scottsdale, AZ, prior to it's closing, a few times, so I knew the menu a bit, and love the pink tacos. We ordered those , the queso and a sampler appetizer plate. The appetizer plate was full of appetizer...a quesadilla, carne asada skewers, chicken tikki skewers, taquitos (which are so different here I LOVE!!).. the queso bean dip was too much and lacking in spice for us.. We kept adding hot sauce to it.. as well as the salsa that comes with the chips. BUT this is a great happy hour with 2 for 1 beers.. we even came back again during our stay. Be ready for that nap after your Mexican carb overload!

NQ6NHnQraR8-k8CAxuGeoQ.text: It gets two stars because our waitress was awesome. The bartender was unfriendly and made our drinks wrong. The hostess was also quite unfriendly.   April 28th we had just checked in to the hotel and met at the Pink Taco for a quick bite and cocktails. We saw a sign that said $.99 margaritas and inquired with the bartender. He mentioned we had to get a players card to get the deal. Well we only had 15 more minutes on the Happy Hour clock to even benefit from it and we were ready to just get started. The last thing we wanted to do at that moment was wait in line for a players card. Not going to lie, the sign is what got us in to the restaurant. Seemed convenient and then turned out to be inconvenient. If it's too good to be True...   I decided to ask what the price range was for margaritas on a normal menu and as he walked away in irritation he said $9 - $100 and then didn't ask if I wanted anything or offer me a menu.   We were hungry and we were there so we decided to stay and get a table. The hostess didn't do anything memorable to be lame, she just was disinterested an unfriendly.   The Pink Taco was a terrible first stop after checking in. It's like they both hated their job and were taking it out on us.   The waitress was awesome. Thank goodness. She was friendly, positive and accommodating. We had a couple special order tacos. There's always one in the group that has to be different :)   No matter how friendly our waitress was it still didn't make up for the fact that the bartender made our drinks wrong. We order straight from the menu. It was something like a Spicy Michelada. Well they added tomato juice and that was not on the menu!!! So gross. She returned with drinks made the right way but we couldn't get past the initial tomato juiced beer we were originally handed. We never asked her to do it, she just took it off the bill on her own.   It was just a crappy way to start the trip. The rest of the Hard Rock experience was great. The Paradise Tower is awesome. This review is simply a reflection on our experience at The Pink Taco.

z6v46QU6OJgO6sqj5deiaQ.text: The food at Pink Taco is nothing amazing..basic Mexican fare with a few flares here and there. What I did not expect when I walked into this Hard Rock hotel establishment was the abundance of tequila they had...and the prices per shot were not too bad (considering it's Vegas).   I had a glass of the Milagro Reserve Anejo and El Tesoro Anniversary Tequila. Both were great...as the staff takes pride in their liquid refreshment. If you are in the mood for good tequila, served without salt and lime, then make sure to head to Pink Taco at the Hard Rock!!!

1Pw0Gq_AP9VfCZs_MZnYNw.text: The food was a little pricey for why you get- I got the lobster taco and I had barely enough lobster for the three tortillas they gave me. It was delicious though and the free chips and salsa definitely helped their case. They were good and our server was very attentive to keep refilling them. My boyfriend for the loaded nachos with the hottest fire sauce on the side, it was really good! Overall, the name draws you in and the food and service are good but they should rethink their prices. The portion for the nachos was good but I think the tacos should've been cheaper.

zzHcvxDFnzJMhQCZtMBfEA.text: It was good for diner food.  I had the carne asada tacos and while it was good, there was really nothing special about it.  Also, the wait staff were busier talking to each other than worrying about their customers.

1-UsU9Gtb0m8Duh8pwDaUw.text: The best thing about The Pink Taco is the Hard Rock Hotel scene & vibe.  The food is good & fresh and the portions are large, but nothing you would not find in many other mexican restaurants.  The bar drinks are excellent with great margaritas  The servers are attentive and attractive. If you are looking for a casual diner  of tacos, nachos, & burritos   before hitting the the Hard Rock then this is a good choice

lH5MmfIitd-Z4mbCpH56CQ.text: Worst service ever. Took 20min to get a server to our table.  I had to ask the bus boy where our server was and if we could get some water. She finally came by and took our order and left we waited another 15min and no chips or salsa. Meanwhile tables were getting seated next to us and recieveing chips and salsa as well as water.  Asked the server if we were going to get chips and salsa and she said "i think so".  We tried to give her some slack bc she had quite a few tables and that is just poor management skills.  She responded in attitude with "Its nothing new". We recieved our FOOD before our drinks and the chips and salsa when we were finished with our food? Finally we had to get our check and she told us if we wanted it taken care ofwe should do it at the hostess station which is where we asked for the manager.   He was some young little condisending boy who had no idea what he was doing and just comped our drinks? Really when the service is that bad thats all you're going to do? He didn't care because they were busy... but I will Never coming back here again.

Q9Hggx57wOQXY6LSRLMGxQ.text: For being a restaurant inside a hotel, this spot is worth checking out.  It's almost 4 stars but the food is just too damn expensive for what it is.  Cool points for being inside the Hard Rock Hotel and maintaining the rocker vibe while still having a mexican restaurant feel.  I love the open air patio that overlooks the pool, and how the doors are open so there is a breeze inside the restaurant. More cool points for making fresh tortillas for everyone to see.  The chips and salsa comes with 3 types of salsa ... and they are all pretty good.  My chicken fajitas were very good at $15, but the portion was kinda small.  But hey, lets face it...  don't we all want to try out a place called "pink taco" ?  Good job with the name, marketing people.  Their pink taco clothing is pretty popular too - I noticed a lot of people coming in to purchase their apparel.  *final cool points for seeing Carey Hart and Joel Madden while we were there*  If I say "cool" one more time in this review I am going to make myself sick.  I need a thesaurus.

-Nl9Til_xnzsNCeYUXP9dA.text: Have stayed at the hard rock before and ever got to try this place out. While I can't write a lengthy review as it was a quick stop for dinner .. I will say that the staff was nice and that the "pink tacos" were absolutely delicious as well as the accompanying rice and beans

AowSndzkhwbfN1SV91nefw.text: Contracted food poisoning from vegetarian soup. I've never been so sick. Never again!!!!

uOF1b82MM-oln_J5xc4Zow.text: Quick Look: First time returning to the Pink Taco in 5 years and much like the rest of the property, the Pink Taco might "hold up" but it is starting to look, feel and taste "tired."   In Depth Review: As locals we used to go to the Pink Taco for a good meal, tasty drinks & high energy atmosphere that made it a great spot for people watching. Wife and I went to the HRH this past Friday, May 9th (2014) and walked into a casino that was as dead as I have ever seen in the city for a wknd night. Music was quiet, the circle bar empty, what happened to the energy and atmosphere of the Hard Rock? Made our way past the death metal fans there for an OTEP concert and got to the Pink Taco check-in at 9pm. Had to wait a few minutes to be acknowledged and brought to our upper level inside table. The restaurant was empty and maybe a dozen tables sat, I counted 4 people at the bar. Strange vibe. Not the typical atmosphere we remembered in this restaurant in the past.   Chips and spicy salsa sauce was delivered to the table right away. The salsa dip was delicious. No water was delivered and the spicy salsa was a bit too much as we had to sit for 10 minutes before our waiter made it to our table to introduce himself. He did stop at the table next to us first that was sat 5-6 minutes after us. We ordered drinks and the Taquitos appetizer. They were a little too chewy and hard to cut in half. My wife enjoyed them though. For our entrees we ordered the chicken Enchilada and the Carnitas Platter. Timing was OK between the appetizer and the main entrees as we waited to order the entrees until after the appetizer was served.   The chicken enchiladas were tasty, a little messy and fell apart, but certainly tasted good! The Carnitas sampler was all over the place, the beans, rice, tortilla and grilled tomatoes were just fine. The carnitas meat was a bit hard and dried out. Some pieces were chewy and tasted like they had been cooked earlier and sat under a heat light. Not sure what that was all about?   Wife loved her Margarita. So that is important to note. The poor girl at the bar looked beyond bored. The entire experience was all overt the board. May have just been an "off" night and weekend. Staff looked bored and we saw a few of them eating dinner in the back of the restaurant behind us.   Was a bit shocked at how quiet the entire property was. Hope this is a rare exception and not the new rule over there. Mothers Day Wknd may have played into the property being slower than usual, who knows? Will we go back? Sure, but we are not going to go out of our way to go there as there is too much competition in the Mexican food department in Vegas - and I feel the Pink Taco may have lost it's edge?!  To sum it up - it was an OK visit at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Platter (close) / Chicken Enchiladas (back)
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taquitos Appetizer - wife loved them. I thought they were tough / chewy.

yVTN-hjLgU5N1grxclHClA.text: The price is high but the food was really good the service was awesome. We gamble at hard rock, so when we ate here we got points.

VJU0PtlmSdOxaCc5BlPTug.text: If you stay at hard rock you have to come here to eat. The food was fresh, delicious and cooked to perfection. I tried the Lucky 7 and it tasted like the food was old. Pay a little more and enjoy the food!! Will be back

p9DbIaxmVCzo1fgUQvJR6A.text: Used to love this place.  It was okay and the food was cold.   Margarita okay. Now just way over priced.  Cold tacos and cold rice and beans is no bueno.

sKU04ncrifFQoTM-ORLg1g.text: Great atmosphere and our server was friendly and attentive. The complimentary chips and salsa were delicious. The chips have a fresh, almost buttery taste to them. The appetizer steak nachos we got were huge in size, but we paid extra to get steak on them and they were VERY skimpy with the steak. Also, the nachos were dry. They could have used a sour cream or queso or other wet component. The tacos I got were tasty, but small for the price. Overall, it's a little pricey but good food.

oTXcz2KmS0FWBViVPCl3dw.text: Really good Food!! Very close to my Aunt's cooking In Sinaloa Mexico. I got three Tacos de Asada & A Torta de Carnitas! So bomb! Ill be back here for sure on our next visit.

KcGETtOGbx9nvQ0DMCmaCw.text: There is nothing really special about this place. It's a typical tex-mex joint that is way overpriced because it's in a hotel. I ordered the carnitas which were $14, but they were seasoned very well. The rice and beans were typical and wouldn't say their stellar, but then again they're staples of any tex-mex style joint.   I asked for more tortillas for my meal as I was only given 2. I found out later that they charge for extra tortillas. When I'm already paying $14 I should be given extra tortillas or if you're going to charge me then at least give me more than 2.  The server was nice until near the end. She was upset that we asked for separate checks. We had a group of 8 of us and of course we wanted separate checks. They even had an auto-gratuity on there and she couldn't do that for us? She was really annoyed but did it anyways.  Overall, the food was pretty good but overpriced and the service at the end sucked and we had to hunt her down to even get refills on water when it was hot as hell in there.

xl4Bd_Q2YN8rbJ9ivxfpjg.text: The taquitos were so tasty and the pink nachos are so fun!!! We ordered a side of tortilla chips and salsas and they have a different variety! It was the perfect snack.

UkkxjYM7lsAdIW8292G45w.text: The churrasco skewers are my favorite!  you get a taste of all three chicken, shrimp, and steak. Its  a appetizers but it fills me up every time especially after devouring the warm chips and salsa. The margaritas are so yummy. When the weather is good be sure to sit outside its so cool.  Also look out for the unexpected celebrity to walk in, every time i eat there I see someone ;)

dwyLUPnPL47SnWvia-WHjg.text: When in Vegas and the urge for great Mexican food hits you, no better place to go. My go to is the Carne Asade plate, it is suburb. They also make great drinks.

HkjnyQpqUpoNZI9sRayjXw.text: Decor and atmosphere is great. We sat outside on the porch by the pool. It was fall and not summer though. Food portions were huge and the taste was great. Staff was friendly but a little slow on the spot. We would probably eat there again

lNpW_Ib2RetPGzfKWNMwlA.text: First time and it was good. I'm not a huge fan of this cuisine which is why it's not a full 5 stars. My food was good and so was my husbands. The server was great and his recommendations were spot on. I had street corn and fresh guacamole and chips. Use your backstage pass to get a discount! Decor was nice too, full bar with lots a unique cocktails.

kQtSEHxv61-uQvF0L7g_xg.text: If you're looking for fresh, authentic Mexican food, do yourself a favor, and eat here! The tortillas are made in house, the carne asada was tender and juicy.  The waffles were decadent, while still being fluffy. The drink menu looked great, but it was a little early for me to drink. Next time for sure! The service was great, and fast. The ambiance was fun, and the prices were surprisingly low. We'll definitely be returning.

qwcMoVwnmckrtamml846dQ.text: Be warned folks..... I know you're not going to drive around Las Vegas looking for Mexican food but this place does a disservice to Mexican food.   It's amazing how tasteless food could be dished out here,  maybe its better when you're inebriated. Doubt it!  However, the guacamole and ribs were OK.

PZTroklqExLWDS5DXAer0g.text: I'm so happy I came here before I left vegas yesterday. They had a killer happy hour menu that doesn't break bank. I got the Carne asada fries and the flautas which really hit the spot for the ride home. Oh and their chips were warm and crispy when they brought them out paired with salsa. I also ordered the green salsa it won't disappoint you. Definitely going to be returning when I come to vegas.

_j9SkWiRLzbFQaqvvoLToQ.text: Came for happy hour. $5 drinks & selected food from 3-7 on a Friday.. I ordered the chicken flautas which were very flavorful. The margarita wasn't all that. It had a weird taste that I really didn't enjoy. But I do recommend the flautas or the pork sliders

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas

sJODSnfD-1ruRjW586OVpg.text: This place reminded me of Bel Air back here in Wisconsin.   We were staying at the Hard Rock, so our bigger group decided to meet up at Pink Taco before heading to the strip.  We were all pretty hungry and sat down to delicious and complimentary chips and salsa that we munched down within minutes. To our surprise, they refilled them for us 3 more times!  Most of us ordered the 3 taco dinner.  I had the fish, shrimp and pork.  The pork was my least favorite (relish was too sweet); however, all the ingredients were fresh and I was full on just 3 tacos - no rice or beans.  One person in our group ordered a pink taco and wasn't impressed.  A little pricey (but typical for Vegas) and slower to get our meals but otherwise no complaints.  I'd go back!

xQKlrVO_pHLNE116GopWNw.text: Came here for brunch and ordered breakfast tacos, which came on the claim-to-fame pink tacos (prepared in house) with scrambled eggs, black beans, cheese, pico and avocado. I added a side of guac ($1) and lots of salsa and hot sauce. The dish came with a side of something (maybe jicama?) that was crispy and fresh and had a sweet heat to it. No homefries, but I stole some from my friends so can attest that they were crispy and flavourful!  We drank coffee because it was morning(ish) and the costs of the cocktails here were a little extreme. They were big comforting mugs of coffee that kept coming, so that was nice. We sat on the patio by the pool and watched three different kinds of birds go insane stealing all the leftover tortilla chips (complimentary) from tables as soon as people got up. They swooped so low they almost hit us each in the face at least once. It was quite entertaining. The pigeons in Vegas make the ones back home in Toronto look like doves. And I have never seen our sparrows behave in such a scavengeresque manner. Vegas really does bring out the worst in everybody doesn't it? haha.   Anyway, I love the dirty, dry humour of this place. Staying in Hard Rock, I was greeted to the inappropriate but welcome messaging each day. A fave said, "Where pink tacos are not just a phase in college!" Do it up. Get your pink tacos. You're in Vegas after all!

GCsqt8_FD7FoZAddkZDGXQ.text: Awesome chile verda.  Chip is and salsa was great.  Definitely coming back when I'm ba k in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K2Uhg8NjlOMu3rXG85PgCA.text: We ordered the pink tacos. They were beyond yummy. I make my tacos with fried corn tortillas and everyone loves them. These went one step further with homemade tortillas. Just incredible. Highly recommend!

sXii3X_7U29zg8P1KWTOng.text: This was inside the Hard Rock hotel where we stayed for a conference. Not many choices in that hotel especially when most are booked due to the conference and we can't go too far.   I've had Pink Taco in LA and felt like it was so much better. In vegas, the lines go out the door but there were so many empty tables so either they need to have more kitchen and table staff or they just need to get people seated more quickly! We just walked right in for the open bar seating instead which was plentiful and way quicker.   Ordered the enchiladas with the poblano sauce which was pretty good! Had some guacamole on the side but it was just okay.   Overall the place would be nicer if service was better since the food was pretty okay.

DwPfBNfnp-nelEmJ999b6g.text: The name is Pink Taco and you can actually order Pink Tacos?!?  I loved so much about this place. The ambiance was so cute and so well themed especially for Vegas. Things can get a bit overwhelming or over the top when it comes to Vegas, but they nailed it. I would say a "Day of the Dead" type of theme. Awesome.  Now the food tho..  THE CHIPS AND SALSA! I am picky with my salsa and they nailed it. Best I've had in a long time, and they were not stingy with the portions. I would say the Tacos were a slight disappointment after those chips and salsa. I ordered the Taco Trio which included the house Pink Taco, the pork Taco with pineapple, and the Chicken Taco. Mainly, I thought they were a little plain and I could only tell the difference between the one pork and not the other 2 Tacos.  The trio did not come with any sides, and ended up with a $18 bill with a Dr Pepper and my meal. Kinda pricey but that's Vegas for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XgZfmwz9XtuHKxryoFP1AQ.text: Great customer service. I love their food. I have never been disappointed. I like the al pastor tacos and steak fajita. I mostly love their salsa.

Yb-3eNL-Hm4P0D9X5Awwqg.text: So every time we come to the hard rock we always enjoy lunch at pink taco. We ordered the bacon wrapped jalapeno, and to our surprise the Chile they used was serrano which is different then jalapeno and much cheaper. The upside of that is that's it's spicer but you pay what you don't get. Other then that, the food is good.

PHdtGo1es0DPw8Sz17yocg.text: Great Food. Horrible Service. Not trying to be mean or anything but that's the truth. Hubby and I are staying at the Hard Rock Hotel for a little staycation.. we decided to try out Pink Taco. Heard the food is great here and it was!!!! I had the famous pink taco and my husband had the carne asada entree.  both were on point! To drink I had Sancho's mojito. The food is great but the service was horrible.  for one, we never got our appetizer and it took about half hour for our food. The server was short and inattentive and only checked on us once. Plus it wasn't even that busy to begin with. Sunday early evening and tables were empty around us. Maybe it was just our luck... sigh. What a bad first impression.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H40PCV6TCI1eoQnDA1DxFw.text: Ate at Pink Taco the first night in Vegas after reading that it was gf friendly. I paid 16.00 for 3 dinky lettuce tacos because the corn tortillas were fried in the same frier. I would expect to have more food for what I paid. On too of that the meat was ridiculously salty (the chef must smoke) My husband ordered regular tacos and was sick the rest of the night. The corn tortillas were dripping in grease and even he thought it was over salted. The margarita I ordered was watered down and overly sweet. I did order some guacamole with veggies and that was okay, but that's pretty hard to screw up. The environment is really fun and I like the decor, but ultimately I'm not impressed. Left a bad first impression on the restaurants in the Hard Rock

_PMNjg6l9_Yt00K_Aa9gng.text: Liked the food but maybe the atmosphere was just a little noisy. It's somewhere I'd try again though. Had Shrimp Tacos, very good. Try a mixed drink or beer since wine isn't their thing. Yes I'm a wine drinker & it was just OK. Have the Margaritas instead. Great service & nice staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n3bWRoD1vusyW2FULFENPQ.text: Sat at the bar for a quick bite to eat. The pink tacos were good, not great. The bartender was rude and in a rush to not help me decide. Would probably give it another chance but not sitting at the bar again to have food.

vmAMFvKT5iD7waasJ2ou1w.text: Over priced no flavor waited an hour to get in what a joke I'd never make that mistake again

U4wv2flli9XrzWJCOUKO-A.text: At Pink Taco the decor is interesting, I think of a down in Mexico City barrio dive bar feeling they're trying to give you, it almost works. But hey, we're in Vegas. It does give you something to look around at. At HRH, the whole place isn't busy, even on a holiday Saturday night, we had no wait to be seated. Waitress was nice enough, she checked on us several times, didn't speak Spanish though. We tried the Pink tacos. My wife, who's from northern Mexico, says that these type are from the south. I'm not sure how to describe them other than, they're not your typical street tacos that we know here in the states. I was thinking they were some fusion thing. The food plates seemed more upscale than how I described the barrio decor feeling. The chefs took more care in the presentation. After being at Tacos El Gordo earlier, this was a totally different feel. Chips and salsa were good. The cost- a typical sit down restaurant meal $55 for two with tip. Just have the tacos and water- $35.

Mw9gefdXka_BEpyNcZovtA.text: The Taquitos are BOMB!!!! Service was fast & Drinks were good  Bartenders were very nice and quick.

QWxIhMQjBMFrBNMLCKpJmA.text: I didn't have high expectations for this place and I was completely wrong!  We ordered the guacamole sampler for starters and it was delicious.  Our lunches and margaritas were also excellent and the atmosphere was great.  We sat outside and the art was great and the little birds were adorbs!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IMYA3jwpKxiv1wn3O4RB8Q.text: My husband and I come here often but brought our children here for the first time a few days ago. They loved it! We ordered some guacamole which came in a generous size. It was more then enough for all of us. The chips were salty, warm and delicious and the salsa was a great flavor. We all ordered different kinds of tacos. I also ordered a side of flour tortillas, yum!  Right when you walk into the restaurant there is an area that is used to make homemade tortillas. This is always fun to watch. Overall the environment is comfortable and colorful. There is a lot to look at. You can also sit out on the patio with a view of the pool. We enjoy sitting outside when it's a bit cooler.  Our server was knowledgeable and fast with bringing out our lunch. Looking forward to coming here again on our next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-H6A8dBl8HPkrhuMkFd0xg.text: Love this place. Second time I have eaten here. Chips are amazing and so is salsa. I had the gringo tacos and my husband had the pink tacos. Both were very very yummy. The decor is nice and the place is clean. Staff is friendly and professional. One of our favorite places to dine in Vegas.

ixkOM1EYqC8B6aUF664yLQ.text: Only a 5 star for my waitress! Host needs working on.. we walked up and there was a chick at the stand while another chick walked up.. not one of them said hi... I was so close of walking out and telling them off.. but it was me and my boyfriend's first night out since his spine surgery.. I was just hoping that our waitress was going to be bad so I could say F this place.. buuuut... Tonya H. really brought great customer service. Even with her dealing with other big parties she still kept a smile on her face and continued to check on us!! It was our first time here and if it wasn't for Tonya we wouldn't have tasted your delicious food!! We will be back just hope the host understands they really do make the first impression!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I would only want Tonya to serve us again!!

JzARocFaTlv7NvfLi4zphQ.text: This used to be my go to place in Vegas pre-husband and children era. I happen to have one of the menus from 2000 that is all velvet, black and pink.  I went in for my birthday last week, and it was more eloquent than I had remembered.  My son fixes up Lowrider bikes, so the ones they have inside were right up his alley.   Our service was good, and the ambiance was casual and fun.    I had the wet chicken burrito and added a side of the mole sauce.  Fantastic!!!    The dessert I had for my bday celebration was the fried ice cream.  They make a fantastic fried ice cream.   Pink Taco is family friendly during the day, and adult friendly at night.  I look forward to cooler weather in Vegas, so we can sit outside near the pool, like old times.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black velvet menu from 2000...
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back of menu from 2000
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ei0z86hbVbMaErO3nLGIVg.text: We ate here twice and the pink tacos are the best!! Margaritas are excellent as well. Fast and friendly service. Will be back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink tacos!
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_-dwmkdkir-0_Mgm4owoMg.text: Really good Mexican food.  My go to are fantastic chicken fajitas, bean dip and freshly made guacamole.  They have fresh from the fryer corn chips and handmade flour tortillas.  Reasonably priced for being in an upscale casino.  Tacos are also very good when I'm not jonesing for the fajitas.

A_2wtnTavnf1t7ex_M-acw.text: We were staying in the Hard Rock Hotel...needed to eat and this was the first place we saw... i'm always hesitant to eat Mexican food outside of Mexico or San Diego...but they had seating overlooking the pool area and for the atmosphere alone, it was worth it.  we were brought chips and salsa ...we asked for some pico to mix with the salsa...they brought it to us...yum yum (unfortunately we didn't know until after we ordered 2 bowls of pico that we would be charged $3 each!) ...that crazy getting charged for salsa! ...ugh  we ordered 6 tacos to share...$19... i had the Pink taco, the adobada & fried shrimp...they are all pretty good...nothing exciting...i wouldn't order them again though..should have stuck with a salad...  had a couple tequila's on the rocks..yum...can't screw that up! haha...  service was good.. atmosphere was good... very convenient... prices were so so... food was so so...  i would return ...but maybe for drinks, and chips & salsa

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lK-NEk0W5Km0RFQbIt9INg.text: I came here for HH. We tried the jalapeno cheese tacos, the chicken tacos and the wings. I LOVEDDD the jalapeno cheese tacos. It was so unique and the cheese was oozing out and a little bit of a kick from the jalapeno. The chicken tacos were a little more ordinary. The wings were also very good - juicy and flavorful. They were fast in their service and so nice. They also had unlimited chips and salsa and they were delicious. In total, our bill was about $21 for 3 people which is pretty crazy!

8AgGKfwtS0118KM9Kdf7dw.text: I stayed at the Hard Rock this weekend for a concert and ate at Pink Taco with my best friend! We sat outside by the pool; it was so beautiful and the weather was perfect! My friend is vegan so we ordered the mushroom tacos with a side of rice and beans. The tacos were beautiful but the smokey flavor of the mushrooms were overwhelming and did not make me want to go back for another bite. My friend and I each ordered our own plate (which came with 3 tacos) and we both only are one of our tacos. The rice and the beans on the other hand were amazing and we both finished them! I also ordered one of my new favorite drinks! It's called "The Panty Dropper". Very fruity and yummy! Lots of sugar but so worth it! I wish I would have taken a picture.. they serve it with a martini glass full of cotton candy and you pour your drink into the glass! So fun :) If I was rating just based off the drink it would be four stars, but I think this place needs to either add more vegan options, or revamp the one they have!

XMC8dHform99JIJOT4vhfQ.text: Excellent service and good food prior to a show at The Hard Rock. Huge serving sizes you could really share. We ordered the avocado and tomato salad, chicken posole, stuffed jalopenos wrapped in bacon, and both the chicken and steak nachos. We could not eat all the nachos. They were so good but enough to stuff 2 off on plate.

peq7o4AcxwxrmyZa5nCX5g.text: Best part of the meal was the chips. My fish taco was not fresh at all. Super fishy tasting. The al pastor on the other had was delicious. Nice environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

arxnwrIzujTv2Rzsg7WcSA.text: We said we were in a hurry and they were very accommodating.  The shrimp street tacos were amazing and I enjoyed the chips and salsa as well.

gYtBJeNaqsa1wOSACiDUyg.text: We came here for a bachelorette/birthday dinner celebration! All of us gals LOVE tacos and Mexican food in general so of course we had to try Pink Taco while in Vegas! We loved everything we got.. Queso Dip , salsa, chips , pitchers of sangria and of course tacos  but the "Pink Taco" we by far our favorite! If you come here you must must try the Pink Taco .. drooling just thinking about it !

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FJfJfN1KyfHkWaJudaZbwA.text: Didn't know what to expect with the name but we had an enjoyable and tasty dinner before hitting the tables.  If you want a lot of food order the burrito.

uaHGDGGZjVXbSHO0WUFWFw.text: The pink tacos's vibe is very nice and the food was great! I tried the tres leche pancakes, loved them. The fried ice cream was the perfect touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cmLgk5ZoV4QePsWZtq9KhA.text: Truly way overpriced horrible sorry but the food was not really worth the price the only thing that was good was the bacon wrapped jalapenos I tried the famous pink taco you can get a better taco from any taco truck in town instead don't try the gringo tacos they tasted exactly like the cheap taco from Taco Bell seriously wow so dissatisfied I guess if you have never tried REAL Mexican food and have no taste buds you might like it  tourists trap for sure

aLVhOgl5F9TJDMf7pVWKLg.text: We ate here twice on on 3 day trip. Happy hour is listed as M-F .  They don't tell you that if there is a concert that day there is no happy hour. Happy hour is also at the bar only, you cant sit at a booth and enjoy the deals.   The food was great both times.

2Xupm33jdb6uxn2cs27_6Q.text: Super cute in this place. The salsa is spicy hot & delicious, the chips were ok. I had fish street tacos & they were great! My husband had a chicken fajita & he said, "that was probably the best fajita I ever had in my life". He also got rice & it was pretty tasty. Oh, my margarita was good, not enough fresh limey flavor tho, seemed like mainly ice & tequila & it was $12 **update~~~we've been here 2 times since this review, not enough servers both times. We sat at our table both times for 5-10 mins before someone asked us what we wanted to drink or brought us chips. Also the food was not hot when it arrived & it was just ok. It's such a cute place, but prob won't go back

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink Taco - Hard Rock casino
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered fish street tacos

wStiAs3_IswI19_RyQuPtw.text: Food was excellent prices ok margaritas tasted like cleaning products worst customer service got there and no one noticed us almost 10 min then were seat and no one else was in front of us then had to wave down Jenny the so called waitress my man had to go get her finally and as I people watched I saw same waitress give everyone else great service so thanks Jenny for your amazing service to the tables around us and completely ignoring me and my man

09TJrVuPU0We78R93x2v_A.text: Eating shrimp tacos and Caesar salad while watching the NBA Playoff. Delicious food and a good vibes. Definitely recommend this establishment whenever in Vegas.

lkRwmrLvcxBHlCElK80QbA.text: Wanted some Mexican food so we stoped at this place. Walked in and got seated right away. As we looked over the menu we were given chips and Salsa. Chips were very crunchy and tasted recently made. Salsa was good and had a nice kick to it. We ordered two drinks to start. I had the michelada and my wife had a Margareta.   Pink taco combo - it comes with the pink taco special that's a tortilla stuffed with black beans, grilled chicken, pickled onions, avocado and salsa de arbol. Accompanied by a cheese enchilada and pork Ribs. The taco was just ok. When you try to eat it, it falls apart and I'm. It a fan of things falling apart. The enchilada was good and cheese and the ribs were nice and tasty.    My wife had the street tacos. 3 tacos on home made corn tortillas. She had the crispy shrimp taco with red cabbage slaw chipotle cream and avocado.  The Baja that came with fish, cabbage slaw, chipotle crema and Pico de gallo. The last taco she had was the al pastor that's rotisserie pork and roasted pineapple salsa. Oh can't forget the side of beans. She really enjoyed the street tacos and her favorite was the crispy shrimp taco.   If staying in the hard rock or around the area give this place a shot. You will like the decor, ambiance and the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink Taco Combo - pink Taco, cheese enchilada and ribs.
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of beans

32DiXN1vaP3mgoqPgPjQUA.text: Pink Taco's rock n roll sports bar/cantina vibe just combines with the overall feel of the Hard Rock Hotel so well.   Great spot to take a break and have a drink. Good happy hour (M-F 3-7pm) at the bar with $6 specials including margaritas, sangria, and 2 for 1 beers. Food specials too with items like grilled skewers and flautas. I had the ceviche and it was bright and citrusy with just a little heat. The fish was fresh and flavorful. In addition, the house made chips are served hot and they are so addictive. It's honestly very hard to stop dipping those warm chips into salsa. So good.   Friendly bartenders and overall cool vibe makes this a great spot to pregame before heading out. They also have lunch specials under $10 too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche and cervezas

YQsWGES8xWkWaroDI1Go3Q.text: I came here just to try a pink taco; you have to right?! Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed. The best part about dining here was the decor and outdoor seating. The weather was great outside! Oh and the chips, salsa, and tortialllas w. queso were pretty good too! But the pink taco itself wasn't anything special. It had a serious lack in flavor... I couldn't finish it. Instead I just asked for more chips and salsa.   I hate that there isn't much else I can say about this place. I would love to come back another time to explore the menu. I've read other reviews where people love their food! If I happen to make another trip out to Vegas, I will give this place another shot!   But for those visiting, don't get your hopes up on this "infamous" pink taco!

mPGYyUiHec4YQvLYS3NLAQ.text: Went to Vegas on a business trip and stayed at the hardrock.. Ate at the pink taco on Monday and Wednesday and both times the bartender was rude and unpleasant to be around... food was decent!

ZhWGtENyZxYpxhrx0Q8m_A.text: Came here when it opened on a Tuesday so we could get a last meal before heading back to NY. We were obviously sat immediately and we opted to sit outside. The waiters were extremely attentive. Since it was taco Tuesday, naturally we went with tacos. Tried the 'signature pick taco'...being a Taco truck enthusiast from NY I wasn't particularly blown away-yet I substituted the chicken for steak. Perhaps it would've been better with the chicken...the steak was pretty dry as well but the flavor was okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pink tacos with a side of rice and beans

9cHkVOJTSPPFlIOR8lC3Dg.text: Meh, just okay. Service was really friendly and attentive and my favorite part of the meal was the piping hot chips and chipotle salsa. My husband ordered one of their brunch skillets and I got smoked mushroom enchiladas. The flavor was overall lacking. We opted to eat outside which they had partially closed off to the pool area with that clear material that looks like a giant shower curtain, but tons of birds had managed to get in. Seriously, I felt like I was eating in an aviary. Their cocktails were good, we ordered a passion fruit margarita that had jalapeno, basil and pineapple, it was really pretty nice.

RtIMwY16x4l7-4iC0Y-L7Q.text: The salsa is ketchup. And I asked for a chevela... I got a bottle beer, a cup with ice in it and a straw. First off who drinks beer through a straw? And who puts ice in the beer?  They lost all credibility as a Mexican restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fE5jrO_Z_JCxdkEdYLvwJQ.text: I was always a big fan of Pink Taco but this time it didn't have the same vibe as in the past.  To start,  I used Open Table to make the reservation and received an email from Open Table that I was a no show meaning the hostess didn't know how to log my visit.  The food was ok, but the traditional Pink Taco dish is now presented as a shared dish instead of an individual meal.  The service was ok and felt that I was always one step ahead of the service.  I'm a local so with all the restaurants in town I'll probably pass on re-visiting Pink Taco in the near future.  Kind of sad as it was one of my favorites.

b4STau-xi1LLbAWCGOzY8w.text: Okay yes....who doesn't really think of YOU KNOW WHAT when they hear Pink Taco??  Anywho, my friends and I stopped in for dinner as we were staying at Hard Rock.  Our waiter was great and very courteous to do 3 separate checks for our party of 5.    I was tempted to get their signature item, the little Pink Tacos, but opted for the carnitas plate instead ($14).  The chips they served were pretty good, the salsa was standard and more on the watery side.  Our food didn't take too long to come out and boy were there lots of chunks of pork on my plate.  I couldn't finish all the food, it was also served with spanish rice on the side and tomatoes and guacamole.  The pork though flavorful enough was a little on the hard side.  We all know that carnitas is supposed to be super tender.  Definitely would have been a 4 star rating if the pork was tender, but it wasn't bad at all and it was served with a couple flour tortillas.  The fajitas also smelled and looked delicious as well.    I'd say that Pink Taco is a decent and affordable place to get lunch or dinner at if you're staying in the hotel.

wEiEopVvTSWv1rYnA7uF5Q.text: Wow!!!! I absolutely LOVE PINK TACO! I love a good margarita!! And the food is DELISH! Plus the bartenders are good eye candy

gBaYV4d05Hov-P4icOlHtA.text: Came here for my first bachelorette party night and was very pleased! Fun, unique atmosphere and great food. Margs are a little overpriced for what you get ($40 pitcher mostly filled with ice,) but overall experience was still very enjoyable. There were eleven of us total and our server (I wish I remembered her name) was so sweet and accommodating. Will definitely go back to try something else (like the pink tacos!)

2ncV8WQC2y-anZ0AvhRThA.text: Great service. Bartenders very attentive for such a busy place. Chips and salsa good and the street tacos were outstanding. Tortillas made on site made it even better!

TaAAXaR6X5hmdB1XKebeQA.text: Really awesome restaurant. Very tasty, very nice portions and I have to say very pleasant service.  We had guests from Los Angeles and we took them here which we tend to do with all our out of town guests.  Go and try the fantastic food!

qeojSyeD5zTOtSSn1jJ_UA.text: Can't believe I forgot to review this when I went in November...  Amazing mojito, thanks to the very awesome bartender there!  I can't remember his name, but both of the bartenders there were super friendly.  I had a big veggie burrito, and it was very very delicious.  Next time I'm at the Hard Rock, I'll definitely plan on coming here to eat!

0Ii2M-UZmvpq-qAO5DjHHQ.text: $17 for steak tacos is pretty steep. I mean, I live in SoCal, so I can get bomb steak nachos for a small fraction of this price. Still, my friend and I thoroughly enjoyed them, and we were in Vegas where everything is more expensive. Since this location was in our hotel, we were totally cool with returning for more food when necessary.

kEHmHJTMyqO4JM2R3kkJ_A.text: This was my first visit to Pink Taco and it was with a group of 12.  The service was good even though WE were a bit rowdy and kept the server running. After all, her tip was already included so we may as well make her work for it!  The shrimp tacos were killer! The Pork Green Chili was just okay. Everyone in our group seemed to enjoy their food and the server was very conscious about getting us out on time to see our show.  I would definitely go again. Only drawback was that the drinks are super pricey!

yPpvr0_dMBvw_e4DKIQ61A.text: Yummy as always !! Very good Posole   And atmosphere! We eat here all the time when a concert is at the Hard Rock and decided to make trip tonight for chips and salsa and something warm to eat ! Drank some Ice Tea and enjoyed our food !!

NRjqmGbEJUsjwpt_x6czUA.text: Poor service. I ordered something to go. When I received my order it was wrong. The young lady proceeded to tell me I ordered wrong. They attempted to correct my order by not making a new one and adding regrilling what was messed up. After paying $20, I then had to pay $1 more dollar for salsa. WOW. Food tasted less than average.

hocxEpoJWShR6CFAN59qIg.text: Service was awful. Took forever to take our order, drinks were left empty over and over again. The busser spilled water on the table, said "oops" and walked away. Ambiance was decent. Food was decent. In short, I wouldn't return.

o_hRMn2QdNUqG-tkYrXQvQ.text: I cam here for lunch one day and found that he Pink Taco was your typical Mexican restaurant.  There are many places just like this throughout Vegas where you can get the exact same food for 75% of the price.  The only differentiation was the guacamole, salsa, and queso trio they offered for their tortilla chips which was quite good.  The main meals were lackluster beyond that.  They had lunch specials but there was nothing exceptionally special about them in terms of price or intrigue.  Unless you are simply craving Mexican, there are many better restaurants in the Hard Rock alone that are better options for lunch.

oevdL1UamqjCPCoIETl-AA.text: It was pretty delicious. Of course a little pricier than it should be, but it was still good. 10/10 would eat there again...if I stayed in the Hard Rock Hotel.

S7nq4hZBoQ1km7btzORc-Q.text: The Hard Rock Casino gives me comps for this place, so I have had several items on the menu. The restaurant is ok, but if I had to pay for it, I would not eat here. The best thing about the Pink Taco is the service has always been good, fast, and friendly. However, all the food is average at best. There are so many great resturants in Vegas to choose from that, unless your being comped, or you just have to have Mexican food and don't want to leave the Hard Rock, I would suggest eating somewhere else.

vAv9PkZ6weYPVb9OJlwLSA.text: Love this place, the decor is half east LA and half little Mexico! Awesome!   Ordered the happy hour specials, taquitos and flautas both were pretty delish! Also happy hour is BOGO on beer and shots woo hoo!

bECbIMS8Ff0APRSzeJYFvg.text: I've eaten here multiple times over the years and have never had a bad experience.  This go around I got carne asada plate and it was good.  Not stand out Mexican food but it does the job when in Vegas.

Jopg0aKe-X6Nm22S_exT6g.text: This place only gets 3 stars in this review because the service was horribly slow.  I came here today for the first time since last summer.  My girlfriend and I were seated on the patio.  We walked out after 15 minutes of not a single server stopping by.  In the past, the food has been okay and everything is pricy.  The real draw here is the proximity to the rehab pool and the ambiance, views, and dare I say, talent.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade tortillas
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

bn5Fe-oZMnXbDG0ivkSiYA.text: I came here because I was craving Mexican food and the name is hilarious!   I ordered the Pink Tacos and the shells are actually dyed pink .  The food wasn't super authentic, but I didn't really expect that considering it was in a hotel/casino and it was called Pink Taco.  The service was great and friendly. If you come here with a group, I would suggest ordering the buckets of beer at $19-$25 for 5 beers.  This is cheap for Vegas drink prices.

1bRmnamB0MGA-xN2XtrifA.text: Terrible service, so-so food, expensive prices! My boyfriend and I are staying at the HR hotel and thought we would have breakfast at the Pink Taco. We got here about 10 minutes before breakfast closed but they said we could still get it. We were sat and after about 5 minutes no one had come to talk to us. The place was almost empty so it seemed ridiculous that we had to wait. After about 10 minutes my boyfriend asked the hostess if we could order our breakfast. She then had a conference with our server who came over to the table and made a really big deal out of our ordering breakfast. I got French toast and he got carne and eggs. My French toast was ok, luke warm. His food was just ok too but the portion was small for the price. The server never checked on us the entire time we ate. It took a long time to get the bill too! The only great part of our experience was the decor. If you decide to eat at the Hard Rock, do yourself a favor, go to Fuel. The breakfast sandwiches are awesome and the staff are super friendly, hardworking and awesome!

kyj-XAc4CUQW62py1gTiDw.text: What a difference a couple of years make!   We came to Pink Taco on Saturday to get a good solid Mexican lunch.   Last time I was here I ordered the Pink Taco and had been seriously impressed.   This time I went with the Fish Taco and thought I got totally ripped off!   Thank God for the Queso dip we got as an appetizer.  In fact that's the *only* reason I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 2.    I'm all fine and dandy with the fuck-you-i'm-a-rocker-and-you're-not vibe everyone was throwing at me.  You're right, I'm not a rocker.  Fuck you too.    That said, I'm here for the food so stop inspecting each other's chiseled bodies and go make me some decent fucking food, alright?!?!

kep8P04F1H3fO9Q0TRRYmA.text: The food WAS great - But suddenly they decided to update the menu.  Happy hour went from Best in Vegas to AWFUL food and BAD drink specials. What the HECK happened?  The turkey chopped salad was amazing, NOW the turkey is completely different and the entire menu has been tweaked.  Dinner was bad and I went to Happy Hour and it was WORSE.  Bartender told me that I could complain to the manager, but Hard Rock really follows up on emails and YELP.  THe entire hotel is dying a slow death - no need to take the restaurant with you!

ewUaJYdeIRrR7Zfzo5xKhg.text: Eh, wasn't impressed. Food quality reminds me of Chevy's, but more expensive. I think chevy's has way better chips and tortillas too.

-f-zFxW5nKpgJWeDczIWZw.text: GET AWESOME! Where can you find an atmosphere like Pink Taco? Where? Um, nowhere. This place has awesome taco's. I love the shrimp taco, it's delicious. The signature home pink taco wasn't too bad.   Becareful not to make the mistake of eating the chips and salsa, your stomach will explode, don't get me wrong, they are good, but save room for the main course. The margaritas are great, when in groups, order the pitcher and CAUTION yourself when pouring, you might spill. Sorry...Carla, you can do better next time.   Oh, almost forgot, keep for eyes wide open...you will see drunks, more drunks, and yourself. The girls aren't bad either. I'm coming here again in September. I can't wait!

CpsV_EtjA0Xedy4wyjJxKg.text: 5 stars for happy hour deals! We go here every once in a while for chicken enchiladas verdes and their chicken tostada salad. The happy hour deals are only offered in the bar area and include menu specials as well as drink specials.   Pros: Inexpensive food & drinks, fun staff  Cons: I wouldn't come here anytime other then happy hour because it is very much a bar with bar food.

R05NPUw2AVF1bCM_SBgrMA.text: My gf & I went to try this place on a recommendation from a friend & this place was really amazing. We shared the taquito appetizer. OMG, the potato taquitos were fn good. If there was a taquito entree I would've gotten that. I had gotten the carne asada plate with the chicken enchilada. Everything on my plate was perfect. It tasted like the best home made Mexican food your mom made. The quacamole you get is to die for. I am definitely coming back. The service was friendly & the waitress were in top of everything

afye3b1uJog62asOlPZ4sA.text: Man, Pink Taco really dropped the ball last Saturday. I was here with a huge party of friends, expecting to have a wild night of margaritas followed by some serious fun at the slot machines. I even gave up my romantic reservation for two at the Paris to share some laughs with the group. Sadly, we all left this craptastic place tired and angry and headed back to our hotels. Thanks for ruining my night, Pink Taco.  My friends asked me to make up some terrible puns to express how horrendous our experience was at this place. Here goes...  *Hairful* what you order. Need I say more?  It was no *enlightening* experience. In fact, we were left *in the dark* about the whole thing. Literally. In the dark on the patio. We had to use the light of our phones to aim our forks in the right direction. Nothing more intimate than eating to the light of an iPhone.  The darkness was a real *buzz*kill. The useless battery-operated candles they gave us lasted about 3 minutes before they set off a high-pitched buzzing noise and then died (except for the ones we threw into the bushes first).  We got a *flush*, but not playing poker... In the bushes next to us, a sudden loud sound of water running was very suspicious. Since we couldn't see anything, theories ranged from someone peeing a heavy stream in the trees to a toilet flushing nearby.  We were the *butt* of someone's joke when they dropped their lit cigarette onto our table from above.  In conclusion, my puns may be awful, but our dining experience was even worse.   They gave us a couple of pitchers of margaritas we didn't ask for and then claimed they "comped our drinks." Uh-huh.  I forgot to mention the food was meh. I didn't get halfway into my chile relleno before a friend pulled a long hair out of his mouth. Aaaaand I'm done.

JxFm4-lT6l3VxHcTjGg8Ew.text: We sat at the bar Thursday at 3pm and we were lucky enough to come across a cool cat named Mike he was the bartender. He's drinks were great and he's recommendations for food were perfect fun way to start off our trip! Do reasonably priced for Vegas! Nice fun vibe at the pink taco!

iTZT6gcCx7G8zQhht4DqsA.text: Loved the Pink Taco!! If you want Great Tex-Mex in Las Vegas this is the right place. If you are familiar with the food at the Hula Hut in Austin, TX it has the similar types of spices and tastes.   The atmosphere is great! More like your in a rock bar that serves great food.   I would come again!  Best Regards, LeRoy Nellis II

jHLvropvC-ry23KIOTS2GQ.text: Really?  $10 for a drink, $12 for tacos......and you want to charge my table 50 cents for some more salsa for my chips?  Good example of pissing off a long time cutomer because my table seemed to like one of the salsas a little better than another........very short sighted.....food was good as always, service so so as always

DI_vhQNKkMqiqcUaWAcZQg.text: First time to the Pink Taco. Was at the Hard Rock so we tried this place. Sat outside on the patio. It was a Thursday night  so it want not too packed. Service was good. Pitcher of Margaritas you cant be that. I did try their signature Pink Tacos(Panuchos) and they were damn good. 3 good size tacos, the pickled onions were a little different but I would order them again

a6l6q3MQ_pSKR3vSL0Suuw.text: Sure, Pink Taco is a west coast Mexican food chain, but it sure does taste better than 99% of the shit in New York. So it tasted wonderful to me.   We went for Happy Hour (4PM-7PM) on a Friday. 2 for 1 beers and discounted appetizers.   The Pink Taco Sampler Platter: Chicken Skewers, Carne Asada Skewers, Corn Tamales, Quesadillas, and Shrimp & Ribs.   Verdict: PROPER  Tachos Nachos: Pretty good. Couldn't even finish the platter with 4 dudes.   Verdict: What you say Hammer? PROPER  Taquitos: Fine, it tasted like Taquitos from Costco, but whatever. I'm on vacation in Vegas and these joints are dipping well with the guacamole son. Pleeze believe it.   Total Bill: about $47 bucks with 4 dudes, over 12 beers, and 3 large appetizers. Jigga what? Jigga who?   I'd def. come back to their happy hour.   p.s. - we saw a drunk girl fall off her bar stool and pass out on the floor. quite entertaining. they had to get a medic. it was only 5PM too.

Z5vpkMwg6rZDoj6VAUu-5g.text: other then being super loud, it was freekin awesome. the food is sooooo good! would deff reccomend for anyone. YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 tiny tacos

OgY8SEQptjwE74zUYAOAEQ.text: Armed with a fist full of dollars a couple buddies and I stumbled into the Pink Taco wondering what the talent would look like in this place and WTF?  This is a Mexican food place? Good thing we were hungry !!  Sure, it is not an "authentic" Mexican place, but ummm, you are in Las Vegas right? Show me one thing here that is authentic and I will hand you that fist full of dollars I showed up with !!  I was pleasantly surprised with my experience here. Chips and salsa showed up promptly, the drink order was a close second and the guacamole was very good. I enjoyed the shrimp tacos (friend shrimp) and my buddies enjoyed their meals as well. Everything served had a very solid showing and the prices were reasonable.  Why 4 stars?  We sat in the open air patio in the back and enjoyed the oasis away from the mob scene found just outside in the casino. What a great way to catch up with some old friends and I am pretty sure one of them will know how to get to Sapphires anyway.

FYwpJs4PTRLiv98N5yIMWg.text: There wasn't much of a crowd on a Monday night, which was kind of a bummer, but the staff was awesome and friendly.  Happy hour with skinny margaritas ROCKED.  Not much I could eat on the happy hour menu being gluten intolerant, but we still had a great snack and fun, tipsy time.  Will definitely return!

RwRLhc_jGMS8hS1fepUP0A.text: Pink Taco is definitely all you think about when dining here on a Sunday.  The Hard Rock Hotel's big pool party Rehab is on Sundays, and one could get super distracted by all the beefcakes and silicone filled ladies prancing around in their little tiny suits, some with the camel toe that gets your imagination working, and the name of the restaurant then holding some personal meaning.  I did not actually have the pink taco, I ordered the shrimp tacos, and they were delightful.  The chips were home made, fried in the kitchen,  and the salsa was of three varieties, so i could mix and match to make my taste buds curious.  Pitchers of margaritas flowed into the glasses, and one of them even poured onto the table.  The waitress was so kind that when she saw a certain yelpers clumsiness with her pour, she actually replaced the spilled margarita, without us asking.  Our table for 12 was set us super fast, and I'm pretty sure everyone was satisfied with their meals, as well as with the distractions of the scantily clad diners.  This was the least expensive meal I had in Vegas, but never felt like it was a "cheap" meal.  I forgot to buy my "I love Pink Taco" underwear, but maybe I'll pick up a pair the next time.  I would definitely return here.  Maybe they will open a sister restaurant somewhere in Vegas called the Roast Beef Curtain.... they could specialize in sandwiches, and not pseudo-Mexican food.  Just an idea.

fvzhCqP17sQK9CVNI50ffQ.text: One of my favorite LV meals.  Skip the tables and line, just sit at the bar.  The service is fantastic, the bartenders super cool and you can get the full menu.  I love the sweet corn tamales.

ECT8Wuuh8nRFQ3Ehuufokg.text: Not bad Not bad. Our server was really fun and nice. We got SOOOOO MUCH food because we had our meal comp'd by a friend.   I didnt like the shredded pork tacos much. Fish tacos were BOMB! Nachos were BOMB! I cant remember what else I ate cuz I downed a few beers but I remembered it was BOMB.COM!

ak-GmEw0__QLw_4Oq9tDQw.text: Think Hooters meets Chilis, and you will get a sense of Pink Taco.   This is a formula restaurant that try's to appeal to young men who drink a lot and like Mexican food, and the young woman who are GFs, wives, or looking to be either that follow the men here. Just like hooters is an Owl, Pink Taco is an actual taco dish and not a sexual innuendo. (Yeah, right!)   This is the first location, inside the Hard Rock Casino and Hotel, established in 1999, followed by Scottsdale, AZ and this year in Los Angeles, CA. They are planning to open in San Diego and Huntington Beach in the near future, but had problems with the name  in trying to open up a second Scottsdale location. (They should have tried Tempe!)   The food isn't bad, actually, and the all female hostess/wait staff doesn't wear pink shorts and t-shirts like you would find in Hooters.  The food is better than Hooters, which isn't saying a lot. I tried the chicken and cheese enchiladas, which came with finely shredded chicken stuffed into 3 enchiladas, and covered with half green and half red sauce (my choice) and covered with baked cheese. Rice and beans came on a side plate, all for $12.50 during lunch. Chicken Tostada was $10.75, and the Steak Burrito was $12.25. Soft drinks were $3.00   This could be a fun place to go with your friends when a little drinking and humor are perhaps more important than the food you eat. My buddies come here to sit on the patio and see the hottie and groupie wannabees in their bikinis sun bathing by the pool, while thinking of eating a Pink Taco.

ClGrByG6eU8UHO4jsDQAWw.text: horrible horrible horrible  staff us rude food is terrible n drinks are watered down do not go!!!!!!!!

fotMCGf9h99Nfn6cK2qR6A.text: I was working at the Hard Rock Hotel for five days and ended up eating at almost every establishment there.  The service at Pink Taco was terrible! I was placing an order for take out and the girl at the counter was so rude. She acted as though I was really bothering her and that I was stupid. This is completely unacceptable.  The food at Pink Taco was alright. Not terrible, not that good either. I had the Baja Fish tacos. The plate included three street sized tacos, rice, and beans.  The tacos tasted fine, but the fish inside was measly. Also, the texture on one was totally overcooked and tough.  If you can, skip this place. There are better options at Hard Rock (e.g. Culinary Dropout, Nobu) and much much better options at other hotels.

q4vly44L058iPHGl2Hwg6w.text: Went during happy hour (4-7).Everything was super fresh. A list of appetizers are only $6. The portions are large enough for an entree. Beers are BYGO and there are other drinks on special for $6. The free chips and salsa were good and it was fun to watch them make the shells fresh.

LoQ_4__LxXpaZnyJrpVP7g.text: I came here for the advertised Cinco de Mayo specials that were not available. The meal ended up being very expensive and the meal itself was just as poor as the pricing. The only thing I liked less than the watered down margaritas was the taste left in my mouth after paying $10 for each of them. I had a regular margarita and decided to go for the cotton candy martini hoping it would be better but was not impressed. Overall, the experience was not great. The food was underwhelming and the drinks were appalling.

78Ctt0o5TOMfA73YQ5R42w.text: Visited pink taco for lunch last Saturday , took some friends that came from Mexico and we really enjoyed it ,Food was great , I had the combo with shrimp enchilada , shrimp taco and skirt steak! Bravo , it was delicious. We had great weather so we sat on the patio . Manager Ian was attentive , great  service , oh of course awesome margaritas !!

27hHy1-9tbLT7fhYHV4ilg.text: Fun Mexican joint in the Hard Rock, I really like the chips and salsa they serve. the wait staff is always friendly and the gift shirts they sell are fun souvenirs to bring home. I always order the mojado burrito here with carnitas and I am never disappointed. I agree with the other reviewers that the sweet corn tamales are a must try, they were so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet corn tamales

upbqWeB_u7nY5QE02s7vMA.text: Came here while on a trip vegas since I was staying at the Hard Rock. The food was very basic as far as Mexican food goes.    They bring out chips and salsa while you wait. There's three different salsas that they bring out with the chips. I personally wasn't a big fan of the salsas, but the chips were fresh and good.  I then ordered the chicken taco which was fair. Definitely nothing special or memorable in my opinion. It was about as basic as tacos could be. It lacked any special flavor and felt more like take out.  This is the type of place you come to after a day of drinking or maybe to grab a quick bite before you start drinking. But it's nothing amazing by any stretch. Food is good, but not that good.

QTkAcGU4qb5BNEqPxrYLzA.text: Maybe if you go to the actual location its not as pathetic but we were at a concert at the pool at the Hard Rock Casino and Pink Taco was selling Street Tacos for $3 the size of a newborn baby's fist. Not only were they tiny but they were pretty gross, the chicken and the steak.  Perhaps the little stand had it backwards. Instead of selling Vodka soaked Watermelon for $9, beer for $8 and Ant-Man sized tacos for $3....They should have sold beer for $1 and Vodka drenched watermelon for $3 to get you drunk enough to actually enjoy those $3 tacos.

xVXDeEG6wT6NwLwiqxNxHg.text: Honestly, I came here purely due to their sexually suggestive name. Pink Taco...hehe hehe hehe. The food was alright- I mean, it's not authentic Mexican and don't be fooled into thinking such either. Of course I ordered the "Pink Tacos" but I was kinda bummed the shells weren't hard shells- it would have totally fit the name. Props to the handmade tortillas though...  Come here just so you can say I ate at the Pink Taco...buy an inappropriate tank top while you're there too!

gq1EoerzQANhRtfneCfxUQ.text: Another place opens for lunch at Hard Rock.  Service: good! Very friendly  Food: I don't eat taco, so the only thing I can order from the manuel is grilled salmon and veggies. Salmon was fresh and nicely made, but the veggies were all too oily and burnt.  They do have a full bar inside, so if you like taco, like to drink, this is a place to be.

scE0YR3aj8IhGCGvcoHOYQ.text: Terrible service. I saw my bartender once throughout our time there. Won't come back for mediocre ambience, and terrible service.

rH91m2rIWbFP5UWI54PiNw.text: Atmosphere was great, our waiter Mike, was great as well. The problem.... Everything was too oily. There is great potential for there food as a few bites, the ones that did not squirt oil into my mouth, were actually pretty good. See pics for the amount of oil in my pink tacos. We also had the queso which again was good but not great. I don't think it was worth $51 with tip for 2 soda drinks, 1 queso app and 2 plates of pink tacos (each plate had only 3 - 4" small street tacos no rice or beans or anything else). I know we are in Vegas but come on. Even if I was drunk I still would have known it's a rip off!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think they forgot to drain the excess oil from our pink tacos after they come out of the fryer. Sucks.
Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Way too oily!!

VwaTJACmRYRDEMCCk-UQ4A.text: I loved Pink Taco, and I can't wait to go back there soon!  So Hard Rock Casino recently went gluten free friendly, and almost all of their restaurants offer clearly listed gluten free options. We stayed there recently (family was in town), and I was able to eat plenty of food at each of their restaurants.  Pink Taco's service is great, and I love their outdoor patio seating at the pool. Yes, it's loud because Rehab is a noisy mess of fun, but that's to be expected at one of the best pools in Las Vegas.   Even though I could have eaten everything on their menu, I decided to try their carnitas platter with corn tortillas. Now, carnitas can easily become greasy and overcooked, but the platter at Pink Taco was superb. The portion size was perfect, but I probably could have eaten another half portion because it was so good. Everyone at my table who ordered the carnitas (4 out of 6 people)ate every little last morsel of their carnitas platter and continually said, "That was the best carnitas I've ever eaten before in my life." I agree with them in every way.  What's even better is that they have a huge gluten free friendly menu complete with lobster tacos. ahi tuna and shrimp tacos, salad, nachos and queso fundido. There is nothing on that gluten free menu that I would not want to devour quickly, and we will surely be back to Pink Taco soon.

JAQ5kBEulj6aRfDMYNxYtQ.text: Not a bad joint, the pink tacos are pretty good, and margaritas are worth a try, the jalopino margarita will warm the soul, and the nachos are not single serving. I love the ambiance of this place and am glad I came here. Check out the daily special, and you must try the link taco. Yum.

Uvwqs7CUpjXSiUZZFhsw5Q.text: Decided to try brunch, very good and filling meal. A must try is the Molcajete with steak, chicken and shrimp it's like fajitas but better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pink Taco - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mocajete is truly amazing. Awesome flavors of steak, chicken and shrimp.
